Each time we returned, we felt like we had a "home base" at the Jacobs Inn with clean facilities and friendly people. The location is great and I would highly recommend it to fellow travelers!

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent all round

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff was great the ficitlies where clean and decided for a hostel stay, but the whole week I was there, they also had allowed a school group of about 60 preteens with only a few adults stay at the hostel and if they took over all of the space, the kitchen the common area where you would normally go to meet people, yelling up and down the dorm hallways at night after quit hours. It‚Äôs probably a great stay if you aren‚Äôt thrown into a summer camp as part of your stay. But it was unfortunate

name: Anonymous
comment:
The rooms were fine, I liked the USB charging ports in each bed and the bed curtain for privacy.
 I did not think the bathrooms were very clean and I absolutely hated the fact that I had to press a button in the shower every 20 seconds or the shower would auto shut off. I have never seen anything like this and it was terrible. Couldn't even wash my face.
 The breakfast was very basic. 
 I liked the security getting up to the rooms.

name: hparkes8984
comment: Every member of staff I encountered was really rude. Not just inattentive, which I‚Äôm fine with, but very rude. Totally unacceptable. My biggest problem was with the awful sewage smell in bathrooms, and how hot the room was with absolutely no way to cool off. Comfy beds, quiet, the terrace, lots of showers and hot H2O make the hostel pretty nice.

name: alice40491
comment: Love Jacob‚Äôs Inn, favourite hostel in Dublin! Will stay again for sure!

name: smonney2867
comment: More options at breakfast

name: Celeste_stratton5314
comment: staff went above and beyond at all out questions and concerns. (we have some other guest that smelled very bad and they moved us and said they would look into it and even accommodated my father for a bottom. bunk since he is 60 yrs.) very clean and good atmosphere to meet people, I ended up watching movies with people and getting to know them that way. breakfast is also good but go early to ensure you get the best selection, would suggest you stay here. very quiet and clean!

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel in Dublin close to the bus station and trams with comfy beds and good facilities. Wasn't much in the way of atmosphere but was only there for one night so may be better normally.

name: JoDavis675766
comment: Good central location. Friendly, helpful staff. Good atmosphere, but Undisturbed sleep

name: meganbauer0148243
comment: A good and welcoming place! A four-person private room worked very well for us. The room and bathroom were clean. You need to keep the windows open to not get too hot, but the streets are a little noisy (it is in the city, though). Breakfast is fine but super simple. The place is near public transportation, and it‚Äôs an easy walk to the other side of the river. The staff had good pub suggestions. No deal-breaker flaws, but pretty basic hostel, though we‚Äôd stay there again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Clean and comfortable hostel ideally situated in central Dublin. Stayed in a pod which made for a very good sleep. Would happily stay there again.

name: shannonm865955
comment: I stayed in an 8 person dorm. It was a nice place, room was decent size. My biggest issues were the fact that the window opened only very slightly and there was no AC, which I know is usually not necessary in Ireland, but we were there during a heat wave, so having the window be able to open more would‚Äôve helped immensely. That and the doors have springs on them to make them close, but this causes them to slam shut, loudly.

name: bjoggiscorpion3879
comment: excelent location great vibe and comfy beds loved my stay would stay again

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location, clean and tidy shared spaces and helpful staff. Unfortunately other guests in my dorm were inconsiderate of others sleeping (despite acknowledgement of quiet hours). Also, after check out I noticed I was covered in bites- pharmacist review confirms bed bugs. Overall, rather disappointing experience- wouldn‚Äôt stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved the free breakfast

name: samazing711
comment: Overall, not too bad. Only complaints were my outlet didn‚Äôt work in my bed and it was overwhelming hot at night. Common area was nice and clean. Simple free breakfast was a nice way to start the day before grabbing more food. Walking tour is convient for a first day activity. Staff was helpful.

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff was very helpful and nice. The room was stuffy and even with the window open it got hot and smelly. The hostel was full of families and younger people so if that isn‚Äôt your scene then maybe consider another hostel

name: Anonymous
comment: Overall, the hostel was okay. It has everything you would want and need. Though, there are signs about the rooms being set to perfect temperature, and if you would like it to be changed - contact the front desk and they would accommodate you. Unfortunately, that is not the case. My partner and I stayed in a private room, with one big window that you can only crack open so much. It got extremely hot in the rooms and the building in general. The staff was also not very welcoming. Nor helpful.

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed at Jacob's Inn while attending a conference. The location is excellent, with easy access to trains and buses and at walking distance to all point of interest in Dublin. Lots of supermarkets and coffee shops around the area as well. Staff members and kind and very helpful. Two suggestions: 1. Change the shower system. Pressing a button every 60 seconds to get water to save water... at least make it longer; 2. Get ready for heat waves in Dublin. The room was stifling hot and no AC or fans

name: caseynnuckols1856
comment: Loved the beds, great internet. Most of the staff was crazy helpful, but there were a few that led me astray a few times- very frustrating. Would stay again, although I would recommend other cities in Ireland over Dublin.

name: rebeccahedmunds3858
comment: Great staff

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn is centrally located, about 1 minutes walk from the bus station (Busaras) and is exceptionally clean. The kitchen is well fitted and has enough room. I will definitely stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: pretty good. Location is out of the way and not super central though. Staff is decent, breakfast is just cereal or toast. The rooms are very hot with only a very small crack of a window to open.

name: staracat3388
comment: Great place, although the room was stuffy. Took a 16 bus to a bus stop near Trinity College, and from there it was a 20 min walk (with luggage and everything). The other buses might've taken us closer, but those costed 3-4 times more. There is great food all around the hostel, which was a plus (the Thai place across was just amazing). Helpful staff, the bathroom looked nice + clean and smelled better than expected. Simple breakfast, with juice, muesli, cornflakes, milk, bread, jam, butter.

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved this hostel. The rooms are large, modern, and the pods were a definite plus. You have to keep pressing the button in the shower for the water to stay on but it wasn't a big deal. Would recommend and definitely staying here again on my next trip to Dublin. Cheers to the staff for being so friendly!

name: hcahillap6336
comment: Amazing place to stay. It was our first hostel and I was so comfortable there. The staff was extremely helpful with all of our questions (and there were many) and I felt extremely safe and secure. I would recommend to anyone going to Dublin

name: ciaranwhite13423444
comment: Very impressed with place. Everything works. Power sockets in each bed and good sized storage cages for each bed in dorm. Helpful staff and great value for money

name: jackkeatings9969
comment:
Brilliant location (pleasant 10-15 min walk to temple bar) with helpful friendly staff who had a bunch of great local tips.
 
 Rooms were ok - expensive for a relatively Spartan room (we went with private double with ensuite) but Dublin is just that expensive on a summer weekend, so better value than a lot of other options with similar locations. Close to a rail bridge which didn't bother us but if you are a light sleeper I'd ask for a room on the other side of the building
 
 Felt very secure

name: jacobw93096
comment: nice place to stay

name: ashleeey10
comment: Great time, great way to meet new friends. Friendly place. Very clean

name: Anonymous
comment: I loved that the beds have curtains. Location is good and staff is nice. Breakfast was very basic. I would stay here again.

name: elainesmorrow7993
comment: Enjoyed my stay in the hostel. Beds very comfy, rooms were clean, shower was nice and hot. There was no hand soap in the dispensers in the communal toilets though.

name: rmacken2
comment: Overall a great stay! The luggage storage was awesome - you could lock up your baggage individually. Nice that they offered breakfast in the morning - nothing fancy but toast and juice is good enough for me. The beds were comfy, and I enjoyed the privacy curtains. Lots of space to lock up your luggage in the room under the bed. Wifi worked well throughout the hostel. Convenient location to bus station and short 10 min walk to O'Connell street. Would definitely stay here again!

name: troydallan699
comment: We cannot say enough about our wonderful stay at Jocob‚Äôs Inn. Thanks for a terrific experience. We loved it and our children loved it. We hope to stay with you again.

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff was incredibly nice and helpful upon our arrival to Jacobs Inn. The bathrooms were clean and even in a 12 bedroom dorm I still felt like I had my own space with the ability to draw the curtains on the bed and lock my stuff in the lockers directly below the bed. The USB charging ports in the bed were convenient and allowed me to not have to break out my converter to charge my electronics. We did the pub crawl they advertise and it was very fun and we got to meet other visitors!

name: Anonymous
comment: My stay here was wonderful. Clean rooms, wifi, curtains and lockable luggage storage under the beds. Friendly staff and great facilities.

name: Anonymous
comment: I've stayed at the Jacobs a couple times before, and it's always a great experience! Staff is super friendly, rooms are clean, and the kitchen area is awesome. Thanks for another great stay!

name: abauer397036
comment: Great location close to airport shuttle stop and tram and train stations. Lots of security to use your key card to swipe in, so I never felt unsafe. Every hinge in the place is a bit squeaky‚Äîthey could definitely use some oil on the door and locker hinges. Other than that great atmosphere and helpful staff. Go on the pub crawl or walking tour to make some new friends!

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved everything about my stay here - Clean kitchen, the modern look, great wifi, organized in all aspects, ensuite bathrooms for mixed bed rooms, plus game room and other fun amenities. Was able to check my luggage as well. Best part were the staff - they were friendly, fun and VERY helpful! Can't beat the location either - close to bus station and Connolly Station. HIGHLY Recommend!!!

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved it. Really impressed by the rooms and beds and the mattress was really comfy. A+++ for this place

name: mchris7649
comment: Great hostel. Really safe. I stayed in the deluxe "pods" and it was fantastic. Lots of privacy, I got great sleep. Breakfast is included and the roof deck is beautiful, although I only went up there to look. Easy to walk all around Dublin from the hostel location. Would definitely stay here again!

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed at the Jacobs Inn for two days and I had an absolutely wonderful stay. I was able to easily buy a padlock for fairly cheap as well as rent a towel. The facilities are very nice and in a fantastic location and feel really quite safe! I stayed in a room with 11 other people and it was totally fine! The cage underneath my bed was broken so it didn't stay open without me holding it open, but it wasn't a huge deal and didn't affect security. Both the walking tour and the pub craw were great!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great facilities and easy to get to and from the airport. Rooms were good too with good privacy if needed. Atmosphere was a bit dull though, but apart from that I‚Äôd stay here again

name: makarielder
comment: I liked this place! I was only going to Dublin for two nights and needed an easy place to stay. It‚Äôs right next to a nice pub and I made several friends. Easy walk to several locations (Book of Kells, St Patrick‚Äôs Cathedral, Dublin Castle, and many more). I would stay here again. Breakfast in the morning was nicely provided, and key cards give you access in the building and to your rooms. Security is 24/7 and you can also book a shuttle to the airport at the front desk.

name: lidijavel
comment: Was impressed by the cleanliness. 10 bed room was quite spacious and liked the privacy of the curtains on the bed. Location was okay but a little far to walk to temple bar area and trinity college... but liked how it was close to bus stops and trams. Washing machines didn‚Äôt work and this wasted a lot of my time (and money). Breakfast was simple but I think should have a few more options for vegans (I.e soy milk and non dairy butter).

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs was very clean and secure, comfortable beds and nice rooms, locker baskets under bed. Extremely close to the train station and bus if you are on the move. This hostel is very large and accepts families, so keep in mind there can be a lot of children. This hostel wasn‚Äôt my favorite for being social with other travelers or for atmosphere, but was clean and comfortable, and great for our purposes. Appreciated the bed curtains and ensuite room.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location. Just keep in mind it houses people of ALL ages so it can be good and bad. It‚Äôs a very large hostel so it can sometimes be harder to meet others as well. Staff is very helpful and friendly!!

name: reannemedill
comment: First Hostel stay and was really please. Loved the bag lockers under the bed and curtains over each bed for extra privacy. Would definitely stay again.

name: carlygallegly7211
comment: Clean and safe, right near the rail station. They were completely out of towels the night I arrived after a day of hiking and still didn't have towels in the morning so it was difficult to shower. The hair dryer in the women's bathroom was also out of order. Staff was somewhat helpful but not excellent especially in dealing with the towel situation. Overall bed was clean and comfortable. Lots of kids staying in the hostel that were very loud.

name: samt1943
comment: I stayed one night before flying out of Dublin airport, it ended up being very convenient. Bus to the airport was less than a block away and the front desk even sold tickets for the bus.

name: Anonymous
comment: My third time back at this hostel. Perfect for a quick stopover. Not very social as it is huge. The only bad thing are the pillows. So awful. Other than that a great stay again

name: meganmurray10247522
comment: Very nice hostel. Nicest bathrooms I've seen at a hostel.

name: ariquelle
comment: A great hostel for your time in Dublin. Each bed has curtains and it's own plugins, which is a big plus. Great staff and facilities. Fully recommend it.

name: mwgrosdidier
comment: We loved our stay here, the staff was super helpful and even went out with us on the pub craw. We are young and wanted to go out but this place would be good for all ages. Very clean, nice security bins under the beds for your stuff. Overall, recommend staying here.

name: sarahfaulkner926409
comment:
LOVED this hostel, one of the best I‚Äôve stayed in. Really friendly vibe, staff are enthusiastic and welcoming, location is perfect.
 I stayed in a deluxe room, and can highly recommend! Would deffo stay again

name: Anonymous
comment:
Went this hostel with my friend to stay for three nights, during our first trip to Dublin. The location of hostel is quite great, kind of central not too far from all the turist activity things. 
 Every morning hostel provide the breakfast ( cornflakes and toasts), what is quite cool if you trying to do low cost travel and save some money on brackfast. If you would something more traditional you can find few pubs wich serve traditional Irish food.

name: gabdern5082
comment: The staff here were lovely, and the facilities were great. There was a big commercial kitchen, huge dining room and good wi-fi. The free breakfast was also a plus! The only qualm I had during my stay was with some of the people I shared a dorm with; people seemed to be in and out of the room into the early hours of the morning (which was quite loud). Not a problem if you're after that sort of experience, but something to take into consideration if you're getting up early for tours, flights etc.

name: Anonymous
comment: An alright hostel. Clean and safe, good location but not centrally located. However, during my 2 night stay, there were 3 separate large and loud school groups who checked in. Two of these groups had 14/15 year olds, and they were RIDICULOUSLY loud and until about 1am. Slamming doors and running around. They also overtook all of the common spaces.Had I known that this hostel apparently specialized in large tour groups, I probably would have picked a quieter place to stay.

name: camilasteele
comment: Nice, clean room and bathroom, good location near the bus station and the canal, spacious common areas and kind staff. Would stay here again!

name: nyla_hussain6734
comment: Hands down the best hostel I have ever stayed in! So clean, impressive, comfortable, and state of the art with that kitchen! 10/10 would reccomend to all. The staff is so kind and helpful!

name: caitlinconnor153480
comment: The location was great. It was easy to walk around to all the sites and close to the bus from the airport. Would be great if there was a minimum age limit or the really young groups of teenagers could be put in one area. They were very noisy yelling up and down the hallways at all hours of the night. They were very young and I was surprised they did not require adult supervision to be at the hostel. The kitchen was clean, but the bathrooms could have been better. Breakfast was really good!

name: rgreene11
comment: Clean and close to everything. Staff very helpful

name: tortellini
comment: Jacob's Inn provided a great experience for our first ever hostel stay. The staff was beyond helpful and even went as far as to make sure we had the best Cliffs of Moher experience by helping us choose a company. The atmosphere was very chill and quiet (but not too quiet) and we always felt safe, which is imperative for two young American girls travelling alone. The shower was the only negative of our stay because it does not stay on longer than a few seconds, but overall it was great!

name: gabrieleadorno7186
comment: Great hostel, just beware that they charge the credit card with full amount of your stay 3 days before the check-in.

name: Anonymous
comment: Had a good experience there

name: Anonymous
comment: It was overall okay, but it was extremely loud at night. Also, the beds need to have curtains on all sides because the curtain that is there does not block the lights.

name: Anonymous
comment:
A tight ship.
 Friendly.
 Superbly designed both in terms of the physical plant and the social processes of a good hostal.

name: taylor_houghton669
comment:
This hostel has an excellent location - minutes away from the bus station. It takes about 15 minutes to get to the city centre, which is reasonable. However, I did find that for the facilities and amenities that were included, it was extremely expensive. 
 The staff members weren't very friendly and this hostel was not very clean. I would not recommend this hostel to others.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place. Showers kind of sucked as you had to keep pressing for water, otherwise its a nice place.

name: mlfox8903557
comment: Jacobs Inn was convenient for transport to and from the airport and the city Centre a bit of a hike to some sites but since the city is pretty small it wasn‚Äôt bad at all. The beds and bathrooms were clean and the staff was super helpful. I definitely recommend the walking tour if it‚Äôs your first trip to Dublin. Just a helpful layout of the area to start your trip.

name: Anonymous
comment: I enjoyed my stay at Jacobs very much. Looking forward to visiting again soon.

name: drdebashis3443
comment: Great location , super friendly stuffs

name: emmahunter9739762
comment: Really liked that there was a little curtain and plugs etc next to each bunk, and the staff were really lovely! Kitchen was good too.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best customer service ever. Staff was friendly, showed empathy when my canceled flight to Italy forced me to have to spend another night in Dublin - he even provided me a discounted rate and in the same room/bed. Huge facility and had laundry on premises. Best hostel I've stayed at thus far.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs inn is so great! All the staff are very friendly and helpful, they have lots of great events, and the rooms are great. I stayed as a solo female traveller in a 6 bed mixed dorm and was very comfortable. Breakfast in the morning is simple but we'll done, and the location is superb. I would definitely stay here again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Amazing and friendly staff! They were so kind and helpful. Very chill and easy to talk to. I don't know if it was the time of year I went, but there were a lot of kids and teenagers staying in the hostel. Never really experienced that before. Great location. Pretty clean facilities. This is a very green hostel, so water consumption is controlled especially in the showers which I appreciate, but could get a bit annoying. Wish there were more events to connect the people staying there.

name: mcurrystevens951
comment: Jacobs inn was clean and had very well informed staff, but attracted a strange crowd. Many children were using the hostel and were often very loud. There were no designated quiet common places so finding some quiet time was impossible. The location isn‚Äôt great, about a 20 minute walk from any tourist attraction, but the city was well served by buses and the Tram.

name: kd121594098
comment: Ended up having a room to myself which was great. Bathrooms and room was very clean and open space. Hallways were very noisy and heard a lot of shouting and screaming.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really good place and friendly staff. Very clean as well. But it‚Äôs really far from the city centre !

name: Anonymous
comment: Rooms were nice. Each bed has outlets, a light, a curtain for privacy, and a locker. Ensuite was good size but the shower had a poor design- you have to hold the handle down for water to come out. Breakfast is included, which is nice. Lots of school groups when I stayed who were rather loud, and took over the breakfast room. My first night was three times more expensive than the other nights to the point where the amount I spent wasn't worth the amenities, but it served its purpose for me.

name: Anonymous
comment: Too many doors to unlock, it‚Äôs a bit excessive. Staff are helpful. Location is pretty good, walkable to everything if you‚Äôre willing to walk more than 20min to some. Pretty clean.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Stayed in an 8 person dorm with en suite. Solo US traveler 
 
 Pros: 
 - Security cards required for all entry points 
 - 24/7 reception 
 - Vending machines that take credit/debit cards 
 - Under bed storage lockers 
 - Privacy curtains on beds 
 - Short walk to city center 
 - Light breakfast provided (toast, jam, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, tea) 
 - Close to transit (bus to and from the airport is nearby) 
 
 Cons:
 - Can get a bit noisy
 - Not a ton of atmosphere

name: emma7931
comment: I stayed in a 12 mixed dorm, which was really spacious. There was a power outlet, a lockable bag cage, a light and a curtain on my bed. As well as a big ensuite bathroom too. The WiFi was really good and heaps of space in the kitchen and common room areas. I would recommend staying here, just sleep wearing earplugs.

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed in two different rooms: in a 6-bed mixed dorm and in a12-bed female dorm. The mixed dorm was AWESOME. It's a fallout type bunker with great automatic lighting, comfy beds that are super private and big lockers underneath the bunks that make absolutely no noise. It was by far my best hostel experience. The 12-bed dorm however was older with the classic metal bunks. It would have been okay if I hadn't been introduced to the bunker ones first. Breakfast: coffee, tea, juice, toast, cereal

name: menonsid24300
comment: Really fun and cool hostel. Rooms were nice, bathrooms were clean, employees were friendly. Great value considering how cheap the hostel is. Only issue is it‚Äôs quite a bit far from the rest of Dublin so you feel kinda removed from everything else. But I‚Äôd still recommend it.

name: Anonymous
comment: I had a great time at Jacobs Inn. The area was just a little outside the city centre but there is a bus station and train station on the same street that made it easy to get to the city centre and back. If your not into transportation it‚Äôs about a 15 minute walk. The dorm rooms I found had the best privacy. The staff was very friendly, I was able to drop off my stuff early and you can purchase a lock if you forget one. Overall I had a wonderful time would recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff were amazing while at my stay, very helpful and told me great recommendations. Only down side was being a solo traveler and not really getting to meet people in the hostel, but once I signed up for the pub crawl it was a great experience. Temple bar is about a 10-15 min walk from the hostel, or about $10 Euros to taxi. Beds were nice and the place had great security! Would recommend to anyone for a good place to stay while in Ireland.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location, friendly staff, and comfortable beds, what more could you ask for? I really appreciated the large, open kitchen space, the cleanliness of the bathrooms and the privacy curtains around the beds. My only complaint was the hostel was completely overrun with young kids on a school trip during my stay. And when I say overrun, I mean there were hundreds of them. I think I met maybe five other adults while I was there which made socializing as a solo traveler pretty difficult.

name: Anonymous
comment: A well run hostel with friendly and helpful staff. The facilities were great, and we appreciated the free breakfast. The location was really convenient for us as it was so close to the bus terminal, and shopping strip along Talbot street.

name: Anonymous
comment: Clean, beds had curtains, and within walking distance of everything I wanted to see/ do. What more is there to ask for?

name: Anonymous
comment: I only stayed here for a total of 2 nights but the atmosphere was perfect and the rooms were better than any hostel I've stayed in before. Loved Jacobs Inn!!

name: mbwPiazza1692
comment: The entire hostel was filled with high school students (age 16) who swarmed the common areas. It created an atmosphere which was negative for meeting new travelers.

name: kathrynmosby7657
comment: Overall I good place to stay. It‚Äôs a little further from the temple bar and castle areas but it was clean and staff were helpful. When I stayed here there was a lot of school aged children so it was difficult to meet people unless you went on the pub crawl or walking tour.

name: hstiff866212
comment: There were multiple CHILDREN‚ÄôS Rugby teams staying at the hostel when we were there. They were absurdly loud at all hours of the night and morning, running up and down the halls, slamming doors and screaming. It was complete chaos in the dining rooms, with very little space to sit and eat. The other people staying in the mixed dorms were very inconsiderate and loud. This was not a pleasant stay in the least and I would highly discourage anyone who needs sleep from staying at this hostel.

name: dougrgreer1850
comment: All around nice place to stay and fairly social too (game room, bar crawl, dublin tour). Little overboard on security.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place! Very well taken care of and efficient. Greeted by a large lobby with art on the walls, tall ceilings, and a lounge area with some games. Checking-in and checking-out was a breeze as well. Curtains on the bunks and lockers below really help to ensure privacy and security. The kitchen/cafeteria got hectic at times as can be expected when there's free breakfast. Would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Dublin!

name: Anonymous
comment: Overall, I was pretty disappointed with this hostel. The biggest issue is that there is no age restriction so it caters to old people, families with young children, and gigantic school groups with hundreds of children. Because of this mix, it destroys any possibility of a proper backpacker atmosphere. Second, it's impossible to move 10 meters in any direction without having to use your key card 16 times to get through 40 unnecessary doors. Conclusion: fine as a crash pad, but wouldn't recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel to explore Dublin. Really clean, awesome washrooms, and perfect location. Hostel welcomes people of all ages so during my stay I found it filled with little kids and many old people. Nothing wrong with that but meeting people your age will depend on luck. Overall it was perfect for what I was looking for and I had an amazing time in Dublin!

name: Anonymous
comment: Take advantage of the free walking tour, and the pub crawl if you're interested in stuff like that.

name: Anonymous
comment: Location was about a 15-20 minute walk from the Temple Bar region but it was worth the walk in order to stay in a nice hostel. Security is super tight but at least you know you and your things are safe! All in all, great experience, would stay again!

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed for one night before departing Ireland. Everything was clean, secure, and the people were friendly. I also liked the privacy drape and personal outlets.

name: Anonymous
comment: I loved Jacobs. Its friendly, fun and perfect for young adventurers! Everything is clean and tidy and the rooms have plenty of space, I would recommend to all and without a doubt would stay here again.

name: ciaran-king7898
comment: Excellent hostel, blew my mind how good it was for the price.

name: Anonymous
comment: The elevator was very slow. Other that's that it was perfect.

name: hrsh09295542
comment: It was wonderful experience being there. Good atmosphere, friendly staff and good facilities.

name: Anonymous
comment: A lovely hostel in a great area! Generally a 10-15 minute walk to all the local bars & locations and very accessible by public transport. The rooms were large and WiFi reached to the rooms which isn‚Äôt something that can be said for all hostels. There is a USB port plug in each bunk which was so handy. My only complaint was that there were no plugs in the bathroom, and the hair dryer they have for you to utilize don‚Äôt work. Also a very secure location!

name: Anonymous
comment: Only stayed here one night, but everything was perfect. Ended up having an entire 10 bed room to myself! Probably rare, but was great for my last night of months of traveling. Everything was very clean and the location was perfect!

name: gbucello6870
comment: The staff were friendly and the hostel has a modern-looking interior. Very pleased with the free breakfast and coffee in the lobby, and I was also happy to see that the bunk beds have privacy curtains and charging stations for USB devices and UK plugs. Dublin is a compact city, so the hostel is close to many of the main attractions but is also in an area that isn't constantly swarming with crowds, so you can have peace and quiet as well.

name: Anonymous
comment: What a great experience to stay here in Dublin. Everything is well equipped and comfortable. I will recommend to my friends.

name: sarahwirnsperger5215
comment:
Absolutaley loved our stay at jacobs inn. Had the best hostelroom i ever stayed in. Very private with the cartoons, feelt like sleeping in a cocoon.

name: sylmar18

name: joaogodamaral6650
comment:
love, love this place, very happy I chose Jacobs....
 
 Gabe

name: Anonymous
comment: I would definitely stay here again. Facilities were great, and appreciated the curtains + usb plug + light in every bunk. Even though there were a ton of other beds, it still felt spacious and not claustrophobic. Felt secure. Good atmosphere and made some friends. Clean bathrooms.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very quiet option a bit away from all the action of Temple Bar. Security was great and the little lounge area allowed for me and my boyfriend to catch up on some homework while on our trip. Everything was extremely clean for a hostel. The showers and facilities in my room were very eco friendly, to the extent that the shower button put out water for about 15 seconds and then stopped. This made for a bit of an annoying shower experience but we made do and I understood the goal. Great experience!

name: Anonymous
comment: I was too drunk to remember the hostelüòÇ

name: Anonymous
comment: We had a wonderful stay at Jacob's Inn this past weekend! We originally booked a 12 bed mixed dorm but upon check in at reception learned that we had been randomly selected to recieve a room upgrade and got to stay in a private room for the whole weekend! This place is perfect for a weekend in Dublin: clean, spacious, nice staff, and the free breakfast is a nice added perk!

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to stay

name: Anonymous
comment: My friend and I had such a great stay, would recommend to all! People at the reception were very helpful and gave me maps + awesome suggestions for donut places, pubs and restaurants around the city. Facilities were good, location excellent and all in all I had a very pleasant time here! Hostel was clean, quiet and got a full night's sleep for both nights I was here. Very happy with this stay!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, can't fault this place at all. We booked a four person dorm as we travelled up from Cork for a concert in the 3 Arena - so this was the perfect location.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's Inn was the perfect place to stay in Dublin! The facility felt very secure and clean, almost like a hotel. The staff was very helpful in providing food recommendations and advice on transportation. The hostel itself was an easy half an hour bus ride from the airport. Being on the North Side of the city, the hostel isn't right inside the tourist chaos of Temple Bar but still close enough to walk to all the main attractions. The free breakfast isn't the best but we ate out anyway.

name: amcgovern
comment: Staff were all very helpful and friendly, gave great advice for places to eat and drink. The hostel was very clean and well run, felt almost more like a hotel. Definitely a popular spot, met a ton of interesting people (pub crawl is well done... 12‚Ç¨ but you‚Äôll probably end up spending a bit more on additional drinks... still a decent value if you‚Äôre looking for something to do for a night.) Overall other guests and staff were very respectful, and I always felt safe even as a solo traveler.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob‚Äôs is an okay hostel overall, but I had a horrible stay there. There‚Äôs no age cap on residents and I ended up in a mixed room that was mostly elderly men while I‚Äôm a young, single female. Other than that, I met some really cool people here and the breakfast was great but the residents in my room made it difficult for me to enjoy my time there. If you have a room full of cool people though, it‚Äôs great for a few nights in Dublin, especially for the price.

name: Anonymous
comment: One of my least favorite hostel experiences I've had to date. This place is run more like a hotel meaning the staff are just there to check you in and out, there are no events except for the paid pub crawl they push, and a good amount of the guests are working in the area. I was in a ten bed and had five much older men in my room, snoring like bears, and they woke up early to get ready to go to work. It was just a very uncomfortable situation and wouldn't recommend for other social travelers.

name: Anonymous
comment: A great placr in a superb location I will be back highly recommended

name: Anonymous
comment: Check in time can only after 3:00pm and kitchen close at 3:30pm, it's not possible to make any food when I arrived in hungry. Location is good, very near by bus station. When I arrived, the room still have some available beds, but the arrange a bed front of toilet door to me the smell not ok.

name: Anonymous
comment: A really nice hostel, lots and lots of activities to do to help meet people and see the city, we did the walking tour which was super fun, also the pub crawl which was great to meet people and we did a day tour to Wicklow mountains which was gorgeous! The location is quite central near the tram and one of the train stations. The rooms and bathrooms were always very clean and you saw staff cleaning them very often which was good peace of mind

name: abbyv149
comment: I met some cool kats at this hostel. The staff was great and the atmosphere was very chill and welcoming. I usually don‚Äôt have a problem with hostels since I stay with 10 people in a room. The only thing was that I was not able to get any hot water for my shower. I took a quick shower with freezing water, haha! So so fun! :)

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel itself was lovely and well equipped but one night reception staff member was very rude.

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed here with a friend as we we're attending a lecture at Our Ladies Hospice. Staff we're really helpful and buzzing with energy on the Friday night shift and full of great recommendations. The room was spacious and the bathroom had a nice big shower and bathroom facilities. However on the second night the toiler could not flush. Beds were comfy with privacy from curtains and all charging points available, as well as own private light. Great free breakfast. Overall joyful stay.

name: bolton
comment: Excellent

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location! Only a 10-minute walk to one of the main drags in Dublin, O'Connell street, which offers many shops, restaurants, and the starting point for many hop-on-hop-off and day-trip tour buses. Such easy access! It is also right across the street from the Airlink Bus Stops, making it so easy to get to from the Dublin Airport. I traveled with 3 children (8months, 6 and 9), and we felt right at home here. Highly recommend for a budget-friendly trip.

name: michellekthompson8190
comment: Probably one of the worst hostel experiences I''ve ever had. The staff were just so rude. When I checked in they were laughing at about how dumb another guest was which made me very uncomfortable. I also had an incident where I misheard one of the receptionists about how to use the laundry and when I came back to clarify both receptionists were very sarcastic towards me, were laughing and trying to make me look dumb in front of several other guests. Would absolutely never recommend to anyone.

name: Tzimisce25
comment: Nice place, good location. The staff is friendly, but slow. There are 3 people at the reception and 1 handles the guests only. This is a huge problem, because it is a big hostel and it is quite crowded. Also, the door key cards, which are extremely overused due to security reasons, and they are NOT GOOD quality, they became broke easily causing HUGE problems. During my 3 days stay and had to change my door keys 3 times, incuding 1 change at the beginning.

name: Anonymous
comment: This was my first hostel and a great experience. They provided linens, reasonable priced and in decent walking distance from most Dublin sight-seeing locations. The push button shower was a challenge but glad making efforts to conserve water. Breakfast was minimal with toast, cereal and fruit. Would suggest the hostel to invest in a reuseable water refilling station. I had to purchase water at local stores (also available in vending machines). Front desk sales bus tickets and excursions.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel. Except the Romanians night shift are awfully not sympathetic. I needed 3 weeks stay. But they chased me because I wanted a long stay. And the manager refused to extend my booking.

name: Anonymous
comment: I got to the hostel on Sunday around 11:30, check in wasn't until 3, but they have a luggage room. Unfortunately the luggage room was full so I had to just hang out with my stuff until I could get into the room. I stayed in a 12 bed girls room - appreciated that the bunks had curtains on them. It was very noisy, but that's kind of what you get with 12 people. It would make it better if maybe the door to the room and bathroom were fixed - they both make terrible noise when opened/shut.

name: sophielou_89726
comment: Stayed at Jacobs for 3 nights. Lovely hostel and super friendly staff - they moved me into another dorm room with no issues after I was placed with 3 older men. Easy walk into the city centre. Bit dodge late at night - if your alone would recommend a cab back. Would stay again and recommend to others. Thanks üëçüèº xx

name: Anonymous
comment: This place was fantastic. It had everything you needed. There were security lockers, curtains for privacy, a friendly atmosphere, free breakfast, and it was secure. The only down side was that the shower was poorly designed so that it flooded the bathroom if you took more than a 2 minute shower.

name: Anonymous
comment: Wonderful hostel when in Dublin! Very friendly and helpful staff, great location, clean rooms and bathrooms, delicious breakfast! I'd recommend staying there.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really great hostel. Loved being able to shut the curtain on my bed and know my bag was safe in a cage underneath me! Would absolutely stay again!

name: MadiPants
comment: This hostel is absolutely amazing and by far one of the best i‚Äôve stayed in. All the facilities were super clean, the staff was extraordinarily kind and helpful, and the residents were friendly. It was close to a lot of great activities and I would absolutely stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Bring an extra blanket , they keep this place cold. I‚Äôm Canadian, I can do cold but this was nuts. Pillows and mattresses have definitely seen better days - wait for one side to go numb, flip, repeat every hour. As mentioned in other reviews, showers are push button activated and only barely warm enough which is definitely a problem considering how cold they keep the hostel. 
 Staff were friendly and helpful with day trip planning as well as pointing us to the best one way tour deals!

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a great hostel. Really enjoyed our stay. Pretty busy place but the rooms are still quiet (snoring aside). You can pay a bit more for a smaller dorm room, my recommendation, or go cheap on a big one. You get what you pay for in terms of traffic and volume. But all in all this property is great and the staff are fantastic. My one suggestion to the property would be to keep a narrower age range in some rooms to help everyone be more comfortable.

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff is informed, super convenient location across the street from the bus terminal, more spacious than your average hostel. Overall great. I was sick and glad I was here and not somewhere else.

name: michellekthompson8190
comment: Average hostel - staff were very rude.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel, dodgy spot.

name: Anonymous
comment: bit of a walk from centre but it's nothing. Great kitchen and staff are lovely! Bed with a curtain is always a plus, good hostel!

name: Anonymous
comment: One of the best hostels I've ever stayed in. Everything is really neat and clean. The beds have curtains, reading lights and chargers. Definitely recommended :D

name: Anonymous
comment: Perfect location in a very clean hostel. Each bed in my dorm had multiple USB and power points at the beds and each bed also had a curtain. Lockers under beds to secure your luggage. The ensuite bathroom was huge and very clean. The kitchen was also very big and well equipped. A really nice stay!!

name: dgr8indi7703
comment: Very spacious and friendly employees. Be sure to bring earplugs because there are many groups of travelers so they tend to be loud. I liked the privacy curtain on the bed. One bathroom in each room, but I used the community shower because it's bigger. The shower in my room didn't have hot water so that's part of the reason I don't shower there. It's quite a walking distance near the city center but it's closer to the train station.

name: Anonymous
comment:
It was great, clean, nice room, the only thing that I can say, which isn't really a negative, was that the guests were mostly teens and early 20s, If I was that age I think this would have been the most fun place I could have possibly stayed, but I felt like an old man at 28. 
 
 The staff was super accommodating after showing up 8 hours early for check in, locking my key in my room, and just generally all super helpful helpful people

name: Anonymous
comment: Totally worth the price! Rooms were huge and the blackout curtains have lots of privacy. Would totally recommend.

name: chill243149
comment: Top notch hostel! Clean, friendly, safe and comfortable. I could not have asked for more! Loved the bed sited lights, plugs and curtains to give you privacy. Have already gone back and stayed there again, will be a repeat customer!

name: Anonymous
comment: Female travelers - if you are staying in Dublin, this is the place you HAVE to stay. I was in a mixed dorm 1 night with 3 other women. Later that night, 2 men showed up and made us all very uncomfortable. Myself & another woman went down to the front desk to explain the situation. They were kind & listened to our issue, & gave us options. They took our complaints seriously & remedied the situation immediately in a way that made us feel safe and comfortable. I HIGHLY recommend to everyone.

name: Anonymous
comment: Friendly staff. Great bedroom and bathroom. Location okay. Mixed rooms with a lot of space.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good value. Stayed 2 nights in 4 and 6bed dorms. The 4bed had a tv and hairdryer which was nice, but no individual light/socket or privacy curtains, which the 6bed did have. Good location for Dublin very central, maybe a dangerous area especially at night or alone, but so is everywhere in the inner city. Everything modern and clean. Free breakfast but left before 7.30am so couldn't try it, the shower was good but push button was annoying. Overall would stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice facilities, easy and safe storage under beds, good breakfast!

name: Anonymous
comment: I've stayed here a couple of times, it's a good location, modern and clean. Depending on when you book it can be excellent value in comparison to other hostels in the city. The 4 bed dorm has ensuite and a TV, while the 6 bed dorm has privacy curtains which is always a bonus. There's also a free breakfast, although I checked out too early to avail of it. This would be my first hostel of choice when staying in Dublin, although prices can vary wildly and it's not always the best value.

name: Anonymous
comment: Probably the best hostel in Dublin within this price range.

name: keithedbell4605
comment: This was my first hostel experience and my first day abroad, EVER! The staff was very welcoming and the hostel itself was more than I imagined. I felt comfortable leaving my things in a locked cage before checking in and felt at ease the entire time.

name: kaycee09836
comment: AMAZING! Would recommend to anyone and everyone. It is one of the nicest hostels in Dublin. Definitely stay here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Only cons are the location - approx. 10 mins from the Spire, and hostel is located in the north of the city considered a bit less safe - and noisy lockers in the rooms. Otherwise, hostel is very secure (keycards used). Rooms are so spacious, with en suite (shower + toilet) in my 12-person dorm. Bathrooms are clean, and showers and toilet stalls are spacious. Reception desk staff incredibly friendly. Breakfast was average, but sufficient. Large open areas in the lobby. Many activities offered.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good location. Nice and helpful staff. Breakfast was basic but sufficient. Common area was large and a bit dirty, smelt like sewer at times. 
 The room was awful. Pillows were paper thin and the mattress was so uncomfortable. The sheets did not cover the whole bed even and the mattress cover had stains on it. We had a 4 bedroom private and there was only ONE electric plug in the room. Could hear doors shutting and people walking down the hallway.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, right next to the bus station so very convienient for arriving and leaving! The staff were lovely, super helpful and friendly all the time! The hostel itself was great, with everything you need for a great stay! Would definitely recommend this place and will stay here if I'm ever back in Dublin!

name: Anonymous
comment: Overall nice hostel. Loved the free walking tour! Warm showers with a bathroom in the 6 bed suite was nice. The bed was not comfortable but to each their own

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob‚Äôs Inn is conveniently located in the city center and within walking distance of almost everything. The bathrooms were clean, the only issue I had was the shower in the room didn‚Äôt drain quickly so you end up standing in a lot of water. The beds have privacy curtains which was a nice touch. Overall a great place to stay!

name: Anonymous
comment: Outstanding as usual

name: Anonymous
comment:
Our first hostel stay and we were very happy. Facilities are great. Great self catering kitchen. Fantastic wifi access. Basic breakfast included which provided a few choices. More than enough for us. 
 We were in a triple private with ensuite and the room was huge. It even had a tv which we weren‚Äôt expecting. The hostel is right near the train station and you could hear the trains but they weren‚Äôt bothersome. Highly recommended by us.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not very clean. Not the best location and is not very comfortable to stay in.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great clean hostel with plenty of bathrooms and showers. Ensuite rooms are a great addition and were always clean. The size of the hostel doesn't really allow for meeting a lot of people but the lounge areas are great to relax. Staff always friendly and willing to give advice.

name: arianeoday5106
comment: BEST place that I stayed at in Ireland! It‚Äôs more like a hotel and has great security and activities planned for guests.

name: Anonymous
comment: Had a great time at this hostel! I felt very safe with the security measures and the hostel was so close to the train station and the airport shuttle. 15 min walk to Temple Bar and heart of downtown. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom was clean. Would definitely recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: This place is great, i would stay there again no prob

name: tait_rachel2104
comment: Lovely hostel, only about a 10min walk from temple bar, nice atmosphere clean rooms, would be nice to see more activities put on but s please tell stay :)

name: Anonymous
comment:
Probably the best hostel I've been all around the world.
 Really nice place where to stay!

name: Taliana21
comment: Excellent place. If I go back to Dublin, I definitely stay here ince again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, would stay again! Atmosphere in the common areas were lively. Staff was very helpful booking bus tours & how to get around the local area. Free walking tour was solid; 2 hours of seeing the city and got recommendations on good pubs and food around. The hostel pub crawl was overrated but it was my first one ever, so not sure how others are. I'd recommend to just do it on your own without paying. This way you get to explore more freely rather than having to stick with the crawl.

name: Anonymous
comment: Outstanding as usual. I travel frequently to Dublin and always stay there. Best hostel in Ireland. I get sad when there's no vaccancy

name: Anonymous
comment: By far the best hostel we stayed in over the course of our trip, the staff were super helpful and friendly, we felt safe in our rooms and safe storing our stuff, it was just perfect and relatively central too

name: Anonymous
comment: Really great value for Dublin prices. Facilities were clean, dorms spacious, and common areas/wifi very functional. Tons of security, and the privacy curtains on bunks were a nice touch. My only suggestion would be to travel here in groups or with another friend-- many of the guests staying were in groups, and the hostel was so large that it was a bit trickier to meet people as a solo traveler. Hopefully the hostel will implement some nightly programming to help bring more people together.

name: Anonymous
comment: I had a very comfortable stay here. Even though I was in a large room, the privacy curtain, individual light and charging points at the bed meant the space still felt personal. Good basic breakfast and fairly well equipped kitchen made food easy and the staff are pretty friendly and helpful. Because the hostel is so big it can feel a little impersonal and there isn't much of a community vibe but there are a bunch of fun events for meeting people and seeing more of the city

name: Anonymous
comment: I enjoyed my stay at Jacobs Inn, the hostel is more like a hotel, very big with lots of rooms so it isn't a very social atmosphere. For the end of my trip this is exactly what I wanted, a large common area, simple breakfast, convenient location and clean facilities. My only con was the snorer I had in my room but sometimes you draw the short straw.

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel itself is great! Very clean! I loved that there were games like a large chess board, pool table and a foozball table! The staff were very helpful and friendly too! There was a decent breakfast provided every morning, and good cooking facilities. Only downside was that it's a big hostel so not a great atmosphere, I didn't know any of the names of my room mates, just because people were in and out all time. Lastly I slept terribly because of a really inconsiderate roommate each night.

name: Jharrison926
comment: This was definitely my favorite hostel I stayed in, in the 2 weeks I was traveling. It was very clean, close to all kinds of restaurants, bars and sights. I do wish they would‚Äôve had a bar or something in the hostel just to meet people but they had a large common area which was nice. Would definitely stay here again!

name: jarrydfoster4066
comment: One of the best hostels ive stayed at would definatly stay here again and recomend it to friends

name: Anonymous
comment: Really nice hostel - I've stayed @ isaacs, not as good. jacobs has huge rooms, lots of storage and amenities (curtain for bed, charger at bed, etc) and so many bathrooms. downsides: didn't provide directions from one of the most popular bus routes, which was inconvenient. It does not come to Busaras but it's hard to know that before you arrive; had to ask the tourist office. Other downside: the doors are almost bizarrely thin. It actually sounded as if the door was open to the hallway

name: Anonymous
comment: I had a great stay at Jacobs Inn. It was very secure and right next to the Busaras Bus Station and a stop on the Luas Red Line. Great secure place to leave your bags until check in, and it was clean with a lovely staff. Would recommend.

name: kiara-humphrey
comment: Loved it here. Staff were welcoming and everyone staying there was lots of fun. Only annoying thing would be they allowed school trips come stay, big trips trying to cook and eat food in the kitchen which made it hard to sit anywhere

name: Anonymous
comment: Can say it was one of the best hostels I have ever been to. Spacious, large rooms, with counter and table to leave your stuff. Individual light and plugs for each bed. Everything super clean. Only downside, I would prefer it a biiit closer to the life of the city - not that it should be considered far. Although I only stayed one night, everything seemed so hassle free that I could stay for weeks!

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel was very comfortable and clean. The amenities were great with plenty of locker space, plugs and lights by the bed, and good wifi. The only major annoyance was that the bathrooms alternate on each floor and the staff would clean the bathroom in the morning when most people were getting ready (7-8 am). The hostel is very big so it's hard to meet lots of people, but the common spaces were really nice. Free breakfast was also great to have, especially when you have an early morning.

name: Anonymous
comment: If you have or haven't stayed in s hostrl before this one is very clean and very safe. I wasn't happy that I have to listen to everyone snore all night and come in and out of the room at all hours. I don't want to have to tip toe thruough my room when I come back from s long day, so for me a hostel is not going to be a top choice, but this one was very good for the first one.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel overall, I would have stayed there again on my return to Dublin if they'd had space. Rooms and bathrooms, and sheets were clean and beds were fairly comfortable. I booked a mixed dorm as females were all full, and ended up with three males in my room. When one of them came home at 2am the smell was so bad I thought I was going to be sick. Not the hostels fault- just bad luck with roommates. Lights and plugs above each bed would be a massive help though for people leaving early.

name: Anonymous
comment:
stay here a lot was in a top floor this time with 4 beds. No curtain on bed or light but i managed. Sleep quality was good as small amount in room. Didnt have breakfast as i was working late and had food. 
 Staff were nice any of them i met. Kitchen was been cleaned just when i needed lunch on friday which didnt impress me, Had to have cold plate of food as microwave in use and i had to go to work. Generally a good hostel with good facilities all round

name: Anonymous
comment: If you just need a place to crash for a few hours than this place might be for you. However, if you're looking for a hostel atmosphere, don't book here. The location was great, but this "hostel" felt like just a big hotel that hosted large school trips. I'm sure if I went to the free activities I would've met people eventually, however the atmosphere did not encourage mingling and didn't have the hostel feeling. Also the breakfast they advertised was just cheap cereal, bread, and jam.

name: amandajay
comment: One thing to note. 24hr check in but you can't get a room until noon. I arrived around 7am and had to sleep in the gaming area until my room was ready.

name: crlynch21
comment: I stayed for 5 nights and absolutely loved this place. The staff was super friendly & helpful, and rooms/common areas were all very clean. I also loved how each bunk had its own reading light, outlet/usb port and curtain. Under bed lockers were large which was also a plus. The location was perfect for someone who wants to be close to everything, but not in the heart of Temple Bar (10 min walk). Having the bus station & train station close by also makes it easy to travel outside of Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location, loved the privacy curtains on each bed! But when I stayed they had a group of 15+ students yelling and screaming in the halls. Ensuite bathroom was roomy but breakfast was minimal

name: Anonymous
comment: It's very good overall except they moved me to 3 different rooms in my 4 nights stay which is not pleasant, especially I have 2 one-day tour starting early morning to 9pm (12 hrs day trip) so I have to checkout every early morning and put my luggage in the reception, then pick them up at night after I come back from my trip everyday . They keep saying sorry to me for such inconvenient arrangement so I just let it go then.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place! right next to the train station for easy day trips to other parts of Ireland. The hostel was very clean and I felt very comfortable staying there. Recommended!

name: aorland
comment: The staff was great! Enjoyed my stay here.

name: Anonymous
comment: I liked the security features however they weren't well utilized- for example, you needed a key to get through doors but many doors were open. My biggest complaint is that my room straight up smelled like poop - I think there was something wrong with the toilet in the connecting room because it wasn't like a normal toilet smelling bad, it was a plumbing issue that radiated the smell so that the whole room smelled like it for all three days.

name: Anonymous
comment: This was a decent first trip to Dublin! We were greeted by the wonderful Niall (like the river). Niall was great!! He helped us schedule day trips and also gave the best advice.. all around great guy that made our stay perfect! My only thing is the whole room thing - 12 guys or girls sharing a room with no ventilation. I was in a room of 12 guys where they refused to open the window, so it ALWAYS smelt bad. Terrible. Maybe mix up dorms. Also people checked in ALL NIGHT, HARD TO SLEEP. Many kids.

name: Anonymous
comment: Stayed here for 1 night in a 12 girls dorm. We liked the hostel and the location. Breakfast was good for us and the room was also fine. Only downside of this stay was there was a big group of people that seemed like a school trip or something and the kids were running around screaming at night. Without that our stay would have been perfect, but even with it was allright for 2 budget travellers.

name: Anonymous
comment: Cool and relaxed hostel. We had a great time staying here for one night. Kitchen was pretty darn fully equipped. Being more prone to the Temple Bar area, the only downside to Jacob's Inn was the location. Otherwise, the staff as lovely and there were a lot of cool areas to grab a drink and relax. The mini terrace area on the roof is small, but awesome.

name: Anonymous
comment:
It was my first hostel experience. 
 Jacob's Inn was a really cool place! 
 The dorms have curtains which really gives you your privacy. 
 The breakfast was good. The free walking tour was really fun. 
 Really great atmosphere!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It's a slick and very professional operation. Possibly the cleanest hostel I've ever stayed in. It's very handy for Connolly Railway Station and Busaras bus station. The only downside is that's it's a bit of a walk to the city centre but hey the tram runs virtually past the door. Thoroughly recommended.

name: hcccss
comment: Each bed has curtains, overhead light, and outlets (including USB ports). The bathrooms are big and roomy, and you have access to the kitchen. Everything in this Hostel is big as it's a big Hostel but I absolutely loved the atmosphere. If you sign up for the pub crawl you'll get a chance to meet plenty of people and they take you to an awesome silent disco. If I'm ever back in Dublin on another solo trip, I 100% plan on coming back here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel with excellent facilities... probably the best hostel showers I've ever used. Lots of things on every day so easy for solo travellers to meet others. Only a short walk to many of the main sights and right next to the bus stop to/from airport which makes it super convenient . Would definitely stay again .

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel deserves a 20 out of 10! Ireland is by far my favorite country to travel to and staying at the Jacobs Inn just makes the trip that much better. From staff to the atmosphere it was all top of the line.

name: Anonymous
comment: Beds were uncomfortable and pillows weren't great either. Bathroom was clean and spacious enough. Some rooms had windows that opened (yay) and others that didn't so whatever smells there were, were there to stay. It was pretty loud because it's like a dorm for college/uni students and they liked to scream and play loud music. Good location but overall, I wouldn't stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel! Clean, spacious rooms with curtains for privacy. Staff was helpful and pleasant, even helped recover a lost jacket after check out. Best hostel I've stayed at in Dublin, would definitely stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: I've stayed in better and worse hostels. Nothing special stands out about it. Was a little out of the way from most tourist attractions. Staff were helpful. The stench of cleaning supplies stands out as a weird memory.

name: j_booth
comment: Brilliant staff, very very friendly and it makes such a big difference. Free walking tour with Alan is excellent. Pub crawl was brilliant and you can go more than once. Facilities were really good and the curtains were good too. Breakfast simple but yummy. Take some bread and condiments for lunch too!

name: nolansritan3053
comment: Very cool hostel. Tucked away on a side street of Dublin so it wasn‚Äôt in the center of everything happening. Offered plenty of events such as guided walks and pub crawls so you can meet people all over the world (my favorite part)

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff was awesome!!! I got back to the hostel really late at night and had to be on a bus at 4:40 in the morning. When I got back I could not for the life of me get my lock off my locker so he came and cut it off for me and had the bus wait! Great and friendly staff!

name: Anonymous
comment: This location offers great amenities. We stayed in a coed room with bunk beds. Each bed had a privacy curtain as well as a light and usb port to plug in your device over your head in the bunk itself. The wifi throughout the building was great. The kitchen and eating area offered lots of utensils, cutlery, cooking pots etc. There is plenty of room for the number of people who can stay at the hostel. The room that we had had its own private bathroom that was very clean. The staff were friendly.

name: joan23
comment: Very clean, friendly staff, a lot of space in the dorms and the kitchen. Plenty of hot water. I will definitely go back next time I'm in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Safe, secure, fun hostel! Great vibes, tours, and a pub crawl.

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent hostel which is why I keep returning even if there's another cheaper hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very helpful and friendly staff. Our flights landed early in the morning, but we were able to leave our backpacks in a locker while we explored Dublin prior to check-in. They also take your security seriously, so that was much appreciated. We had to catch another flight before sunrise and the staff offered to call us a cab. That was also very helpful because I couldn't get the app on my phone to work and didn't have international calling capabilities. Highly recommended!

name: possumperner
comment:
Place annoyed me 
 Luckily there's a pub next door 
 But the shower floods and the water is thougherly annoying 
 The bedding poor 
 Breakfast is poor 
 No ac
 Poor luggage space 
 Not many English speaking people in my room 
 One toilet and shower in 12 person mixed room is a joke

name: Athallett31
comment: This was our biggest hostel we stayed in. Staff was helpful for what we needed. Basic amenities for rooms but tons of lockers for storage. Big kitchen and area to eat plus area to hang out.

name: Anonymous
comment: It's a nice hostel.... You have space and freedom.... Very friendly staff and has everything nice....I liked it

name: Anonymous
comment: Great stay. Good breakfast, central location close to Donnolly, BusAras, and the Airlink 747 to the airport. Walking distance to Dublin Centre.

name: Anonymous
comment: Second time I've stayed at this hostel. 12 person room, would be nice if the shower and toilet were separate so if one was in use, the other can be used by someone else. About a 15 minute walk to Temple bar.

name: Anonymous
comment: Paid for an all female dorm, being a solo traveller, and found myself in a mixed room. Breakfast is very basic, the reading light and usb chargers in the bunks were handy, but the beds and pillows were uncomfortable. Bathrooms weren't that clean either, both ensuite and separately. If you're a solo traveller in Dublin and don't mind spending just a bit extra, stay at a BnB.

name: Anonymous
comment:
A little bit more expensive than your average hostel, but beds have individual reading light and outlet to charge your gear plus privacy/sunshine curtain. In addition my 6-bed room was spacious with private bathroom, hangers for coats and small table. Very close to main bus and train station and 10-15 min walk to Temple Bar.
 Not fancy, but one of the nicest/most efficient hostels I have ever stayed overall.

name: Anonymous
comment: Comfortable bed, very clean en-suite bathroom in girls flat. All beds had a privacy curtain, light, and USB charging port/outlet. Shared bathroom on the floor as well. Staff very friendly. Bfast = cereal, toast, eggs sometimes, canned fruit, beverages. Luggage storage available before/after stay; bring your own lock or purchase one for ‚Ç¨4 (a fair price!) Can be noisy if large, drunk groups are present, but that's the trade-off for staying in a hostel. Police (garda) literally next door.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very noisy, not so clean and would not neccessarily reccommend. The staff is friendly but definitely not for people who just want to use their hostel for just sleep.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, the curtin system on the beds provides lots of privacy and the bathroom in my 12 bed female dorm was very spacious. Free breakfast was ok, staff were lovely, and location is good about a 10-15 minute walk to city centre. Would stay again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice hostal, great central location in Dublin

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel. Perfect location, lovely staff and nice atmosphere.

name: brezcolin2897
comment: Very good hostel for the price, I would stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good location - easy to get to/from the airport via Airlink Express 747 and within a 10-15 minute walk from attractions south of the River Liffey or O'Connell Street. Rooms were clean and spacious. Privacy curtains on the beds are a nice feature, and ensuite bathroom had a nice hot shower. Would recommend staying here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff was friendly & very welcoming with tips & local wisdom.Centrally located.Cleaning has seen better days.Our mixed room of 12 had THE worst smell you could imagine & this made it hard to sleep.Smell ended up coming from 2 separate travellers.Beds were thin cots, I got an eye infection from my pillow (minor; eye drops were my savior).Walls were super thin & noise curfews weren't enforced;so people would continue blasting music till 1am.simple breafast.For ‚Ç¨20/night,you get what you pay for.

name: Anonymous
comment: Fantastic and huge hostel. We had a great spacious room for 6 with a beautiful bathroom. The breakfast is great, althought it can become crowded, so take a bit more time. I would also suggest a couple more toasters. Functional kitchen and nice other facilities, like the terace or the game room. Very nice and helpful staff.

name: Anonymous
comment: There were some large groups staying here (high school age kids), but other than that, this place was great. The mixed dorm room that I stayed in had under bed locker cages, each bed had a light and a charging station, and a curtain! What more can you ask for?

name: akashpalia8443
comment: Really friendly and helpful staff. Good location , must recommend the walking tours too.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very clean and safe. I totally recommend it!

name: Anonymous
comment: So I stayed at this hostel back in September but the location was really good. It was about a 10-15 minute walk to the downtown area where a lot of the bars and sights to see were. The staff was honestly amazing. They answered every question and drew extra directions on the map for me. I booked my tours last minute but the staff made calls and got me into the tours I wanted. The room was clean and that was a huge plus for me. But the place is huge and hard to meet people

name: Anonymous
comment: Good location. Would have been nice if the likes of pool was free rather than a euro every time you play but other than that it was okay. Security getting in was good and a standard bring your own lock for the under the bed baskets.

name: Anonymous
comment: Fairly clean. Staff very nice and helpful, organized pub crawls and walking tours, among other events. Curtain on bed is great, beds have USB outlet and light. Bed not very comfortable. Cages under bed and separate luggage room. Busy hostel, lots of very young people and student groups. I'm only 24 and felt like one of the older people there. About a 15 min walk to the city center, bus station right outside door. Wish it was a little closer to the city center, but overall pretty great hostel!

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved my stay here! Great facilities with an awesome room set up. Liked that each headspace had a curtain and nightlight bar with plugins for your devices. There was also a bathroom with shower in the room, along with the communal ones on the floor. This was great, so you were never waiting to shower or use the washroom. The breakfast was also a great start to the day!

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved the curtains over the bunks. Cages below beds were noisy. Bathrooms need to be cleaned more than once a day. Especially the downstairs ones. There is no atmosphere, only people on their laptops who don't socialise. A little dissapointed with an incident that occurred in our dorm. A rude travller brought home a girl from a night out. They were noisy etc but the worst part was that she was let in by security. She was not a guest of the hostel. As guests we need a card and a pass.

name: Anonymous
comment: nice hostel for the price-- need to rent a bike (‚Ç¨5 for 3 days) or allow 15-20 minutes to walk into where all the action is, but this means its a more quiet place to sleep. Police station right around the corner added to a very safe feel to the location. Fairly close to everything you could want to see in Dublin! Staff was very helpful, seemed like things were organized and opportunities to meet people were there if you wanted.

name: Anonymous
comment: Full size kitchen; secure; decent location. It didn't feel as much of a social hostel to me, but I didn't spend much time in it anyways.

name: Anonymous
comment:
I would definitely stay again. My room (mixed 6 bed dorm, ensuite) was spacious, clean and well equipped - as was the kitchen and common areas. 
 
 Reception staff were friendly and helpful.

name: Anonymous
comment: One of the best hostels I stayed in during my two weeks in Ireland. I was here with a group of 25 and then stayed a few nights on my own. Super helpful staff, large common area to hang out in, big kitchen with a variety of breakfast options. The hostel is close to most things but just far enough out of city centre that it's not in a busy area. This will be my go-to hostel the next time I'm in Dublin

name: Anonymous
comment: This might be in the best Hostel in Dublin. Safe, curtains around the bed, plug ins, hair dryer, straightener, very clean, great and hot showers, cozzy bed, great linen, nutella for breakfast.. I absolutely recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: Fantastic place; probably the best hostel I've stayed in. Staff are terrific and evetything is super-organized and still fun.

name: Anonymous
comment: Had a good stay at this hostel. Had a big secure locker room to store my gear before I could check in. Rooms are big and spacious. Every bed had a curtain to "hide away". Power supply and readinglight for each bed. Free breakfast was ok. Nothing special, just a little something to get you going. Room was clean and quiet. Always managed to get a good night sleep. Best part is location. Only 15 min walk to temple bar area. Not much social at lobby, could do better with a bar. Good value.

name: Anonymous
comment: I didn't have a bad time here- just didn't particularly have a great time. It was hard to meet people and the staff at the front desk didn't seem that excited or knowledgable about Dublin. I've found on other trips, the hostel staff is way more excited to show off the city// way more friendly about it. It's clean though and they give you a free breakfast, which is awesome. I wouldn't stay again though.

name: danielcarlini
comment: Lots of students, workers and families with children. Not a bad thing, but it looses a bit the friendliness of the environment, common areas tend to be empty or more functional than fun.

name: dollaraaron1813
comment: Fantastic in all regards, no complaints! Security is very extensive, but better safe then sorry!

name: helloclarisse5386
comment:
The place is very well located, nice staff, nice facilities. Breakfast is ok: milk, coffee, tea, cocoa, eggs, butter, Nutella, cereals and jam.
 It's veeery close to the central train station and to one of the stations from where the buses to the airport leave.
 
 The only suggestion for the hostel would be to make it possible for the windows to be opened wide. In a room with 10 people it can get very smelly. Plus, you need fresh air anyway... :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff were not the most pleasant. Seems like this hostel did not attract common backpackers, and overall had a very fake "cool" vibe to it. Administration did not seem to express the importance of being quiet when returning to your room like most other hostels I have stayed at. That reflected on the actions of numerous room mates who were talking well past the quiet hours. My room had awful ventilation, probably none at all in fact.

name: colinjames811487
comment: JACOBS INN IS A GREAT JOB , WOULD RECOMMEND YOU STAY HERE

name: Anonymous
comment: Great affordable place to stay!

name: Anonymous
comment: The location is not really in a good part of the city, it's about a 10 minute walk to the centre but there a better and safer areas for tourists I think, it was also very noisy at night. A part from that was a pretty good place to stay but found it a bit hard to meet people as the hostel was so big. Rooms were clean and spacious.

name: Anonymous
comment: Al ways stay here when in Dublin. Extremely convenient and I love the improved lights , sockets etc.

name: Anonymous
comment:
I throughly enjoyed the walking tour and the pub crawl. I made amazing friends, and got to the see the city in a highly entertaining light. 
 I appreciated the proximity of the hostel to all major public transport. 
 The entertainment facilities, in room bathroom, and bed curtains are brilliant additions. 
 The breakfast can be enhanced to include various items like fruit, pastries, and cheese. 
 The staff were highly responsive to my questions, and I felt safe 24/7. 
 Thank you!! :D

name: Anonymous
