comment: Very secure and close to bus station. Shower turns off after 2 seconds so you have to hold the button but apparently that's a thing in Ireland. Reception gave me bad advice on how to get to cork.

name: Anonymous
comment: Average hostel but close to the temple bar area and other pubs. Close to the bus station is a plus. Only downside of this trip was the little kids that were also staying there and the lack of atmosphere. They do advertise a pub crawl and a walking tour as well which can help solo travellers meet people and have fun. Despite the negatives I do believe next time will be better and I would stay at this hostel again.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Location is certainly central but it's not in the nicest part of city - walks to Temple Bar, Dublin Castle etc., about 15 minutes away. 
 Rooms come with an ensuite - useful as didn't have to walk too far to go to bathroom - never had a problem fighting over it - could have done with more frequent cleaning. 
 Problem with noise on last night from next door room - complained 2x to reception & to neighbors - kept me awake - hostel needs earlier quiet hours on week-nights.
 Breakfast was okay.

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel was amazing and I would highly recommend especially a roughing it trip around Ireland. Couldn't fault this place at all. Would return in a heartbeat üòÄ

name: Anonymous
comment: Clean hostel, friendly staff. Very close to the city centre! USB plugs right above the bunk beds are definitely a plus!

name: davidalexander85
comment: It's more of a hotel style hostel so wouldn't recommend for lone travelers but it was excellent for our group. Great beds and facilities.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really nice hostel. Great facilities and very clean. I would personally wanted better atmosphere. Large lounge area that didn't make you feel warm enough.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn was a great stay for our time in Dublin! Awesome location, just off of Connelly street, close to many food shops and grocery stores. A 15 minute walk to the Temple Bar district just across the Liffy! The tours they provide are great, be sure do to the FREE walking tours!

name: Anonymous
comment: Fantastic staff. Super helpful in providing advice about what to do in Dublin and all around Ireland.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice place to spend a few nights. Check in is at 3pm like a hotel but there's free breakfast if you arrive early like I did and nobody minds if you hang around the common spaces until your room is ready. Modern spaces and a youthful atmosphere, tech resources easily accessible. I wish I hadn't been so jet lagged so I could have participated in some of the discounted evening and morning activities offered. Linens provided. Just be sure to carry your keycard within easy reach! Wonderful!

name: genacesiren
comment: Amazing time!!! Will definitely go back! Do the Pub Crawl!!

name: Anonymous
comment: No complaints whatsoever. Very clean and up together room and a great pub crawl.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Was great stay for my one night.
 The USB charging facility on the bed was brill.
 And the mattress was surprisingly comfortable.

name: Anonymous
comment: Had a great stay at Jacobs Inn. Great location in Dublin and received an upgrade to a private room upon arrival which was awesome! Rooms are great. A lot of teenagers on summer camp were present - wasn't a worry but for other travellers, good to know it's an all ages hostel. Would definitely recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: Not right in the city centre but if you're like me and don't mind walking it's still a great spot, right near the train/bus station and just a short walk to the city centre! The rooms are great, each bed has its own locker, light and power outlet, as well as a curtain to give you a bit of privacy! If you're travelling alone the atmosphere is not amazing because there tends to be a lot of large groups staying here but it's good if you need somewhere to stay for just a night or two.

name: Anonymous
comment: Staying in a hostel is not ideal but Dublin is so expensive it was the only option. I was very surprised with jacobs inn. I stayed in a mixed 6 bed dorm with an en suite & have nothing negative to say about it! Obviously, you can't help the coming and going of other guests but in terms of facilities and cleanliness it was great. Each bunk has a curtain, which gives guests privacy & blocks out light/disturbance from others in the dorm, and also a reading light and an adapter to charge your phone.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location with some good lively bars near by about 10 min walk away from temple bar also great for local transport with a bus and tram stop near by room was clean and spacious

name: Anonymous
comment: Good large hostel in a very convenient location. Easy to reach from airport.

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved the place! The day staff were lovely and the rooms and facilities were fantastic! Would definitely stay again but a few of us got ID'd on our way in (even though we had security passes) and it made us feel quite uncomfortable! Maybe they should get a list of names for the rooms then it would be easier to recognise who's staying there by their ID (as they looked at our ID even though we was only under the name of who booked the room). Also rooms were VERY hot.

name: Anonymous
comment: Our stay was amazing! :) And the bedrooms were very clean, plus the curtain on the bed made it private and very nice.

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed here for 8 days. It was great!! The only complaint I had is in my 12 bed dorm, the door was very noisy when it shut and the under bed lockers were very squeaky as well. I was woken up several times through the night when people came in. This would have been fine with some earplugs (they are even available at reception) but I find them very uncomfortable and I can't sleep with them in. I would 100% stay here again, just in a smaller dorm.

name: Anonymous
comment: Right next to train tracks, you can hear them going all night... and the bus station area is a bit sketchy

name: Anonymous
comment: The security was over the top. To get around the hostel you have to keep using your keycard to open various doors.

name: Anonymous
comment: The dorm was clean and every bed had its own plug and light. Good location near the bus station. Kind staff.

name: Anonymous
comment: Rooms are very modern, with curtains, plugs and a reading light and locker for every bed, which I thought was pretty great for a hostel. It was reasonably clean and quiet and in a good location, 10-15min walk to most of the sights. Breakfast very basic but okay. Would definitely recommend it! The only downside is that it didn't seem as easy for a single traveller to socialise here, but that's probably the same in other Dublin hostels

name: Anonymous
comment: The facilities at Jacobs Inn were comfortable, and the breakfast was great! My only complaints are that the bathrooms and showers were not always clean and the staff was not very helpful.

name: Anonymous
comment: We had a really good stay here in Dublin, this was the perfect starting place for us to do everything we wanted to in Ireland. The security is good and the kitchen is huge, we also liked the huge locker space and the privacy curtains were nice as well. Also the staff here are super helpful, Greg was a really big help to us, helping us book our day trips which made our stay even more pleasant. This is a really good hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice hostel in good central location, with the city centre and the main attractions within walking distance. The rooms are nice and clean, we booked a private bedroom (with very clean bathroom ensuite). The included breakfast is basic, but good value for the money spent. Staff is very friendly and helpful, and the hostel offers a number of additional activities like pub crawls, barbecues, Irish dancing etc. Excellent hostel for a few days in Dublin!

name: Twitchyq
comment: I stayed in a 6 bed mixed en-suite dorm and it was great! The bathroom attached was large and the showers were hot and lovely. I wish there was an exhaust fan because it kind of got really steamy after someone had a shower. Comfy beds and the privacy curtain and individual power sockets/lights were very helpful! Didn't go to common room but it looked like a fun chill space. WIFI worked GREAT. Lockers under beds to store valuables. Key card system for security. Close to airport bus stop!

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel has everything. First, if you're coming from the airport and take the 747 bus, it leaves you one minute from the hostel on Talbot St. The hostel is big with lots to do! There is an elevator which was good for me because I had so much stuff. It was clean, each bed had an outlet, light and curtain. And best of all, they arranged a shuttle to pick me up from the hostel at 3:40 am and take me to the airport for 7‚Ç¨. I will definitely be back to this hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Honestly it is to big for any real atmosphere. Hard to meet people, dorms of 12 are to large and it feels like people pay to live there instead of just travelling. Apart from the bathroom, seems like the dorm never got cleaned. Staff have good advice however never seem to leave reception even after 2 nights they questioned if I was staying there even after swiping in through a door. Security is 100% though. Your call but I would stay somewhere smaller if you want to meet people. School groups to

name: Anonymous
comment: I came to this hostel in a bind, and they rescued me and made an otherwise bad experience awesome. I showed up at 6 am on a Saturday and they found me a really nice 4-person room and let me hang out downstairs and shower and store my luggage and do my laundry until I was allowed to check in. Their facilities are super spacious and clean, the environment is really fun, and the common areas really nice. I am definitely coming back to Dublin, and when I do I'm staying here.

name: Anonymous
comment: I loved this hostel! The breakfast was free and as such had some decent variety. The 6 person dormer style had a private bathroom and shower, but there was also the main showers separated by gender. There was a main area with plenty of games (board games, foosball, pool, chess, etc) and seating area for people to gather in. The staff was very nice and helpful. My room key stopped working a couple times but the staff happily fixed this issue. I would stay here again if I ever return to Dublin!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location but was a bit noisy at night. I stayed in a 12-person dorm which was very clean and secure. I was very thankful for the front desk staff who reserved an airport shuttle for me to make sure I was on time to my very early flight.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really good option!

name: Anonymous
comment: I only stayed for one night so I didn't get a real feel for this place but my experience was good. The location was very convenient being so close to the bus stops so I had no problem getting to & from the airport. It's a bit of a walk to the Temple Bar area (about 15 minutes) but I didn't mind that. My only complaint is that I felt the staff could have been more outgoing and welcoming. They weren't unfriendly but they didn't go out of their way to be hospitable either. I would stay again though

name: Anonymous
comment: The guy who made my check- in was not friendly at all . The hostel is clean and 10 minutes away from the center

name: Anonymous
comment: Had a fantastic stay. The location was excellent, the staff were quite helpful! The kitchen was massive - 10 people were able to cook in there and you'd still have space! Really appreciated how big the place was and how clean the rooms were. I'd definitely recommend it to people who are looking to stay for more than a night as well as families and couples! Such a fantastic atmosphere and everyone was lovely.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is literally my favorite hostel I've stayed in, and I've stayed in a lot. It has everything you want in a hostel. Fun sociable atmosphere, great staff, a giant kitchen, a huge eating room with free breakfast, nice spacious super clean facilities, beds are comfortable and have chargers etc, laundry, lockers, and the location is unbeatable and right next to public transit, grocery, pubs, and restaurants. And a crazy good price! Amazing way to see Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay, staff were very helpful and friendly. Would recommend staying here

name: Anonymous
comment: Super place, right next to Busaras and Connolly train station. Great and very helpful staff and excellent facilities.

name: Anonymous
comment:
The staff was great. Location was ok. Had a private room. Would have been nice to have a little bit more space in the room, but not anything to complain about. 
 I would also want to have a better light in the room but also nothing to complain about:) overall I had a good stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: The location is ok; staffs are pretty friendly. But it's the kind of hostel that is too big and hard to get to know people. The room is not bright enough even all the lights are turned on. The breakfast is basic, the security sometimes can be pretty annoying as you have to use the card to open a lot of doors.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location, walkable access to many Dublin attractions. Hostel was very clean and comfy, also extremely safe. Staff were nice, but I didn‚Äòt interact much with them. Would stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Clean and staff were helpful. Everyone very much kept themselves to themselves though so it was a little isolated an atmosphere so dont come here if you want to meet other travelers! otherwise a perfectly adequate hostel

name: Anonymous
comment: As I was traveling by myself, I wanted to stay in a female bedroom, but they didn't have one and it wasn't really a problem. I found it hard to meet people as It looked like everyone was traveling in groups. Despite that, the hostel staff was very friendly and helpful, the bed was very good and private as there's blinds in it and the bathroom was very clean. It was a good stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: I was very sleep deprived and the staff was very helpful!! It's an ok location because I just need the bus to the airport the next morning and it was right there. Comfy beds, big dorm areas, clean bathrooms.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, good offers for daytrips, sight seeing tours, pub crawls, dinner,...

name: Anonymous
comment: I can only fault this hostel on the bathrooms constantly being flooded and having no draining or towels to clean up the water. The staff were great, and when I had a problem it was resolved immediately. Awesome location and great hostel overall

name: Anonymous
comment: In heart of city, good location and facilities. Breakfast really good. Staff helpful. Only downside is this place is huge, mainly groups of school kids and friends so meeting people is very hard.

name: Anonymous
comment: Absolutely the best hostel in town. I've been to Dublin 4 times, so I know a lot of places to stay in. Jacbos is the most comfortable and clean. Open spaces to chill, open terrace, comfortable rooms with plenty space for luggage. Modern and clean bathroom. Very helpful crew. Well located near Busaras and Connolly Station. I will certainly come back.

name: Anonymous
comment: Quality hostel! The staff were very friendly, always up for a laugh and super helpful with tours and suggestions. The facilities were good quality - the curtains for each of the beds are a great idea.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location to jump on the bus or train as it's about a 2 minute walk. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nice spots for coffee just around the corner. Only small complaint was the number of times you had to use your key card but it keeps us all safer so really not a complaint at all. Just remember to keep your card on you at all time even within the hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Great atmosphere and well-mannered staff who are available to attend to your enquiries and offered useful assistance.
 I have been here on several occasions and will definitely be back again. It's a home from home without leaving a hole in your pocket.

name: rosieanneman
comment: Some of the nicest staff I've come across in hostels and the place is squeaky clean and fab. Love staying here :)

name: mjoellet
comment: A ten minute walk over the bridge to "downtown". The rooms were very nice & the hostel itself was modern & cool. Laundry available and the staff could book anything for you. Most of the staff were nice but one guy was kind of rude. Definitely a good stay at Jacob's Inn though

name: kconnelly544
comment: Stayed in a 12 person bedroom, some of the people in my bedroom were a little inconsiderate to others and the bathroom was always wet and a little stinky. Everything else was good though.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's Inn was very clean, spacious, and comfortable. I felt very safe with all of the card-access doors. The curtains on the beds were great for privacy. The room was big and had a big bathroom. Large common areas and great kitchen and dining room area. A little bit off the beaten path but otherwise would highly recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: We had a very pleasant stay at Jacob's Inn. Friendly and quiet room mates, slept well and felt secure. The breakfast was poor but we hadn't expected anything else.

name: Anonymous
comment: The actual hostel is pretty great, the rooftop was a cool touch and the staff are lovely, very helpful and friendly however would not stay again only because of the location. I was warned multiple times by locals not to walk around late at night in this area as it was unsafe

name: Anonymous
comment: I was so happy with this hostel. Great location, the staff rock and the rooms were clean. I would stay here again :) thanks, guys!

name: Anonymous
comment: great to stay at! a lot pf groups or families staying there - and not the best atmosphere to get to know new people. super clean, felt like a hotel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel! Good location, loved the bunk set up with little curtains, heaps of communal spaces, great free brekkie. Bathroom in room but good. Definitely recommend

name: Anonymous
comment: Brilliant hostel able to check in early on the day! Super clean!

name: Anonymous
comment: The facilities at this hostel are very good - comfortable beds with power sockets, privacy curtains, good WIFI, strong showers and everything is very clean. If I were looking for a quiet night to rest in Dublin then this would be my choice. If you are travelling alone and looking to meet other travellers then go elsewhere. The guests staying at the hostel were mostly older people, families and kids on some kind of school excursion.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's is very good situated,near the main bus station,and in center of town. The staff ond atmosphere is super. It is nice,clean and friendly hostel. We enjoyed very much!

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff is very helpful and rooms are clean. Very comfortable and easy to meet people. Close to the team and buses for easy transportation but also easy to walk anywhere from Jacobs.

name: Anonymous
comment: I really enjoyed my stay at Jacobs Inn. The staff was very helpful and the hostel had an inviting atmosphere. It is in a great location making it easy to get around the city.

name: naco228
comment: Second time I stayed here in a week. Great hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Rooms and facilities were clean and spacious but sometimes strangely designed... You have to keep pressing the button in the shower and sink for water to flow. Also definitely not a party hostel - people speak many different languages and apart from the solo travellers, tend to stick to themselves.

name: Anonymous
comment: I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I felt very safe as a solo female traveler. The customer service was excellent and responsive.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not recommended for solo travellers. Location is decent. The other side of river would be more ideal, but it's not far to walk there from the hostel. But very big hostel. Feels like a hotel with cheaper beds. Lots of doors and entrance controls establishing barriers between travellers and staff. Seems like lots of big groups when I stayed. It was not easy to meet people as a solo traveller. Not aware any events there. Not much an atmosphere to speak of. :( Some staff helpful, others so so.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good spacious hostel. Walkable to most things and right next to a tram line if not. Stayed in a room of 12 with no problems. Lockers and bed curtains are nice. Nothing to complain about with this place, one of the better hostels i've stayed in.

name: Anonymous
comment: I understand there is a need for safety but this hostel is another level. The amount of times you need your key card to get to different places in the hostel is unbelievable. The location is decent, only 20ish min walk to the major sites and temple bar. The rooftop terrace has a strict 10pm quiet hour rule so if your looking for a good social atmosphere I would look elsewhere. Overall decent experience.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bring earplugs to sleep! Very hot in rooms, no AC. Breakfast was basic but free. Good security. Oh and don't waste your money on the pub crawl, absolute joke! Felt like a 5 year old on a school field trip. Just head to temple bar district and bar hop on your own time.

name: Anonymous
comment: Each bed has individual curtains which is nice. But there aren't enough washrooms for a floor. The hostel has a decent common area. The hostel lets you leave luggage in the locker room for free. And overall a pretty decent hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: I had a really great time in Jacobs Inn, staffs were very friendly and helpful. Unlike some of the hostels which have no lock in the luggage area, they have lockers in their luggage room so you can lock your bags after you checked out. Overall it's a great hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs inn has a true hostel vibe. Very chill and social with a lot of common spaces to hang out but also a lot of families and school groups which was a little weird. The location is pretty good but is about a 15 minute walk from temple bar. Outlets at every bed with usb ports is always a plus. Would stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Very pleasant experience. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Our room on the 3rd floor was clean and even provided towels. Breakfast is basic: bread and spreads, coffe, tea, milk and cereals and canned fruit. 
 My only "vegetative" comment: iI wish there would have been individual lamps at the bedside. 
 Thanks - we had a good stay at jacobs Inn.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel. Close to the main bus stop and within walking distance of everything else. Helpful amd kind staff, as is everyone in Ireland. Very clean and accessible.

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff honestly made this hostel wonderful! They were so friendly and helpful when navigating the city!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great people. Fantastic times. Very welcoming. WOULD RECOMMEND

name: Anonymous
comment: I really enjoyed the hostel. Nice area to eat and another one to socialize. The only thing that I didn't love was the neighbourhood. I wouldn't book back here again just because I didn't feel safe staying out too late and walking back to the hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: The front desk staff were not very helpful - I asked for help figuring out public bus times and they told me to find it myself on the pole next to the stop, even though I needed to catch a bus to the airport at a certain time. The breakfast was good.

name: Anonymous
comment: Favorite hostel in Europe. So close to everything you need and more. The front desk staff is also so nice and helpful- I especially loved the Chilean lady. The kindness soul in all of Ireland just like the people in the country. Ireland was-by far-my fave country in Europe and this hostel def helped with that regard. Cheers!

name: lucywinter832503
comment: Absolutely amazing hostel! Very safe and friendly! Everyone was so lovely and helpful! Such a fun environment to be in! Would 100% recommend :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent facilities and security. Friendly staff they don't promote a community sense in the shared areas.

name: leandroquintana93
comment: Very nice, big and full equipped hostel. Kinda dislike the amount of child there was, but i agreed with that.

name: macysprock
comment: Some of the staff was great, while others were extremely rude. They did help us book a trip to the Cliffs of Moher and had several other options, including movie inspired trips. The rooms got a little crowded sharing one shower, but we found the floor had a separate female-only bathroom with more showers and toilets. Not a terribly far walk from Temple Bar, but not directly close to anything special. Worth it for the price.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good location, clean, good places to hang out, roof deck was really cool. Met a bunch of good people

name: Anonymous
comment: Very clean bathrooms, they come and clean everyday. Good water pressure. Stayed in a 12 person mixed room and found it pretty difficult to get any good sleep even with earplugs and eye mask, just a lot of people for a fairly small space. Good for a few nights, any more than 3 (I stayed 5) was definitely not comfortable. Free breakfast ends at 9:30am, which I thought was a bit too early and easy to miss.

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel overall was very nice. Its located right next to main bus station. Everything is close to the location including grocery stores, liquor stores, pubs, and fast food places. The price was reasonable but weekend will always be more expensive. Its not 18+ hostel so there could be kids there during your stay. Would stay again here if ever in Dublin.

name: naco228
comment: I appreciated the sheets for the beds to cover the sunlight. The rooms had plenty of space, and I liked the personal bathroom for the rooms. I do with the pillows were a little fluffier. They were quite flat and sometimes uncomfortable to use. Either way, great first hostel experience.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay for a couple nights. The common area and kitchen/dining area were very big which was nice. The rooms were nice and had their own bathroom/shower but there were also other showers on the floor as well. Overall great stay!

name: Anonymous
comment: The place was really cool and the staff was just as awesome. Can't ask for a better location, its within walking distance of almost anything in Dublin and there's plenty to see or do right next to it. The proximity to Connolly Station is what ultimately did me in, but the Hostel has a lot more to offer than just that. The games room, lounge, kitchen, everything was all top notch. The beds could be better, but ya know its a hostel. Loved the privacy curtains those help tremendously.

name: Anonymous
comment: Renovations have really helped to improve this hostel!! Had an enjoyable stay :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location! Room was clean, plenty of lounge space, giant kitchen, clean rooms, and nice staff. Loved it

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent stay at Jacob's inn. Great location and atmosphere - perfect for an affordable stay in the centre of Dublin

name: Anonymous
comment: There were so many good things about this hostel including the curtains on the bunks in the dorm, the outlets and lights with each bed, the quietness, security and much more. I would definitely stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good but could have done with a bedside light in my room.

name: Anonymous
comment: The four of us stayed here for 4 nights, and couldn't have been happier! The staff was super helpful, friendly, and had great recommendations for food and things to do. The room and bathrooms were very clean. We stayed in a private room for the first part of our trip with an ensuite shower--all super clean! And the end of our trip we stayed in an 8 mixed bedroom--best part were the curtains around the bed and lockers were easily accessible under the bed. Overall-awesome stay. Highly recommended!

name: JONATHANBARRY
comment: We had a great stay. Right in the middle of town. Rooms were clean and tidy. Staff were great. The USB charging point, electric power plug, and bed lamp built right into the bed is a very nice touch. If I had to find something on the down side, it would be that the breakfast could have a bit more substance and that the pillows are probably up for renewal.

name: Anonymous
comment: Amazing staff, super friendly and they help you with anything you need. The hostel is well located 5- 10 minutes from the city center and the metro station is just around the corner. Push button shower and sink (not the most comfortable thing to do, but manageable). My only complaint was breakfast, your options are basically cereal or oatmeal, and bread with jam.

name: jordanpickard28
comment: Staff are really helpful and put a lot of effort into making your stay as best as possible. Location is quite good, usually 5-15 minutes walk to many major attractions.

name: angelamahlook6190
comment: One of my favorite hostels! Handy elevators, huge dorms with curtains for privacy and personal outlets and light in each bunk. Ensuite and luggage cage as well. Fantastic security (probably a little overkill for me personally) massive kitchen, good chill area and heaps of events/ discounted tours. There were a couple of school groups, so can be young children and books out quickly! So close to Dublin city center! Really enjoyed my stay here and will be coming back!

name: Anonymous
comment: Really good stay in Jacobs Inn. Breakfast is simple but good! Lots of places to charge all of your devices, lockables can be kept in a safe place with a place to keep your baggage and explore the city before your departure time. Close to public transit and taking the airlink bus to and from the airport from the hostel is easy as they're close by. If I was to stay in Dublin I'd stay here again but that Irish summer won't bring me back anytime soon!

name: Haylxy
comment: Nice, clean, and secure place. Next to the Bus/Tram station, super easy airport transfers. 10-15min walk to Temple Bar. The only thing I didn't like was that this place was full of tour groups full of teenagers. It was annoying for me as a solo traveler. Breakfast is typical toast, jam, cereal.

name: Anonymous
comment: This place was great! first hostel i stayed in and i was really happy with it. had i been there longer i would have taken more advantage of the kitchen and all they had to offer! it was an amazing deal and atmosphere. like i said my fist hostel so i didn't know i needed to provide my own lock, but luckily they sell them there! if stay here again

name: Anonymous
comment: Good location, comfy beds , staff what ok some had a bad attitude

name: sbruce10
comment: Loved this hostel!! Very clean and comfortable. The bed curtains were great, along with a personal light and outlet. Big lockers under each bed. Staff were all so friendly and helpful to me, a first-time traveller. They took the time to help me find a bus, even printing out the timetable for me. Location is great, everything you probably want to see is within a 15 minute walk. Right near the bus station and tram too. I highly recommend and would definitely stay here again!

name: Anonymous
comment: I was impressed with this hostel because it is clean and very organized . It reminded me of living in the dormitory at my university. The staff was very helpful and kind. I would definitely stay here again

name: Anonymous
comment: My stay at Jacobs was a very pleasant time. Beds were nice with their own curtains/power outlets, good lockers, brekky was basic stuff but really good. Staff were very helpful and easy to talk to. Not much of a atmosphere when it comes to drinking as there's no drinking games or pub crawls that start at the hostel itself but they do team up with another pub crawl with a few different hostels. About a 10 minute walk from temple bar area. Security and facilities were very good

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff was amazing and helpful, privacy curtains were great with outlets, USB ports and lights for every bed, AND the bathrooms were cleaned EVERY DAY. By far the cleanest hostel I've ever stayed at with everything You could possibly need. The lobby area had books and games and all sorts of things to keep you entertains not to mention it was literally right next to the central bus station. It was quite crowded, but it didn't feel cramped at all. A+++

name: biohazard12353750
comment: Great hostel especially for the price. Rooms had lots of space and beds were semi comftorable. Having a bathroom in each dorm was a plus.

name: Anonymous
comment: It was one of the best hostels I've ever stayed in. The staff was very kind, the location was perfect and the rooms were very spacious and clean. I especially enjoyed the breakfast and the kitchen area. I would definetely use this hostel again if I come back to Ireland!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place! Loved the staff, location, and people we met! Great pub next door too :) and super well located!

name: Anonymous
comment: +: Decent location: near train and coach stations but a bit far from town centre - Easily accessible from airport via bus no. 747 Great privacy as each bunk comes with a curtain electricity outlet and USB charging ports -: Staff were unwilling to put my friend and I in the same bunk despite we were staying for only 1 night and the upper bunk remained empty on said night The 8-ppl rooms are located on the ground floor and therefore quite noisy due to people chatting loudly in the streets

name: abarber219
comment: Stayed here on a weekend so was a little expensive, but that's okay because beds were really comfy and the staff were super helpful!

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent hostel in a great location to explore Dublin. Very clean with friendly and helpful staff. We stayed as a group of 11 for 2 nights and really enjoyed our stay.

name: ChristinaJoy
comment: Lots of fun stuff to do/places to hang out in this hostel after a long day. They have a giant chess board with giant chess pieces that was fun to play with newly made friends!

name: Anonymous
comment: Was very plesently surprised at how good it was here. Very clean, with fantastic rooms. Beds were comfortable enough, staff were really really friendly. Will definitely be going back again. First ever hostel and needless to say it was a success :)

name: savannahhendry5671
comment: This hostel was very expensive for what it was. The location was not the greatest, there were some weird folk around and was a good walk to temple bar. The facilities we at par as they had curtains for the beds and charger & lights in the beds as well. They made me change rooms half way through my stay which was of annoyance, and I was unaware of at the time of booking. Would probably choose another hostel as this one wasn't worth the price.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great building, rooms, facilities and people! Didn't realise that check in wasn't until 11am but I could lock my luggage away, have breakfast and go on the free walking tour. The staff and visitors were lovely and there were games areas as well as quiet areas and eating areas. Can't fault it! Only about a 20 min walk to most of Dublin and the staff were keen to advise me on places to visit as I hadn't planned much!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good hostel. Great location. Nice atmosphere. Carla st the front desk was especially helpful a day friendly. It's a bit loud because of the proximity to taverns but ear plugs do the job.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good breakfast offered for free. Good wifi throughout whole hostel. Short walk to city centre area. Cage under bunks to lock away valuables.

name: Anonymous
comment: Overall, a great hostel: clean, strong security, a lot of commons areas. That said, it was crazy crazy hot in our 12-person room on the 2nd Floor, with no fans and just a small opening in the window available to us. That, combined with the loud noises from the street below and hallway, made it hard to sleep. If you're not looking for a party scene, this might not be the place for you. Also, fairly difficult to meet people in the commons areas compared to other hostels. Maybe 'cause it's so big?

name: Anonymous
comment: Pretty standard hostel. Great location and good value for money. Decent amount of space in rooms. Ensuite was clean but not enough for 12 people. (Extra showers and toilets are available). Ideal for someone wanting somewhere quite central just for sleeping in. There were a lot of groups of students staying when I was there. Lots of security doors.

name: Anonymous
comment: My time at Jacbons Inn was a good experience. Staff was helpful and knowledgeable, the hostel was clean and the bunks were nice with personal outlets and a reading light. The only downfall may be that it's too big so a little harder to socialize than other places I've stayed. Small room sizes were also a plus.

name: Anonymous
comment: So this hostel probably would have been better, but I went during summer and I quickly came to find out, Ireland is ill equipped for the heat. My big issue was the ventilation of the room. There were windows but they did not open. So you basically suffocated. However, apparently the 1st floor stayed nice and cool. So if you go during the summer, try to get a first floor room. Otherwise my stay was pretty nice. I would want to visit again during the winter next time

name: Anonymous
comment: Absolutely one of the best hostels in Dublin. If you're traveling to this city, don't think twice. Book here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, great location, super friendly staff, beautiful communal areas. The bunks had curtains and outlets for each bed. Overall terrific experience. Don't expect much from the breakfast though.

name: Anonymous
comment: This was my second time staying here, an just as good as he first. Clean, modern, plenty of outlets, clean bathrooms. Great place!

name: Anonymous
comment: We really enjoyed our stay at Jacob's inn. Great location, wonderful staff! Our room was really hot, though, and the pigeons were annoying, as we had to leave the window open for some air. Would definitely stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: I had a good stay at Jacobs Inn. It was conveniently located and well priced. Rooms were clean and quiet and breakfast was provided. Staff were very helpful.

name: Anonymous
comment: The location was not very good, which surprised me based on reviews. Not only was it at least a mile away from everywhere you wanted to go it was tucked away on a street that made it hard to find. It was very hard to get a cab back from Temple Bar late at night, and it wasn't a walk you would want to make on your own (not just the area, but the potential to get lost.) The top and bottom bunk were to close together, making the bottom horrible. Staff was nice however.

name: Anonymous
comment: The location and price were great but it wasn't the cleanest. It was not very modern at all. The rooms were SO HOT! There was no air conditioning and only a small window to let air in. When you walked into the rooms they were saunas. So uncomfortable to sleep in.

name: Anonymous
comment: I laid up here in the middle of my trip, and it was very good for that. Close to a couple stores, good breakfast, lots of charging ports in common areas (which is good because the one on my bunk was broken). It was enjoyable to relax at the hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff were super friendly and helpful. Our room was so comfortable and the bed was not creaky! And plus for the curtains and individual lights. Location was a little further from where we had stayed in the past in relation to town, but Dublin is really easy to move around in, so it was not an issue once we sorted the Google maps. Bathrooms were so nice! Secure, but really comfortable and relaxed vibe. Awesome hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great clean hostel, comfy beds. A little expensive (weekend stays are much more expensive) but would stay there again!

name: marcuslacy
comment: This hostel was splendid. Great hip atmosphere, kind and helpful staff, reasonably located, safe, and well priced. For first time visitors to Dublin, I highly recommend taking advantage of the various tours and pub crawls offered by Jacobs. Good time.

name: Anonymous
comment: Hands down one of the best Hostels I have stayed in. The rooms are great, enough space, privacy curtains, each bed has their own outlets. Everything is clean. As a solo female traveler I felt very safe staying here. Overall great!

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff are helpful, friendly and check in was very straightforward. I requested a lower bunk upon check in and they accommodated my request so thanks to the staff for that! Storage locker under bed was big enough to fit my mid size luggage and shoes which was appreciated. Lounge, games and atmosphere are decent. The location is not the best but not terribly bad either. It's a 15-20 minute walk to anywhere worth going in the city centre.

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel looks like a hotel, but in a bad way. There was a lot of groups of teenagers that interacted only among themselves. Not good for solo travelers, since there was a lack of hostel atmosphere.

name: Anonymous
comment: Although we were probably the oldest folks in the building by a couple decades, we had a wonderul time. This was the start of a 2-week Ireland trip. We took the Freedom Pass to get transport into the city from the airport and to explore Dublin. Jacob's Inn was centrally located and a cheerful, secure place to call home for a couple days. We were always welcomed by the staff and had the pleasure of meeting several of the young people staying there over breakfast. Thanks for all you do!

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a great hostel. Each bunk has its own charging station with USB ports and plugs, and a light and a shelf. Each bunk also comes with a curtain for privacy and an under-bed locker. Hairdryers available for 50 Euro cents in the bathrooms. Kitchens have place to store food and fill up water bottles. Nice, bright, updated facilities overall. Breakfast was mediocre (toast, corn flakes, coffee). Security was great though location was a bit dodgy at night. Short walk to bars on South side.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice hostel -- had no issues with it. The staff were really helpful and had some good recommendations as well.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay!! Not much of a hostel atmosphere. Lots of young kids staying here when we were there. But a pretty good location and good privacy in dorm rooms (full curtains on beds). Internet works great in rooms.

name: VictorMSanchez
comment: Very good hostel (very clean with large common areas and extra showers/bathrooms) we had a very good stay there because it is also very close to lively streets and pubs. I would definitely stay there again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Super experience. My first

name: Anonymous
comment: Good Hostel, nice location clean and useful facilities! Staff were very friendly! Curtain around bunks were an added bonus!

name: glibra
comment: Decent hostel in okay location, but if I was going back to Dublin I'd roll the dice on somewhere else. Pros: huge, nice kitchen; tons of common area seating; nice staff; newer facilities Cons: typical large hostel things - expect large groups of kids or older adults staying here. It's not easy to meet people unless they're in your room. Only TWO laundry machines for the whole hostel - don't expect to get ANY laundry done here. PUSH BUTTON SHOWERS - christ, those things are terrible.

name: Anonymous
comment: Just stayed for one night before flying out of Dublin. Bus to airport 1 block away. En suite bathroom was very nice and huge help to have outlets and privacy curtains on every bed. Will stay again if ever in Dublin.

name: mrerucha
comment: Great, updated facilities and friendly staff! Would highly recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: A clean, large hostel with many great facilities. Washrooms were a dream! A little out of the way from the main core but still walking distance.

name: Anonymous
comment: Decent stay. Big hostel with many groups so a bit different from a hostel vibe a solo traveller might be used to and difficult to meet people. Does the job for a place to sleep outside temple bar craziness.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best hostel I've ever stayed in! Very clean and very secure! I traveled as a solo female and I felt safe my entire stay.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Everything was really great. The rooms and corridors are slightly dated but this didn't affect the stay. The ensuite bathroom was really modern and the communal bathrooms down the corridor are very spacious and well-equipped including coin-operated blow-dryer and straightener.
 My only complaint would be that the new bathroom sinks have taps which are press-and-auto-release, which wasted a lot of water, especially if you just wanted to wet your toothbrush for example.

name: blakesam0001454
comment: I was highly impressed with this hostel!! The staff was very welcoming, and the security of the hostel was top notch!! Bathrooms were large and all the facilities were in great condition. Highly reccommend!!

name: Anonymous
comment: Courteous staff

name: Anonymous
comment: This was an excellent place to stay. I loved the curtains on the bed, they gave a aspect of privacy. Also loved the cages under the bed I felt like my gear was safe which helped me to relax. The staff were helpful but often did not seem very friendly. But apart from that it was a great place to stay and would stay there again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Better than your typical hostel, the environment is always lively. After coming from a stint in Asia, I forgot that bringing your own lock for the bins was common in hostels in Europe. Barring that personal faux-pas, everything was great. The space is HUGE.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really good experience in this hostel. Even though is not much of a fun/party hostel, I really recommend to stay here and I'll definitely come here again when I'm back at Dublin. Clean rooms, nice staff, really secure cages for the backpacks after checkout and is in a walking distance for the Pubs and touristic points of the city.

name: Anonymous
comment: Clean. Big lockers in room and locker room available before check in and after check out for free. Close to bus from airport but a bit away from the main sites. Easily walkable to Guiness and Jameson as well as Temple Bar and Trinity College.

name: mattpapineau129450
comment: Staff was awesome! They were Very helpful with providing insight into day tours and helping you book them. Rooms are clean. Showers in rooms are awesome. Beds are comfy. Lots of restaurants and foods spots around. I liked it so much I stayed there 2x during my trip through Europe.

name: kenzybrown
comment: There was very good security, although it seemed to be a bit overboard. Pretty good atmosphere, seemed to be a lot of groups so it was a bit hard to meet other solo travelers but there's lots of places to lounge and relax. The location was ok, walkable to public transportation, but the neighborhood it's in I would be just a tad more cautious. Overall good stay though!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice hostel, the rooms and bathrooms were very clean. The staff were nice upon checking in and there were numerous facilities around the property that were very nice. A good number of people went to the nightly pub crawl and it was very fun to meet everybody and hang out! I would definitely stay again, and the price was reasonable for the value as well.

name: Anonymous
comment: Pretty good place to stay if you're looking for cheaper accomodations in Dublin. Not very central, but the city is small enough that the walk is fine. Only complaint is the stag/hen parties - they get really rowdy and not fun if you're stuck in a room with them!

name: danashlomo429395
comment: Very good location, the staff were very nice and pleased to help in anything! Even though it was a 12 bed dorm it was just fine. Very recommended!

name: Anonymous
comment: I really loved staying here! It's a nice distance from the city center so that you aren't hearing people partying when you are trying to sleep but it's also just a short walk to Temple or Grafton for a night out. Staff was friendly and I found the room really comfortable and great value for the price!

name: Anonymous
comment: Super, super clean. Comfortable. Beds have nice privacy curtains and large storage lockers beneath. Staff was all really friendly and really helpful. Short walk to Temple Bar and some of the other highlights of Dublin (we walked to Guinness Storehouse in about 40 minutes). Breakfast is pretty minimal, but at least it's there. Definitely would recommend.

name: evanamauriz4306
comment: It felt more like being back in middle school than being at a hostel. Not a lot of amenities, like a community kitchen. More like a cafeteria and lots of really young kids. The location is great though and the beds are super comfy. It gets the job done if you're not looking for a "homey" feel.

name: avhall29
comment: Absolutely fantastic hostel. I talked to multiple members of the staff and every single one went out of their way to help me and get me to where I needed to go

name: Anonymous
comment: Really clean facilities, I was very satisfied with the security as well. Good wifi, and each bed had a light and somewhere to plug in. Very modern, and the rooms abd bathrooms were spacious. The free breakfast wasn't much, but free is free. I would definitely recommend this hostel to someone traveling.

name: Anonymous
comment: We were checked into the wrong room upon arrival and when we came back to our bunks the next day all of our stuff was just packed up into plastic bags and there were people in our beds. We went to the front desk and the people working were just flat out rude about the whole situation, never even said sorry. The location was okay but we had to walk about 20 min to get to the temple bar area.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place, good atmosphere!

name: Anonymous
comment: Fantastic place. Very nice and very clean great kitchen facilities.

name: Anonymous
comment: Except for one night where the power was not working in the rooms (meaning we couldn't charge our phones, which is essential in the 21st century and for travelling all day), everything else was pretty good.

name: beckmaea
comment: Stayed at Jacobs Inn for two nights; very clean, nice facilities. The location wasn't the most convenient, but it worked! The staff was very pleasant and had great suggestions!

name: Anonymous
comment: the night staff is terrible, very rude do not let you hang out in common areas. the breakfast bad as well. other than that, the place is very conveniently located, very safe and clean. the ladies at the front desk were awesome, the night guys are just rude.

name: Anonymous
comment: Fantastic hostel, great atmosphere and nice rooms. Would recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: Awesome hostel! Comfortable beds really clean and great atmosphere the free walking tour is also a most Keith are guide was fantastic already planning my next stay there

name: Anonymous
comment: Wasn't there for long. Good showers. Busy at brekkie. Helpful staff. 24 hour reception meant that we could rock up at 1am and check in.

name: Anonymous
comment: Friendly, attentive staff. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Recommend this hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment:
By far the best hostel that I have ever stayed in in Dublin. Clean, comfortable and centrally located. The staff were exceptionally nice to me as I arrived at a very awkward time to the hostel and my friends had already checked in hours previously (under the same booking).
 To top it all off, there was a fantastic spread laid out for breakfast in a cool common room

name: Anonymous
comment: A nice clean hostel with helpful staff... as it is quite a big hostel it's a bit hard to meet other solo travellers but it was a good stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel was clean, staff were friendly and the location was fine. It is about a 5-10 min walk to the central area and where all the sights are. The airlink bus is right by the hostel. This isn't a party hostel at all. At night if you come in late you need to have your security pass to get into your room. Having the curtains is great in the rooms and the cages are good to keep the rooms tidier. Breakfast was pretty good too - free granola and toast most days and sometimes eggs provided.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn worked perfectly for what we needed, a cheap place close to the city. The staff were helpful with giving directions. The only down side was that the shower only came on for 10 seconds at a time. You had to keep pushing the shower knob in to get any water.

name: michellec123
comment: For being my first time staying at a hostel, Jacobs Inn set the standard high. The staff were friendly, catered to my needs. The room were nice and clean, the bathrooms in the rooms were great. Rooftop area and games room was a good plus. Restaurants and bars within an easy walking distance. When I go back to Dublin, I'm definitely staying here again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Perfect location. The staff is super helpful! Definitely recommend it!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Pros- Awesome staff, perfect location for sightseeing and getting to-from the airport is easy with the express bus just outside the doors. Huge clean kitchen for diy cooking, super fast wifi and the bunk beds were clean and comfortable.
 
 Cons- Breakfast, while free was very limited. Some days they had eggs, other days no. Leaving you with toast and a choice of two cereals.

name: Anonymous
comment: There were a lot of great common areas and I loved the big kitchen! Free breakfast and curtains on the bed were also pluses :)

name: Ejchristner
comment: Overall, it was a great stay. The beds were comfy enough and the common area a fun place. The doors and walls were thin so every time someone came home loudly we could hear them. Also, breakfast was a bit slim in choice. But the staff were helpful and getting to and from the airport to the hostel was easy. Literally had an airlink stop on the end of the street. I would stat again if I was back in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's inn was fantastic! The facilities are almost all brand new, purpose-built for a hostel, and really spacious. The location isn't perfect in terms of Dublin sightseeing, but it's an easy 5 or 10 minute walk. I strongly recommend this hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay and great location!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place! Location was good and able to walk everywhere. The pub crawl was a blast. Staff at the hostel were awesome!! Very clean.

name: Anonymous
comment: Decent hostel, we really enjoyed the curtains and the facilities. The ensuite bathroom was very nice and clean. However, one of us got a fungus from the bedsheets. The night before we had a flight out we spoke to the staff about booking a airport shuttle. They confirmed they booked it, but the next morning our shuttle driver had no record of our booking. It was an early flight and we ended up having to take an Uber.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best hostel I've been to yet. Spacious, great facilities, very clean, good location. Shockingly good value for money.

name: Anonymous
comment: Superb hostel in an ideal location. It's close to the centre of Dublin and to the main modes of transport. I loved the little shelf with a light, plug sockets and charging ports above my bed. And the curtain for extra privacy was a great touch. My only grievance was that the toilet was clogged in the bathroom for 24 hours and the bathroom I was in looked like it hadn't been cleaned during my stay. Other than that the facilities were good, the staff were friendly and I got a good nights sleep.

name: abpiotro8967
comment: Jacobs inn was a great stay conveniently located next to the city center bus stop. Their written directions were a bit confusing as there are very poor road signs in the city. Would recommend mapping "giant spire in Dublin to Jacobs inn hostel Dublin". Any bus you take from the airport will drop you off at this huge spire in the city center. Can't miss it and it's a good reference landmark. Would stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Couldn't ask for more!

name: Anonymous
comment: Pretty decent hostel. Nice, large kitchen and large refrigerator. Safe and had cool amenities. Wish there was more interaction between guests. Wasn‚Äôt as easy to make friends here as compared to other hostels I‚Äôve stayed at. Very friendly staff, clean room and and overall nice stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really loved this hostel! So much room to hangout and plan for your time in ireland that was not just from your room. The beds were set up to give each guest a great amount of privacy. Staff was warm and welcoming, truly seemed to care about your trip and helping you out with any questions. Would stay again and highly recommend to anyone.

name: Anonymous
comment: I felt very safe and met a lot of great friends there. The free tour was incredible and so was the pub crawl!

name: Anonymous
comment: Lovely staff, Wifi worked great in rooms, Friendly staff, central location, beds were comfy they had a curtain around them to block out light, the kitchen was full sized (organized and clean)

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel based on location and security. If you're looking for partying this wouldn't be the place but good for a night or two for reasonably priced accomodation

name: MiriahRalston
comment: Great hostel close to everything in Dublin! Staff is friendly and accommodating. Halls to get quite loud at night and they do not enforce their quiet hours. Good amenities, and their free breakfast (toast, jam, eggs, cereal, juice) is great!

name: Anonymous
comment:
A great place to stay with friendly and helpful staff.
 Remember to bring a lock with u for security of your luggage .

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel if you wanna rest and don't have to deal with young people chatting next to your head in the dorms.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best hostel I stay in while in Dublin. Privacy curtains, decent breakfast, personal lockers in your room, and clean. I would book there again.

name: Anonymous
comment: I am so happy I stayed and this hostel and will again in the future! Very large, modern, and secure. Someone warned me that it is just slightly out of the better parts of town, but it was fine and I actually appreciated the location because it was closer to the main bus stop I needed and to a couple of pubs that weren't as packed as the city centre (so I could chill and read). The early AM airport shuttle was clutch and they were great at directing me around. Very happy.

name: Anonymous
comment: I was very impressed with this hostel! By far the nicest facilities, amenities, and cleanliness I have encountered at a hostel. Wifi works great everywhere, free security lockers in rooms and for day storage, tons of bathrooms (and most rooms have ensuite bathrooms) so never a wait to shower. USB, power plugs, and reading lights at every bed. Great value for the money and the staff was always very kind and helpful. Will definitely come back the next time I visit Dublin!

name: Anonymous
comment: I was in a 12 girls mix and it had a really weird atmosphere. Most people were hiding behind their curtains and unfriendly, lights off at 8 PM, and people checking in at all hours of the night. My friend ans I felf uncomfortable whenever we were in the room. The staff was rude, I asked for an employee to call a cab for us to a location that is about a 20 minute walk and he told us we could just walk, though my friend has serious mobility issues and that was not an option.

name: marceljepson
comment:
Cons:
 Not very friendly staff. We eventually didn't want to even talk to them at the front desk anymore. They didn't even give us an overview of the hostel. 
 The hostel had a lot of unattended children running and around and yelling. It was hard to enjoy the hostel. 
 The construction starts early in the morning (8 a.m). 
 Staff provided us incorrect information about tours. . 
 
 Pros:
 The breakfast was okay.. However, they start to pack it up before the end time.
 It's a safe hostel

name: Anonymous
comment: Fantastic facilities and security! Not the best location but right by excellent public transportation to take you wherever you want to go. The one staff member we interacted with was not very helpful, but we are sure that's not the norm. Highly recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: I didn't really enjoy this hostel. It seemed more like a hotel vibe or a college dorm. There were huge groups of teenagers or school groups staying there and they were extremely loud.

name: Dhallock
comment: Was my first trip over seas and my first ever hostel, I won't lie this hostel far exceeded my expectations fantastic hostel I recommend to anyone and everyone.

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel was fine but there were so many young kids running around in the hallways on a class trip. There teacher tried to get them to be quiet but they were still loud. It was clean and good beds but if you are a solo backpacker looking to meet people then this is more a hotel it felt like.

name: Anonymous
comment: My stay at Jacob's Inn was great. The staff were very nice and also very helpful with any questions that I had. Never once did I question my safety while staying at Jacob's Inn. I checked in before my room was ready but I was able to store my luggage in a locked locker which was very convenient. In each room, there are cubbies underneath the beds with plenty of room to lock your luggage away while you are out and about. The hostel is very close to the tram and an easy walk to central locations!

name: Anonymous
comment:
First experience of staying in a hostel. Very impressed with Jacobs Inn. 
 
 Shared and en-suite bathroom was very clean. Each bed has a curtain for privacy, light, two plug sockets, two usb ports and a lockable understorage basket underneath (bring your own padlock). Stayed in a 12 bed mixed dorm and had a fantastic nights sleep. Breakfast was amazing with cereal, toast, tinned fruit and a selection of hot and cold drinks. Highly recommended and will be back next year.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very accessible location and the staff were excellent!

name: Anonymous
comment: This isn't the best place to stay if you're trying to party a lot, but as a single woman traveler i loved it. I still heard people getting a bit rowdy, but I was in a quiet all girl's room so it wasn't bad. Its very safe and clean too. If you're traveling alone & are there to travel but maybe not so much party, its a great place to stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very clean and secure hostel, with great staff. Not super close to the main attractions in Dublin though.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn Hostel was a great hostel in a great location! It was so easy getting from the airport to the hostel, the bus stop is right out front! The hostel is very spacious and does not feel cramped or over crowded. They have great amenities and after a long day, me and my friend loved that they gave us the remote to the T.V. to watch a movie on Netflix! They were very welcoming and the atmosphere of the place was great.

name: Anonymous
comment: I highly recommend this hostel due to the location. its 5 minutes walking to the temple bar. The hostel itself its really clean and the staff are helpful. The security is really good, almost every door you have to use a key card provided by them.

name: Anonymous
comment: Was put into a dorm with a group of 10 rude and inconsiderate girls who came back in the middle of the night screaming and yelling so did not get any sleep. There was not enough storage space so I was forced to leave my suitcase out.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really nice hostel, stay here again

name: Anonymous
comment: Just a note - you're in a city - you're with young people - there is going to be noise! Expect it, roll with it, and if it goes on too long, the staff at the front desk will be the 'bad guy'. The folks on staff are AMAZINGLY helpful.....

name: Anonymous
comment:
I have mix reviews for this hostel. 
 Pro are(clean, safe, location is good, beds are great) 
 Con (to many lock doors, hard to meet or talk to people because of it, way to big this hostel. 
 It's great place if you want a clean comfortable bed for a night.

name: Anonymous
comment: The location was amazing. Very easy to find and close to many pubs if you are interested in that. And it was only about a 20 minute walk away from more. The staff were very nice and helpful. The pub crawl they offer for 12‚Ç¨ was amazing. I met a lot of new people and became good friends with them. It was very well organized. I would definitely stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Maintaining its usual high standard. Always a pleasure to stay here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Overall a good hostel. Relatively cheap and in a great location within walking distance to everything but away from the noise and drama of temple bar. The hostel is huge and has a lot of groups of younger students (I swear I saw like 50 kids under the age of 15), so the atmosphere wasn't great even with all the awesome facilities. I would stay here again, but its not the greatest hostel for a solo traveler trying to meet people.

name: Anonymous
comment: Hi everything is perfect. The kitchen is huge and we love it! It's only far from the main area of the city.

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent place to stay. Breakfast was nice and the location was great. One suggestion purchase celllphone ear buds to mufflle noise from the guest.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Good stay here, the doors to my room weren't cut well for the frame so they only slammed closed, which was annoying. 
 But overall it was a good location, and a good hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent stay and great staff. The only downside was the showers and the fact you had to keep Turning them back on every minute but it wasn‚Äôt really a big deal. Other than that we had a great experience. Dublin is a beautiful city. Highly recommended

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel in the city centre of Dublin. Lots of activities were offered me there was tons of space to sit and meet new people. Will say the security pass is a bit bizarre. Not sure why exactly you need to keep a tiny receipt with you at all times, but at least you know your items are safe. Free breakfast was minimal but nice to have if you can wake up for it! Overall a great place to stay and would recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel. The only thing I would say it that because of its large size, the experience with the staff felt more like interactions in a hotel than hostel. Friendly enough but not very personal feeling.

name: Anonymous
comment: I had a good stay, very nice hostel, clean, organize, staff are friendly.

name: Anonymous
comment: Within walking distance of temple bar area, trinity college and Dublin Castle. great staff!

name: Anonymous
comment: Really incredible facilities, many options for public areas. Perfect location, right next to busaras anc Connelly station, and close to all the great Dublin attractions. Modern amenities, rooms and bathrooms are very big and clean. ,

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay in the heart of Dublin. The really close proximity to the bus and train stations made getting around a breeze. 24 hour staff at the desk was ideal in maintaining a great standard at this busy location. The dorms were clean and well organized and I liked that each bunk was fitted with a privacy curtain, outlet and a light bar with USB charging option. The self service kitchen was well organized and I appreciated being able to lock my luggage up hours before check in.

name: Anonymous
comment: This was my first time staying at a hostel, so naturally I was nervous. but jacob's inn put my worries aside. the beds were super comfy! loved the privacy curtains and the under the bed storage. it's a little hard to get to if you're in a car, but walking to it is easy! it's centrally located to a lot of great restaurants and it's a quick walk to the temple bar area! would definetly stay again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Really nice hostel, very secure, clean, nice free breakfast, helpful staff and great location.

name: Anonymous
comment: clean, okay location. Staff are not the friendliest/most helpful, upon arrival I had to ask literally 100 questions because they don't tell you anything! They give you a small reciptices when you check in, make sure you keep it because security will ask for it when you come in late at night. Pillows and duvets are paper thin, there were a load of large groups (many looked young under 16) I wouldn't recommend to solo travellers. Maintenance on the building which they failed to mention.

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent hostel. Just perfect. Best bunk bed ever. I've never stayed in a better hostel than this one. Love it. I'd definitely come back

name: Anonymous
comment: Not the best location, but nice staff and its a safe hostel. I will repeat there.

name: Anonymous
comment: The worst part was the creaky bed frames but even that was manageable.

name: Anonymous
comment: Have stayed here several times. Would recommend

name: Anonymous
comment:
Pros: The building has all the facilities you need, the receptionist are usually friendly and in a good mood. Cons: There are way to many security doors and a very unfriendly security check at night, vending machines don't give change and the kitchen is closed almost 12 hours a day. 
 Avoid if you are a solo traveler, the hostel is prepared to host groups.

name: Anonymous
comment: Exquisite hostel in Dublin. It's defo worth the extra money for a nice nights sleep. WiFi works in all rooms and the free brekkie is very good.

name: Anonymous
comment: I would recommend this hostel to anyone

name: Anonymous
comment: Airlink bus stop and the main bus station w connections all over Ireland around the corner, 15 min walk to Temple bar, 5 min to main shopping areas. A big hostel with many dorms. Stayed in female 10-dorm ensuite. Spacious room. Very few hangers (as usual), big locker under bunk bed, big clean bathroom. Paper thin walls, you heard if someone sneezed two rooms down, thin pillows. Curtains and outlets. Basic breakfast included. Big kitchen and dining room. Good wi-fi. I'd stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: im a regular visitor here and i must say it was very plesant. I was very late coming in and room i bookedwas a topbunk. I counldnt climb so the excellent guy on reception changed my room and gave me my request. Excllent mannered and so inderstanding. This is what makes it plesant for us. Breakfast was nice and bathroom and room was very clean.

name: Anonymous
comment: This was a typical big city hostel. Large enough that you don't really meet other people unless they are in your room. Free breakfast, but the eating area felt like a high school cafeteria. The beds were comfy and have cool privacy drapes, but none of that matters if drunk people are allowed to yell in the halls. The ensuite shower was very convenient. All of this should be taken with a grain of salt though because I'm just not a "big city hostel" traveler. But I feel like most people aren't..?

name: Anonymous
comment: Right next to bus station, perfect for late night/early morning arrivals. Large facility. Great security. Clean. And clean bathrooms. Excellent hot water! Unfortunately, there were many teens there during my stay. To no fault of the hostel, but made my experience a bit unpleasant, as I had to ask a number of girls while in the shower/bathroom to stop throwing their stuff on mine while showering/getting ready. And I missed breakfast by 1 min (9:30 end) & was turned away. That was a bit of bummer.

name: cocosaysno
comment: Very nice staff, good location. Would stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: One of the most impressive hostels I've ever stayed in. Lots to do. Good kitchen and breakfast, beautiful dorms.

name: Anonymous
comment: Everything about this place was great. I was a little sketched out when i was walking up to the door at first but after that initial weird feeling i realized it was the people i happened to walk by. The employees there were amazing and the pub crawl was a great time. would definitely come back again

name: Anonymous
comment:
Stay over renovating time, quite noisy in the morning, start construction early in around 7.20 am, quite disturbing for people need more sleep.
 shower is hot enough and its nice to have shower and toilet in each room.
 hairdryer(50p per use) in the shower is broken, but can borrow it from reception with ID for free.

name: Anonymous
comment: Typical hostel with some games to keep you busy but pool table was junk and it gets very quiet and boring at night. Not a fun atmosphere on weekends but kitchen was huge.

name: Anonymous
comment: While the facilities at Jacob's Inn perfectly suited our needs, we found the staff to be particularly inattentive and at times rude. When my friend and I returned to the hostel one night, we were met with the security guard, who asked to see our security passes. While I had mine, my friend had lost hers. When we told the security guard she didn't have hers, he rudely pointed to the door and said she couldn't come in. He offered no help to us at all, and he was extremely rude.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best place to stay.

name: jangmisiv
comment: Jacobs Inn was our first hostel for our backpacking trip that we just started two weeks ago. Jacobs inn MOST DEFINITELY set the bar HIGH. Now that I have been around different countries and various hostel within similar price line, close to city center and the reviews, by far, jacobs inn was the best. Very friendly local staffs, Very very good security, clean, each bed has outlets/usb charge/reading lights, curtain for privacy. They know what travelers need while traveling. üëå

name: Anonymous
comment: Solid location. Not so easy to meet other people as solo traveler. Good staff, was able to accommodate my request to switch rooms after a group of English guys were loud coming back to the room at 3AM. Overall solid choice and pretty good location but not a party hostel by any means.

name: Anonymous
comment: Fun staff, huge hostel, but easy to meet people and have a good time. They have basically everything you'd want in a hostel, comfy beds, information, tvs, board games, efficient breakfast, kitchen facilities. Can't complain!

name: Anonymous
comment: My first hostel that I have ever stayed at and Jacobs inn could not have been a better place! From its amazing facilities that are clean to its wonderfully helpful staff members, I couldn't have asked for a better first hostel. And the breakfast here is simple but great - they even had boiled eggs and these amazing croissants. There are lockers in each room for your security, which was comforting. So many other security features! Absolutely amazed!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice hostel, good location, good breakfast and staff.

name: Anonymous
comment: Went in off season so atmosphere was lacking but can hardly blame the hostel. Breakfast was brilliant. Organised tours were popular. The only thing that bought the rating down is the toilet flooded extensively on more than one occasion over the course of 2 nights. Flooded bathroom and into the dorm room. Wasn't resolved while we were there and we weren't compensated which was a shame.

name: Anonymous
comment: The location score was pretty misleading. This is definitely not as close to the action as it seemed to be. That being said it's only a 15-20 minute walk to the temple bar area (although some local streets are much cheaper and more fun). You definitely get your money's worth from this hotel though. The facilities, security, and staff were fabulous and even though you're on the north side of town, it's still a reasonable walking distance for a much better price.

name: Anonymous
comment: Was only there for 1 night before i flew out, but from what i saw place was clean and quite busy. Rooms were big and beds were good.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a big hostel. There is a lot of guests everywhere in the building but we feel safe and it was not too noisy. The breakfast is inclusive and good. The room was clean. I find the price quite expensive but it is Dublin and the hostel is very well located.

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff not very helpful or nice,I was there early in the day for the checkin and I asked for a lower bed (there were a lot empty in the room I was assigned to) but they wouldn't change it saying it won't work (it shouldn't affect if they switched the assignments of 2 beds in the same room).The sockets at each bed are very weird with a bump at one end so my adapter didn't fit,they weren't helpful about this either.Shower is the type where you get only a few seconds water then need to push again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good hostel! Wonderful stay. I truly recommend it!!

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel was great! I highly recommend it. The only downside was the English rugby player that I shared the room with were very laid late at night but that was not the hostels fault

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel itself was great but the staff, particularly the night staff, was bad. My friends and I checked out in the morning and left to spend our last day in the city. We had a flight the next morning at 6:00am so we did not want to go to sleep that night. The Jacob's Inn staff would not let us sit in the seating area for two hours before we had to leave for the airport. Then, when we were waiting for a taxis they would not let us sit on the couches. This is not a way to treat paying customers

name: qu33ns13
comment: Jacob's Inn is a nice value for the room rate. The hostel is very lively with many different types of travelers. The common spaces always have a crowd and there's plenty of seating for eating, working at your laptop, or sharing conversation with others. The 6-bed bunk rooms are quite good. The mattresses and duvets are comfortable, but our pillows were fairly thin. The ensuite bathroom was clean enough and in good condition. The kitchen is the best part of the hostel with lots of seating.

name: Anonymous
comment: Possibly the most well-equipped hostel you will step into. Each room was spacious, despite mine having 12 beds, there was still plenty of space to move around. Each bed has a functioning security locker, will require your own padlock though. Each room has its own clean toilet that looks like a hotel's. If that one is occupied, a bigger shared toilet can be found in the corridor. All shower facilities working. Staff were always helpful and friendly.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good value for money

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed at Jacob's Inn for 5 nights, and I really enjoyed my stay! The room was comfortable, the beds had little privacy shades, there were under-bed lockers, the shower had good water pressure, the wifi worked well...
