The only complaint I might have is that I had to move to a different room because they were so full they needed me to move, but even that wasn't really an issue, especially since I stayed for so many nights.

name: Anonymous
comment: The atmosphere at the hostel is great, there are a lot of tables to sit down and eat or just chill. They have a game room, a nice kitchen. They have a really NICE breakfast (for a hostel) with coffee, juice, milk, cereals, bread, butter and the most important of all a lot of NUTELLA. The reception staff is indifferent, they were not rude but not kind at all. There was a HUGE spider on my towels (bring your own), the room was O.K. The hostel is expensive for what is provides.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very big hostel, not easy to connect to other people, but overall a good place to sleep

name: Anonymous
comment: Big comfy beds and very clean. Great wifi and each bed has access to charging ports after a long day of exploring as well as safe lockers. Great vibe and a big mix of different people. Definitely would love to come back in the future!

name: Anonymous
comment: Everything was alright nothing special

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location and comfortable atmosphere. Everything is suitable for tourists.

name: Anonymous
comment: Desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. I very much appreciated the free towels and, especially, free luggage storage. I thought breakfast was cleared a bit too quickly, having gotten downstairs just before 9:30. Since many of us are late to bed and late risers, extending breakfast until 10 would be a kindness. Security was excellent. There are keycard entries all through the building so noone could just slip in easily.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Lovely place, it is a bit of a walk to temple bar but there's a tram stop right around the corner.
 Place is very clean and modern and the staff are super friendly and helpful. Comfy beds and clean bathrooms. Great value for money.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel! Super friendly staff, comfortable, nice common spaces. Would definitely stay again.

name: backpacktravelprodotcom
comment: Staff here were really friendly and helpful. The hostel is massive and has all types of guests including regular travellers, stag and hen parties, and also large groups of children. Because of this, plus the location, it can be quite noisy at night and in the mornings so make sure you have ear plugs. A number of the built in bunk bed lights/plugs didn't work, but there were enough wall sockets nearby for charging. The kitchen was always very clean but had a weird smell - possibly cleaning agent.

name: Anonymous
comment: I really liked it there, even though i didnt lock my suitcases, i wasnt even scared people would steal from me. The atmosphere was great

name: Anonymous
comment: I had a great experience here. The hostel had great security as you had to have the key to get in to every door. The lounge area was nice and comfortable, and the room was comfortable and clean. The room I chose was a 4 bed room and we had our own bathroom, which was nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was pretty good, I could walk the a lot of the main places, shops, and restaurants, and the bus from the airport dropped me right around the corner from the hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: This place is fantastic. Stay here!

name: Anonymous
comment: Big hostel but with a great standard! Good facilities and cleanliness! Atmosphere was good. However, one should be aware that this hostel seems to be favored by younger people / school classes (at least during the holiday season).

name: Anonymous
comment: Great staff, very helpful, a solo traveller so was worried about sharing a room, I had one roommate who smelled really bad but nothing they can do about it. The only problem I had was my key didn't work for some doors so had to keep asking them to help me out but they did. I was wasted most of the time and they had no problem with that and still helped with whatever I needed, I would stay again just better luck of roommates.

name: paisano0506
comment: They are located about half a mile East from O'Connell Bridge near Busaras station. The place has a kitchen with big refrigerators to keep your groceries. They also have a laundry (‚Ç¨3 washer/dryer) and free cages to store your belongings even after check out (12 hour limit). Not all beds have curtains or an individual light/charging station but the shared bathroom is in the room. They don't have a bar but offer many options like day trips, walking tours and even a pub crawl (crawl fast).

name: Anonymous
comment: Everyone is really great but of the three nights I was there my key card stopped working four times. Also, there were some lads playing football in the halls well past the quiet curfew at 11. Outside of those two things, my stay was great.

name: Anonymous
comment:
After speaking to a few other backpackers, a few of us were made to swap rooms up to 3 times within a week. Perhaps better organizing of bed allocation needs to be looked at. 
 However It is a great clean hostel!!

name: curubetancourt
comment: It was a great stay, my only complaint was that after the firts of two nights thay made us check out and then check in into another room. They shoul really have a better booking system or be more organized in that sense.

name: sarapdl
comment: Stayed in a mixed dorm. Beds were clean and comfortable. Under bed lockers were great. Shower had good pressure and hot water, which I enjoyed. Ensuite had an odd smell but was clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. It's a large hostel and had many giant groups of young kids on tour (ages 13-16), so it's definitely not for anyone looking for a calm stay - more of a loud stay with people slamming doors at all hours.

name: Anonymous
comment: Amazing stay. Awesome, helpful staff. Very cool atmosphere, great location, great luggage room and room was great with a curtain for privacy. My personal lamp and plug socket on my bed didn't work but plenty of other plugs to use. Very secure with key cards. Loved my stay at this hostel. Would recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: Facilities were great but this hostel seems to have mostly groups of teenagers and partyers (as opposed to backpacker/journeyers).

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location nice food friendly nice staff

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved the place. I'll be back again this Thursday. Very comfortable

name: Anonymous
comment: It's a great hostel, massive! Excellent facilities, great location. I would say however, that it always seems with larger hostels, the "hostel" atmosphere is lost. For example, this place tended to have a lot of children (nothing against children, they want to travel too), but when you're in the kitchen with 20 kids cooking at the same time, it's not your typical hostel experience. So it's great for a nice, clean place to stay with great facilities, but a party hostel atmosphere won't be found.

name: Anonymous
comment: Added to one of the best weekends ever for my stag do. Thank you Jacobs inn!!!!

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's Inn was an "okay" hostel. Their pillows are thin as paper. One shower I used the water only remained on for 7 seconds before you had to push the button again. And I even though I booked a seven night stay, I was forced to change rooms after two days. (Something that happen to a male in the same room, but not the females.) This meant I had to check out and recheck back in, so I didn't have access to a room I paid for during this time.

name: Anonymous
comment: The curtains and the charging stations on the beds are the bomb! The kitchen is very nice, the only thing is it smells like cheese. This place is always very clean and has really helpful staff! Love how there's lots of bathrooms throughout the building.

name: Anonymous
comment: Cool hostel, very neat and new. I stayed at another hostel in Dublin and much preferred this one.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good place to stay, the only trouble is the bathroom in the room gets a bit rank and its a bit noisy at night every thing else was good though. Staff were friendly the wifi worked well and the kitchen is well stocked.

name: Anonymous
comment:
I really enjoyed the place. But I must say one thing about it. If you want to have a shower you have "wonderful" choices...
 You can choose the option A, a private bathroom in your room which have one advantage, you can choose the temperature of the water WHAT A LUXURY. But each time you push the button the water flow for 5 wonderful seconds.
 You can choose the option B, the public bathroom, with 3 showers. And what do we have here?We have plenty of water BUT only at the temperature to boil pasta

name: isella27
comment: I feel like in home. The rooms are quite big and the bed very confortable. The livingroom is very nice with many facilities. Breakfast very good.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel. I was only here for a night, but good location and facilities were fine.

name: Anonymous
comment: I loved my time at Jacob's Inn! Staff was friendly and helpful, place was in a good location, rooms were clean, all in all a 10/10. My only complaint is that I wasn't there for longer :(

name: Anonymous
comment: Stayed here during St. Patrick's Day. Crazy busy but the staff managed to stay friendly and very helpful. Beds were comfy and have the privacy curtain üëå facilities were awesome as well

name: Anonymous
comment: Good value and near the bus station. Basically a converted hotel, so the facilities are nice but the atmosphere is a little impersonal.

name: charleshill4119
comment: Nice hostel, ridiculously surged prices for St. Patrick's Day. Location isn't terrible but not worthy of praise. Very secure hostel, with key-card needed to go anywhere.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice hostel with very good security. I appreciated all of the different spaces that encouraged mingling. It was also very nice having USB ports on each of the beds. The bathrooms weren't great but not bad either, typical hostel bathroom. Overall, a great experience.

name: Anonymous
comment: Extremely well facilitated hostel. Panels above each bed with a power point, USB points and a light was a definite plus.

name: Anonymous
comment: We stayed at Jacobs inn for 2 nights in a 4 bed room. We didn't think it was anything special , functional, and simply served its purpose. It is a bit of a walk to many of the attractions, perfect to burn all of those Guinness calories ;)

name: Anonymous
comment: Love the charging capabilities. Bed was very comfortable. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. They let us lock up our suitcases before and even after check-out. There could have been a few more offerings for breakfast, but our stay was great. I would stay here again

name: Anonymous
comment:
Great hostel close to city center. The place was very clean and the security measures amazing. 
 Great breakfast and very nice rooms, with light and electric outlets in each bed. The only complain was the bathroom: only one bathroom for a room of 12 people, with all the facilities in one single space (shower, toilet, hand washer), so it wasn't very useful after all. 
 Overall, great place.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Pros:- security: strict door control, access to each area only by card 
 - one min walk from Busaras bus station, Connelly train station, Airlink stop for airport. 
 - markets and shops of all sizes, all around
 - beautiful roof terrace
 - rooms, toilets, common areas: spot clean! 
 Cons: - one shower for 10 persons is never enough...
 - the free walking tour meets at 10.10 but you spend one hour picking people from other hostels. actual tour (really enjoyable!) starts at 11 from Ireland Bank.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great experience! Would stay here again next time.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very big hostel, which I think makes it a little more difficult to meet people because there were so many large groups. Common bathrooms could be a tad bit cleaner. Rooms were clean. Curtains/charging ports for each bed were nice. Free walking tour and pub crawl were both great. Staff was nice- but nothing beyond the ordinary. Common areas were cool. Location: 15 min walk to Temple Bar- there are closer hostels to the action but it's not bad. Very close to bus station. I'd recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs inn has by far been my favorite hostel to stay. The staff are great, the location is convenient for the LUAS, and the place is gorgeous and clean. Each room has their own private bathroom with shower. There are only communal showers on each floor, and not toilets -- you use the one in your room or on the main floor. There is a rooftop patio which is great. The free breakfast is toast, cereal, oatmeal, canned fruit, juice, coffee, milk. The beds are comfy and the privacy curtain is key.

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent staff, location and facilities. The staff work round the clock to keep 5 floors clean. Only negative feedback is that we had builders banging at 8am in the morning next to our room, however you can't hear anything on on the top floors.

name: Anonymous
comment:
I would stay here again.
 Very well run hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Had such an amazing time- met some fantastic people in our room and the staff are super helpful and friendly. Would 100% return.

name: Anonymous
comment: I love Jacob's Inn Hostel! Everyone's bed has curtains, outlets, and your own light. Plus luggage cages under the beds. Every door has keycard access which can be annoying downstairs but it feels extremely secure. There is a lot to do within walking distance and I really enjoyed the free walking tour that picked us up from the hostel. I'd DEFINITELY go back anytime I'm in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: much better stay than the last time the hostel is having refurbishment work at the moment the whole reception area has had a rejig with the breakfast area moved to the other side the reception staff were more helpful and friendlier than the last time i stayed .A young lady on reception helped me with my printing for the Guinness store house and the handyman fixed a problem with my television also the night receptionist and a lady who looked like maybe housekeeping manager were both friendly

name: Anonymous
comment: During my stay there was A LOT of indoor construction going on within the hostel, but I was not notified by staff ahead of time so awoke to hammers and machinery in the morning. Wish I had known about it before checking in. Otherwise, great spaces for sitting, reading, socializing, big kitchen to cook in and friendly staff. Great location!

name: Anonymous
comment: Not much of a social atmosphere for solo travellers. Lots of big groups stay here (one group of 80 people!). Staff is always there to help and answer questions but don't interact with guests and just sit behind the desk. Facilities are clean but you need to push the button for the shower every 10 seconds or so.

name: Anonymous
comment: Super hostel with great facilities, about 5 minutes walking from O'Connell Street and Henry Street and maybe 15 minutes to Trinity College; also, the airline bus coming from the airport stops right around the corner and Connolly Station is to be reached within 1 minute, in case you plan to do a day trip to Howth, for example. Very clean and well equipped kitchen; nice lobby and other common room areas to meet other travellers - would definitely recommend it for other and come back here myself!

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs inn is warm, friendly, clean, and lively. For our first hostel experience, it definitely set the bar high! Staff are friendly and beyond helpful, the environment is comfortable and homey, I loved that there was plenty of pamphlets and information available to individuals to plan their days in Ireland. There's an amazing coffee shop right within the building and access to tickets and transportation. Thank you Jacobs Inn for being a great contributor to an amazing stay in Ireland!

name: Anonymous
comment: It was my first time staying at hostel. I'm used to staying at 3 stars to 5 stars hotels but I wanted to give hostel stay for the experience and you can't beat the cheap price. The staff was nice but didn't provide me with a lot of detail when I first arrived. I came early in the morning and I was allowed to store my backpack in a secure locker but you have to supply your own lock. I stay in the female room. The place was really secure and wifi was good. I like the privacy curtain for each bed.

name: Anonymous
comment: Each bed has its own light, usb point and plug and pruvacy curtain + locker. Everything was also super clean. Lots of common space. A short walk to Temple Bar

name: tkelly4
comment: This was my first time staying in a hostel! I didn't know what to expect by Jacobs Inn blew my expectations out of the water. Everything was clean and I felt very safe there

name: Anonymous
comment: Really nice hostel. Lots of card swipe doors so felt very secure, lockers under the bed. Ensuite and then more bathrooms and showers every second floor for each gender. Staff were nice. Great game room, cafe, tv. Easy to meet other people. A bit of a long walk into temple bar and the busy parts of the City. Good place to meet other travellers.

name: Anonymous
comment: A school group were staying there unsupervised. Teacher was two floors away. Teenagers were loudly yelling running from room to room, pretending to not understand nightman. Staff member handled it well before t shouldn't have to do it alone. Teacher was rude. Manger didn't really mind the next day. Pity everything else is great especially the location but ended up feeling like I was in daycare.

name: Anonymous
comment: Decent hostel, made better by curtains on the beds. Pretty standard.. would recommended.

name: Anonymous
comment: The rooms were always clean, the beds were comfortable, and the atmosphere was fabulous! Kind staff, too. Couldn't have asked for better!

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff was very helpful. Facilities are fine although the bathroom we had (6p room) was a bit old.

name: Anonymous
comment: Common areas are nice, staff is great, security was great, 10-15 minute walk to most places you want to see. However, the rooms kinda smelled and the bathrooms definitely needed to be cleaner

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel was easy to find and within walking distance to many attractions. However, for single travellers it may not be the best choice if you are looking to meet people because the hostel is very large and seems to mostly contain very large groups. Additionally, the bathroom should have had a bit more cleaning.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn is in a good location, close to Connelly Bridge! The staff are helpful and the included breakfast is a nice extra. The beds are great. They come with privacy curtains and have a charging outlet. My one problem with this hostel is the bathrooms. The bathrooms were not in good condition. I really liked this hostel except for the bathrooms.

name: Anonymous
comment: The only issue I had was that in the rooms you could hear a lot of what was going on the hallways so sometimes it was annoying. The kitchen and lounges were great, rooms and bathroom as well. The breakfast was ok. Location was really good as well, just around the corner from were the Airlink bus leaves you. Overall it was a nice hostel to stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: Can't go wrong staying here. Good for both groups and solo travelers. The staff is incredibly helpful and very knowledgable about the city. Not the cheapest hostel, however the extra couple euros a night is absolutely worth it.

name: dlmichel
comment: I only stayed for 2 nights and it was my first hostel experience. It was a great place to stay. Right next to the bus station and the city is really walkable. Tons of stores and places to eat in every direction you go. Staff is super friendly and helpful! I would definitely stay there again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel. Dorms are pretty standard, but the rest of the facilities are very nice. The staff is great, and the lobby is pretty lively on the weekends, but not too crazy. The real gem in my opinion is the coffee bar in the lobby. Specialty coffee roaster serving excellent pour over coffee. Talk to Brian, the owner of the coffee place if you get a chance. He is very friendly and can give some great recommendations for less common things to do in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: The best hostel I have stayed in. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The place is really clean and has a lot of facilities.

name: Anonymous
comment:
I really enjoyed my stay at Jacbobs Inn and though the facilities were great. Loved the curtained beds, the variety at breakfast (all included) and that the location was extremely convenient when coming from the airport late at night.
 The only thing it lacked for me was a soul! I was travelling alone and it would have been nice if there was a comfy chill-out/ common room to meet people, where the dining area felt a bit institutional. 
 Overall I'd really recommend staying here though!

name: Anonymous
comment: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Jacob's Inn! The staff members are helpful and friendly. The facilities are nice and well kept. The atmosphere is fantastic for group travelers or a single traveler hoping to meet others. The location is excellent as well! Overall, a wonderful place to stay while in Dublin. Cheers!

name: thaisviana
comment: Satisfied overall

name: Anonymous
comment: Superb location. Outlets in beds with underbed lockers. Staff is friendly and helpful. Other guests were mostly kids which made meeting people difficult

name: wouterderooij5677
comment: There's nothing wrong with this place, there's also nothing outstanding about it. It's clean, big and bright. It's also unpersonal, misses the atmosphere of a small hostel and it definitely requires a bit of TLC in some of the (bath)rooms. A place to stay not a place to make new friends.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very large hostel. The cafe style common areas create compartments where people sit with their phones/ipads. Everything works and is there, but felt generic. Has the feel of a place that's being used a lot, general wear, strong smell of floor cleaning agents in hallways, otherwise a little scruffy but not in the endearing ways. Ugly stains of something sticky on the wall next to where the pillow was. Unsecured Wifi (come on, it's 2017). It was just very impersonal, maybe best for groups.

name: Anonymous
comment: One of the best hostels I've stayed in, the rooms are huge and clean, same with the bathrooms. The included breakfast could be better but for that price, it's ok! Super recommended

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place, we only stayed one night and were exhausted from a long haul flight but otherwise would have loved to hang out more in this hostel. Friendly but not pushy or leery staff, great facilities with lots of space to meet other people. 12 bed female dorm didn't feel too cramped and was really quiet and private with the curtains for each bed. Clean bathrooms with good hot showers. Great brekky in the morning too! Highly recommended!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very helpful staff and very accommodating

name: Anonymous
comment: Really friendly staff. Excellent facilities (kitchen, dinning room, living room). The bedrooms are perfect as well

name: jamieva900
comment: Huge well run hostel. Too big to socialize.

name: Anonymous
comment: I loved all my stays in Jabob's Inn. It's close to the city center, about 10-15 min walk. The lockers below the bed are really handy. And there are 2 plugs and 2 UBS portals with EVERY bed! I'd totally recommend staying here!

name: Anonymous
comment: Spacious hostel, great location just 5 mins walk from the Spire, next to central bus station and Luas, the airport bus 747 just round the corner, next to the Garda station make its more safe, new and tidy amenities, clean shower and bedding, large common area with decent breakfast, free locker and public shower provided , I have stayed here for twice during my spell in Dublin, would definitely recommend to budget traveler, it's worth every penny.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really good location, nice staff, nice d√©cor and clean. Well equipped self catering kitchen

name: amandarivera
comment: This place is awesome! The staff is really nice & helpful. I had a conversation with the barista who was super sweet. 24 reception is a must for me, it really helps people feel safe. I liked the downstairs cafe, it's a good way to help with the atmosphere. The rooms were clean & organized w/ lots of storage. The bathroom was clean & private for each room. The location is a short walk from Temple Bar & the National Gallery & many restaurants/bars. Also, I loooved the donation-based walking tour!

name: Anonymous
comment: One of the staff, he's so cute and he wasn't wearing his name tag whenever we talked so I never learned his name. Very sad. But aside from that, very chill atmosphere and super clean. Really helpful as well--my airport shuttle forgot to pick me up, so the night guard called a taxi and was kind enough to cover the majority of the fare. Also, the location is GREAT. The tram is literally 100 feet from the door, and Abbey Street/ the shopping district is a five minute walk away. Go here.

name: Anonymous
comment: I was really impressed by this hostel! I felt really safe and comfortable the whole time! :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Was in town for a couple nights for a work meeting. The only complaint I had was every staff member I seemed to interact with acted like I was inconveniencing them in the greatest way possible. I asked about what time the walking tour was because on arrival the front desk basically gave me my key and didn't tell me where anything in the place was located. Speaking of, the walking tour was great - highly recommend. Overall it was a really good hostel. Love the curtains in the rooms, too.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay. Lots of space to move around in the rooms. Big common areas and kitchen spaces. Well stocked with games and everything else you would need. Security was very tight, couldn't get anywhere without a key card which was nice to know. Bed were comfortable and private. There were curtains on each bunk, lots of outlets and a shelf. Would stay here again next tme.

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff were fabulous, super nice rooms too.

name: batcamis
comment: One of my favourite hostels until now. The staff is amazing.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, would definitely stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel was really good but you needed to bring your own lock for the storage in the room. Very easy to meet people as a single traveller and always something to do. A little bit away from the heart of everything, but a nice walk when you're trying to sober up on the way home

name: kffej101
comment: The good: amazing facilities, huge lounge area, tram service to airport, strong free wifi, helpful and knowledgeable 24h staff, high standard of cleanliness, great lockers under each bed, free breakfast, good security standards, and located not too far from Temple Bar/City center. This hostel was absolutely amazing and I would recommend it to anyone. My only complaints are the rooms aren't well ventilated and the pillows are laughably small/flat, but that can be fixed with a jacket in the P case

name: Anonymous
comment: Really close to the bus station. Very clean rooms, each bed had its own light and outlet. It has a cool coffee shop down stairs and a really awesome vibe, a bit of a hike from the temple bar area but totally doable.

name: Anonymous
comment: Staff is so great and answer any questions you may have. They will go above and beyond to improve your stay. The rooms and showers are also really clean... definitely recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: Building is very secure and easy to get to from the airport, free breakfast is really good and it's in walking distance to many Dublin sights such as temple bar and trinity college. However, the windows are single pane and there is a train line that runs by it so it's quite loud in the rooms and can get cold

name: Anonymous
comment:
Location is not bad but you want to go to the city take a tram and there was clean and wide space but employee are not kind especially reception employee.
 And breakfast is not good.
 But you paid money you can get thr value

name: Anonymous
comment: Very clean and very nice hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved the curtains in the hostel between the beds. Great privacy when you don't expect much from a hostel. Def more of a party hostel. Was here for a quick night because I was heading to Galway early morning and just needed a nights rest. But didn't get much bc the people in my hostel were in rage mode. Which I understand- it's Dublin and it's an amazing city. But just to let you know what to expect!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very impressed all-round! Right in the centre of Dublin. And very social/ fun environment - You are able to BYO in the common area, which is huge. Also very big kitchen with great facilities.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay, beds were comfy and had curtains!! Pillows were very thin. Great to have PowerPoints at each bed. Shower was terrible with water turning off every 2 seconds, breakfast was great!

name: Anonymous
comment: Night time staff is very rude and want to skirt responsibility more than help out - seemed to enjoy more chatting to themselves in their own language. The bigger one ignored me the last night probably because the previous night bed wasn't made and he didn't want to make it ... he also started a fight with two guests threatening them and interacting physically in front of 10 guests in my last night. Moldy showers, no ventilation in rooms, far from temple bar and other attractions. Will not stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel has a great location and the staff is the absolute best! Everyone there was super helpful. The only problem was that my sheets were not totally clean. But besides that this place is great!

name: Anonymous
comment: Really nice facilities, spacious rooms, full ensuites available in many rooms. A bit farther from city center than other options, but the "away from center" location likely allows for such great accommodations. Nearest sights are about a mile hike but nice walk along river.

name: Anonymous
comment: Beds were comfortable and had curtains and own chargers which were really good. Wifi and kitchen was also good. Staff really friendly and helpful and hostel had a good vibe: easy to meet people. Good location from the bus terminal which is easy to get to from the airport. Would stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment:
The positives are the staff. Good chat, good advice, friendly. It's also a big, modern hostel with spacious kitchen etc. 
 
 But it's in the trashier part of Dublin and I wasn't wild about the area, there are much nicer parts of the city across the bridge I wished I was staying in. It was expensive and had no atmosphere, no bar or chill space. The wifi doesn't really work in the room. 
 
 Also? I was in a 12 bed with my friend.... and 10 men. I did not feel safe or secure at all. They were a group

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel good location nice rooms would stay here again and Dublin is an absolute gem!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good hostel, near to the central train station and very easy to go all Dublin by there.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a great place to stay when in Dublin. Well located in a quiet area near the train station. It's clean and the environment is friendly. The room was spacious and it has a closet and an area with mirror and a table.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great experience here. The staff was the best part very helpful and friendly. The rooms were great and clean and the curtains on the beds were super convenient.

name: Anonymous
comment: Couldn't be in a better location! Steps away from a stop the airport shuttle makes and just a few minutes from all the sights downtown. They take security pretty seriously here so no need to be concerned. The breakfast is alright, but you'll probably be looking forward to lunch.

name: Anonymous
comment: Beautiful hostel and the staff are very helpful. And the location is awesome. Near the the Spire which is near the river. Pubs everywhere. No need to worry about food and beer. Definitely recommend backpackers to this hostel if they are staying in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: It's a huge hostel. Great for groups but if you are a solo traveler, go with slightly smaller ones as people tend to socialize better in those places. Everyone in my room were group travelers and no one wanted to talk behind the privacy curtain. Common area also was a rather quiet place. Place and facility itself is great.

name: theworldismineveronica588
comment: Everything is within walking distance from the hostel. 15 min walk to Temple Bar and 5 min walk to Henry Street. The hostel was big, clean facilities, very popular, have different spaces to relax and meet new people. They also give you a discount for parking. The staff is really nice and friendly! It leans towards the more expensive side but well worthy.

name: Anonymous
comment:
How can it be so perfect?
 As soon as i moved my hostel to other place, I missed this place so much.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice environment various range of people staying which was very cool to see the differ t curl tire however theybqere children also staying there which I thought was kind of weird. The location was right around the corner from the spire and the main shoppping district and not too far from the temple bar area! Saw the cleaning staff cleaning everyday and the kitchen was fairly clean as well. Very strict with security which was comforting but after a certain they wouldn't others from outside in

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel. Not spectacular in terms of atmosphere but overall good. Rooms were great and clean.

name: vatler
comment: For some reason there were quite a few "older" guests and it not only made the atmosphere sort of awkward but it was quite uncomfortable sharing a room with an elderly man. The staff would help but didn't seem overly enthused to do so nor were they friendly. The place is very secure and you need to use your key card about 5-6 times to get to your room. You could hear every door slam or toilet flush from your bed which didn't make for a good night sleep. There were nice big common areas.

name: Anonymous
comment: This place is so sick!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay, great location. The only issue I had was with the storage cage under the beds, the cage wouldn't come out when someone was on the bed and I had to wake up the person in the bottom bunk twice, however that may have just been for that bed. Other than that Jacobs Inn was all class.

name: Anonymous
comment: For such a large hostel I was very impressed. All of the facilities were amazing and kept cleaner than most other hostels where I have stayed. The staff overall very nice, with the exception of one who was a little negative when I asked questions.

name: Anonymous
comment: Overall, Jacobs is a fantastic hostel for a stay in Dublin. It is situated only a short walk away from the main centres of O'Connell Street and Temple Bar so is incredibly convenient. The beds and shower facilities were good, as was the kitchen - this was well converted from a commercial kitchen and the availability of good ovens, hobs and utensils was very much appreciated. I would definitely recommend it!

name: sabinelang3608
comment: Really enjoyable stay, staff and facilities were great, and great value for money. Would definitely stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a really nice hostel! We came here for 3 nights and literally we haven't planned for anything. However, the staff were really friendly and recommended us for few tours so that we had a great time in Dublin! The price is reasonable, with perfect location as well.

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent hostel smack bang in the middle of Dublin near everything you want to see if you only have a few days. Staff were friendly, particularly Allan who did a great walking tour on the Monday morning. Our room was very clean and the shower was very environmentally friendly. The coffee was excellent downstairs too!

name: Anonymous
comment: Everything was great.

name: Anonymous
comment: Had a great stay - it's the perfect location for exploring Dublin city as well as going out! the staff was super friendly! it's exactly how I expect a good hostel to be!

name: Anonymous
comment: good kitchen. staff were helpful in pointing out things to do and helping out when I had no charger for my phone. easy walking distance to temple bar and other sites. very clean. included breakfast and kitchen were good

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice hostel. Perfect location and really nice beds with curtains and charging stations. Tasty included breakfast as well. Would stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel is decent, but lacking charm certainly. It feels very large and people are definitely coming and going frequently. I stayed two nights (one in an all female too and one in a mixed room) and by far preferred the mixed room. The guests were not very considerate of coming and going late at night, and this bothers me a lot in a hostel environment. The location isn't the most central, and I think there are better options. I do like the outlets at each bed and privacy curtains.

name: Anonymous
comment: One of the best hostels I have stayed in. Jacobs inn was fantastic and I hope to stay there again when I return to Dublin. The atmosphere is great in there lounge. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Location is superb. You can walk to most of the historical sites. Great deal all around!

name: Anonymous
comment: A big hostel that feels even bigger. Staff are nice enough but at times seem overwhelmed with the sheer number of people that come through here. Located in a decent spot, about 20min walk to the middle of town. Beds are great with each one having its own curtain and multiple power outlets. Atmosphere is what you expect from a big hostel. Would only recommend this place if you're already in a group. It's super hard to meet anyone here, so not ideal for solo travellers.

name: Anonymous
comment: Helpful staff, beds were fairly comfortable, plugs and USB chargers on the beds and in the lobby area, breakfast was fine (albeit fairly limited). Around a 15 min walk from the centre.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best hostel Ive stayed in all of Europe! Modern fun atmosphere, great kitchen and common area, free breakfast, walking tour and pub crawl from hostel, curtains on bed, bathroom in room, each bed has own charger

name: Anonymous
comment: The facilities were top notch. The beds all have a privacy curtain and a shelf with a plug and a light. There's a pub crawl and walking tour that both leave from the hostel. Loads of chill out space and has a good atmosphere. Staff were super helpful and friendly, giving good recommendations.

name: Anonymous
comment: Secure hostel close to transportation options.

name: Anonymous
comment: Would definitely stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel with amenities. Many people were loud especially the young ones drinking but that was the only negative.

name: Anonymous
comment: Remember to bring a lock to lock up your stuff. It was a big hostel which meant that there was a lot to do within the hostel. The beds were comfy. The staff was quite helpful.

name: hannahmckinnish
comment: The staff was very rude and acted like anything you asked was a huge problem. One bathroom to a room, but there was also hallway bathrooms. We had very obnoxious roommates, but we're also alone for two nights in a ten bed dorm. Everything is WAY overpriced so you have to walk about a mile to find things you can afford

name: Anonymous
comment: Literally one of the best hostel i have stayed in! The beds had curtains and USB outlets in every bunk. It was clean and the staff were helpful! Stay here if you can

name: Anonymous
comment: I really enjoyed my stay here. Great atmosphere and I met many great people! The building is great, with plenty of space and facilities and a beautiful roof garden.

name: mwhite3380
comment: I stayed back in December for 2 nights but am just now getting to this! I had an excellent price since it was the off-season and not middle of summer but regardless, would stay again. Nice curtain over bunk for privacy and outlet in bunk too; felt entirely safe here as solo female traveler. Great common space- sat down as I arrived and got to work on homework (was on quick break before final exams in Spain) with the great wifi, even got interviewed for a video they released a few months back!

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's Inn provided a safe, conveniently-located, and overall pleasant place to stay for my four nights in Dublin. The staff were all friendly and helpful, the security features of the facility were great, and the free breakfast coffee wasn't half bad :) The price was reasonable, except for Friday night when it more than doubled. However, the good far outweighs the price of one night, and I would definitely recommend Jacob's Inn to anyone wanting an affordable place to stay in Dublin town. :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Friendly staff, very clean and tidy hostel. Would definitely recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: Although I stayed in a room with 12 beds, I had plenty of privacy due to the curtains on every bed and a bathroom inside the room.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a relatively large hostel, very near the central train and bus station and within easy walking distance of the city center. Rooms are clean, outfitted with lockers and enough power plugs. Staff is helpful and in general there is a good vibe in the place. Bars like The Celt nearby have good live music and reasonably priced drinks. All in all, very convenient place to stay and excellent value for the price.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good hostel the facilities were the best I have had! Power points and USB points at each bed and a curtain across the bed is amazing

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a great hostel! I felt extremely safe with there enforcement of security policies, the atmosphere is great and it is pretty clean for a hostel. They also play great music in the common spaces. I love that the dorms have coverings for all the beds. It really gives you that extra privacy. The location is great too! Very close to the bus stop to and from the airport and the central road! Stay at this hostel!!

name: Anonymous
comment: The Jacob's Inn was a perfect location in Dublin. Only a 10 minute walk to O'Connell street and maybe 15 to Temple Bar area. There are big cages under your beds for storing luggage. The free breakfast in the morning is simple, but really handy (toast, cereal, coffee, juice...sometimes hard boiled eggs). The coffee shop is good, but only open till 3:30 or something. It's secure and that's good, but annoying to have to use your key card 5000 times before hitting your room. I recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place! The only hostel I've even been in that had bed curtains for some privacy- a really nice touch. Attached bathrooms are simple and clean. Breakfast was free, easy, and filling!

name: Anonymous
comment: I couldn't put my things in the storage cage as it would not open. Nice and large hostel with plenty of room to move about, however if you are travelling solo, it's not the best to meet people. But hey, join the pub crawl, it's a great night!! I did enjoy the free breakfast and definitely took advantage of the Nutella! :)

name: Anonymous
comment: I had the best nights sleep here! The beds are comfy and you get a curtain for privacy. There is key card access everywhere so you feel very safe and it's clean. The only thing is that it's a huge hostel so it's harder to meet people as a solo traveller. But all in all I would stay there again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's Inn in Dublin is a 5 minute walk from the bus station and close to a nice pedestrian street. It made us feel very safe considering they always check who is coming in and out. The facilities were clean and the cafeteria for the breakfast in the morning was spacious and the breakfast was good.

name: Anonymous
comment: If you're looking to stay somewhere near the main bus station this place will do. The staff wasn't overly friendly nor helpful. The room I stayed in was right next to the train tracks and it was quite loud. Wasn't the cleanest place and the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor.

name: Anonymous
comment: Was perfect.

name: Anonymous
comment:
This might be the best hostel I've ever been to. Basically a hotel with bunk beds. 
 
 Cons: the beds themselves are not top notch, no privacy curtain or individual power outlet for each bed. 
 
 Pros: Everything else. 1 bathroom & shower per room, breakfast, kitchen, easy to get to and from airport, laundry facilities, tours of the city... Everything you need.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place!!!! The rooms are comfortable with a personal light and a curtain to cover bed. Every room has a toilet and a shower. It is the best hostel in Dublin for this price! Huge place, not so suitable for travellers who want to get to know people, but good for long time accommodation.

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel has a weird security system. Even though you have your key card, after a certain time you need your original receipt to get it. We didn't have an issue with this as we always came home early in the night. Also there is so many doors and so many times you need your key to get through the door or to push a button to get out, it seems a bit overkill and can get annoying fast. The breakfast was good and the areas were always clean. Staff seemed nice but not overly bothered to help us.

name: gbmarcal3053
comment: Totally recommend ! Bed super comfy, hostel clean, good atmosphere , good breakfast, safe ! Good option!

name: georgecumming2027
comment: Brilliant hostel, conveniently located and all staff were very helpful. Worth noting that the coffee for sale in reception is also excellent.

name: Anonymous
comment: The security was good at this hostel but having to show the front desk staff a receipt for my stay in order to get back in was silly. I'm 28 years old, I don't appreciate being treated like a child when I re-enter the place I'm paying to stay at. What's more is the attitude from some of the staff - definitely not into being scolded like some of the other guests were if you forgot this tiny piece of paper swimming in a sea of travel receipts in my purse. Otherwise I enjoyed the facilities.

name: Anonymous
comment: Second time I've stayed there. Will definitely be back again

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved it, perfect location, staff was unreal nice and very helpful. Can't ask for much more from a hostel. 10/10

name: Anonymous
comment: Super amazing location. Friendly helpful staff. Outlets and privacy curtains with all bunks. We very much enjoyed our stay at Jacob's Inn.

name: Anonymous
comment: Preferred this place to generator hostel just cause the vibe was better. Pretty clean and free breaky

name: Anonymous
comment: If you can avoid dorm room 414, this is a great place. Literally half a block from the central bus terminal right downtown, a wonderful staff, one of the cleanest hostels on the planet, fierce security, incredible kitchen facilities, nice atmosphere where it's easy to start up conversations. i've stayed in three dorms during two stays. Two had almost perfect facilities, with good-sized storage lockers under the beds, night lights, personal charging plugs, even bed curtains. Not room 414.

name: Anonymous
comment: Everything was really good. I loved the individual power points and lights and curtains around each bed. Stayed in a 10bed dorm with an ensuite which was pretty good. Only trouble was the toilet was blocked the morning I left (other toilets available though) and the shower in the room took a long time to drain after I used it. Wifi worked well and free breakfast was basic but still good. Helpful staff too!

name: Anonymous
comment: It is a very good place to stay. The breakfast is very good (milk, coffee, bread, juice, cereals) and the plugs in bed really works. About the place, it is ok, about 7 minutes walk to O'Cornell Street. It is a little dark to walk at night, but it don¬¥'t seems so dangerous if you go back too late. The staff is kind and the card door works pretty well. It has the hot water, but in the cabine of the shower doesn't have a place to put the soap, shampoo, etc. So, it is a little hard, but nice shower.

name: Anonymous
comment:
The radiator in the room doesn't work properly so the room it's very very cold, further more one of the windows was broken and badly fixed with a plastic bag, not nice at all!
 the room and the corridor where very dirty but the cold room was by far the worst thing! The staff and other facilities where very good thought, very good whify...!

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed at Jacob's Inn a couple of times before it was refurbished and thought it was great then. Now it's absolutely brilliant! The dorms and bathrooms are larger than in most hostels and not at all cramped. Plus there are extra communal bathrooms, which are modern and spotless. Each bed has its own light, sockets and USB port, plus a curtain for en extra bit of privacy, which is a real luxury. The kitchen, dining and lounge areas are also really nicely decorated.

name: Anonymous
comment: It's nice and clean, and the staff are great. It's a bit too big which can making meeting people difficult but they do have a pub crawl every night and the walking tour was good!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Excellent hostel! Spacious and clean common areas, confortable room and friendly staff.
 It's not so close to temple bar but location is convenient with many public transport around.

name: Anonymous
comment: I really enjoyed staying at Jacob's Inn. The hostel is VERY clean, secure, and guests and staff are friendly. It's a good location, close to public transit and a 15 minute walk to Temple Bar. I stayed in a mixed room and it was quiet and safe. Each bunk has its own plugs, USB ports, and a reading light. I liked that each bed has curtains for privacy. The rooms smelled nice (no weird smells as in other hostels) and the common areas were very nice. Locks for the lockers cost 4 euro, towels cost 2.

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel is right across from the bus station and really close to the city center. They offer a free walking tour every day that is definitely worth doing. For the amount of money it costs, it couldn't have been a better place to stay. The only thing you should do is bring your own pillow.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn is a well situated hostel with an easy 10 minute (if that) walk in to the centre. The beds were comfy, the lockers were great and the facilities available were decent. You can get an AWESOME cup of coffee here but a bar wouldn't go a miss to add more of an atmosphere. There were many middle aged/older people staying in the hostel which affected the atmosphere. A little on the expensive side for what you get but all in all a fairly decent place.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Great value for money. I love the pods your almost in! Curtain, light and charger station is top noch!
 Location is very central but is in a bit of a dodgy area, but it's a busy area.
 I'm pretty sure our ensuite bathroom didn't get cleaned at all, my only negative of this place!
 Staff are great!

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, we really enjoyed our stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: It was a great hostel! One of the best hostels I have stayed at!

name: Anonymous
comment: Loved my stay here! My roommates were loud and had different schedules but the hostel was great. It was so clean, pretty good location and the staff was very helpful. Breakfast was a little sparse but having the cafe was lovely. The walking tour was the highlight of the trip.

name: Anonymous
comment: Hostel was clean and staff were very accommodating and helpful. Location is a bit off the main road and about `15-20 min walk from the main bar area though easy to get to from the airport. Nonetheless it was convenient and an overall good stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: This is a pretty standard big hostel. Doesn't have the atmosphere/friendliness of a smaller hostel but it was very clean and the facilities were good. The ensuite to our dorm was good and there's under bed lockers. Staff were very friendly and helpful

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent

name: stamcuba
comment: Information in the front desk was not accurate and the staff was no so friendly. But the rest of the services were excellent, so the rooms and showers. The location is perfect and nearby main attractions in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great staff and location. Wish the showers were more powerful but otherwise cannot fault. Would happily go again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Just amazing...everything fantastic!!!

name: Anonymous
comment: Except rude behavior and lying by receptionist maria at the time of check in that computer showed the print out that I already got receipt of room number when I paid for rent before check in and got security card, it was good.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel. Very clean and comfortable with great staff.

name: Anonymous
comment: 14 persons in a room is right at my maximum limit. Place is clean, but the wi-fi is spotty in the room. Otherwise, it's a good place to stay especially if you're catching the bus, it's right next to the central bus station. Bus Aras

name: Anonymous
comment: It was a nice and clean place to stay! The staff were awesome and friendly! Definitely worth what you are paying for.

name: Anonymous
comment: Place was clean and cute. Location was good, 15 minute walk to central spots and felt safe enough to be a single girl walking around at night. Tours also pick up near by. Only complaint is the people staying in my 6 bed all female dorm. They brought in men around 2 in the morning, one was heavily drunk and kept yelling she was cold and dying. They were very rude, which I know has nothing to do with the hostel itself. They montior eveyrone coming in, so I wish that situation had been handled.

name: Anonymous
comment: Friendly and helpful staff.

name: Anonymous
comment: We only stayed around for one night, but we still had a great time at the hostel and in Dublin. I can highly recommend the pub crawlings with the hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Fantastic Hostel! Beds are private with a curtain, your own power point and light. Free breakfast and also a large kitchen to do your own cooking. Great location, just outside of the temple bar area. Maybe a 10 minute walk there. But only a 5 min walk from all the shops! Definitely recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: Had a great stay, staff were super helpful and the hostel was very close to the city center. Would recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: As far as location, Jacobs Inn is located close to Busaras, but it is a bit of a walk from the popular bars. This was definitely been one of the best hostels Ive stayed in. Accomodations were clean and modern, and the staff was easily the most friendly and helpful I've ever come across. Pub crawl every night thats good value for the what you pay and a great chance to meet cool people. Would reccommend highly to anyone travelling in Ireland!

name: Anonymous
comment: This place is big, with multiple hangout spaces. Met some nice people here and while far away from the temple bar area, its very close to the bus station which is great and the walk downtown is very pretty now with Christmas Lights. My big issue with this place was that in my full dorm, only 4 of us were travellers. The rest were homeless? working and unable to find affordable housing. Them all getting up at 6 to go to work everyday...maybe put all those workers in the same room?

name: Anonymous
comment: We stayed one night, arrived pretty late but it was perfect for our short trip. We had 2 beds in a room of four, it was nice and clean. Small breakfast. Really good location. Definitely going back.

name: Anonymous
comment: The curtains on the bunk beds were great! Comfy beds and great shower. Made really good coffee in reception!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Great hostel, at a great location! Only downside is that there is no bar! 
 Staff is fantastic, and there is plenty of room to just hang out. Free breakfast is alright, but at 11 euros/night I'm not expecting much! Breakfast included juices, coffee/tea, cereal, and toast with butter/jam and Nutella.

name: Anonymous
comment: I think it is not bad especially the staffs were so kind. If i go to dublin again I hope to stay again

name: tcoleman37
comment: Great hostel, loud at times, but it's not hard to find a spot to relax. Beds and pillow could be a little better but that's not a huge deal. Incredible deal for the value.

name: Anonymous
comment: Probably the best hostel I've stayed in so far. It has everything you need: wifi in the rooms, curtains, charging ports and a lamp for each bed, free breakfast etc. The rooms even have en suite bathrooms! The hostel is also really spacious and clean. It's about a 15 min walk from the main attractions in the south part of town but that's nothing. Loved my stay here!

name: Anonymous
comment: This place was really great! The staff were really friendly, no matter what time of the day we went to the desk, and they gave us really great suggestions on where to eat and what to do. This place is a definite must stay if you're in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Thoroughly enjoyed my time here. Facilities, breakfast, location and beds were all fantastic. You can practically walk anywhere from here. Though the only downside was that the hostel didn't have that "cosy" atmosphere feeling to it.

name: Anonymous
comment: Always a great place to stay. Pleasant and convenient since my first trip to Dublin back in 2006.

name: JamiesonCosgriff
comment: Staff were very friendly, however the overall vibe of the hostel was certainly lacking. Very stark rooms (comfy beds though) and outdated facilities. Perfect to crash for the night however I'm sure there would be more central/ better options.

name: Anonymous
comment: Outstanding hostel - cannot recommend it enough. Only mark off was that, with baggage, the level of security was *too* high and caused a lot of annoyances getting in and out... but of course YMMV and you may like that sort of thing! Loved the extra amenities (charging bars and lights in each bunk! curtains!) and the staff was amazing. Thanks so much for an outstanding experience in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Pretty good hostel with great facilities and breakfast. atmosphere was alright and you can join the combined pub crawl with other hostels as well. Comfortable beds, easy bus access from the airport although not far from the train line so can occasionally get some noise. Not far from the main sites. Would stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: We often had problems with the wifi. It cut in and out and was often quite a weak connection. We had an issue with the people in the rooms next door and in the hallway yelling and screaming to loud music with no care for other guests, but when we informed reception they came up and asked the neighbors to turn off the sound. I still had to yell at teens in the hallway at midnight but the staff really went out of their way to help us with a couple issues we encountered. Would recommend :)

name: Anonymous
comment: very noisy at night!!!

name: Anonymous
comment: I really liked this hostel! I would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Dublin! Nice building, friendly staff, and a good environment!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very busy noisy place, but staff were helpful and the facilities were very up to date and clean!

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice spot just over the river, north side, easy to get everywhere. Just walk it mate. Hostel was fine, met some cool people. Reccomend it. Dublin is the best

name: Anonymous
comment: Coffee shop in the hostel‚Äìgreat combo.

name: Anonymous
comment: This place covers all the basics; clean, safe, affordable.

name: Anonymous
comment: We stayed for 2 nights. First night was in a 12 bed room, although we booked a 10 bed room. Had to move room After a night. Decent breakfast, nice staff, clean facilities. Good location as it is super close to the Train Station .

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location in Dublin, right near the train and bus station. Have stayed in another hostel in Dublin and this was much better in terms of cleanliness, dorms and facilities! There are plenty of bathrooms, storage under the bed (big enough for your backpack), a large common area to relax, and dorms are a decent size! Would definitely recommend to travellers visiting Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Best hostel ever!!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very happy with my stay here. The rooms were great! Free lockers under each bed and curtains for extra privacy. The only negative is that the street below and hallways can get really noisy due to other guests. Obviously people are free to come and go as they please but people screaming in the hallways at 4am on a Tuesday isn't always fun so keep in mind that this is essentially a party hostel. If that's your scene then they have pub crawls to your advantage. Very pleased :)

name: Anonymous
comment:
The people who work at the reception are very kind and nice. They help you whenever it is necessary
 Very clean, confortable and secure

name: Anonymous
comment: What a wonderful hostel! The room was great and very clean, beds were comfortable and noise levels were fine (even on a bank holiday weekend in Dublin). The staff were extremely friendly and accommodative to our needs, the hostel has great facilities too! Oh, and the location could not have been better - right in the heart of Dublin, minutes away from tonnes of bars and restaurants and about 10 minutes from the wonderful Temple Bar area. I would definitely return, thank you to Fran and the team!

name: Anonymous
comment: Too much security. Had to swipe my card 6 times to get to my room. It was a bit antisocial as well (granted I was there on a Sunday night)

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel in good location with social environment. WI'll stay here again

name: Anonymous
comment: Clean comfortable accommodation. Staff provided good customer service. Great location easy to get to from Dublin airport.

name: Gormanoconor
comment: It's a great Hostel any complaints would be superficial at best

name: maisiejillb
comment: This place wasn't great. I spent most of my time out of the hostel because the room smelled really awful, and the common area was always empty and dirty.

name: Anonymous
comment: Such a nice hostel! I will definitely be staying here if I ever find myself back in Dublin! The vibe is great, everything is clean, there is a great coffee/tea cafe in the lobby, the staff was nice, it's in the city center, and the rooms are laid out really nicely. Your bed not only has a curtain so you can have your privacy, you also get two outlets and two USBs, plus a light, and your locker is secure under the bunk! We loved our stay and the friends we made here! Can't complain at all!

name: Anonymous
comment: Wonderful hostel. Very clean, lots of lounge space and amenities. My only complaint is that the four-person shared dorm did not have an outlet, light, or curtain for each bed. (There were underbed storage lockers, though.)

name: Anonymous
comment: Only toilets in room and only 1 at that, keycard locks everywhere gets pretty annoying, beds were very uncomfortable. Great location though

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel A+++++++++++++++

name: Anonymous
comment: The place was nice and accommodating. It was in a good location to get around the city.

name: Anonymous
comment: This being my first hostel experience, I have to say that I was more than pleased. The staff was awesome (Brian the Barista was the man!) and the people in the common area were cool. When I return to Dublin, Jacob's inn is definitely the place to stay at

name: Anonymous
comment: Awesome hostel. Staff was super friendly and they also gave me a free ticket for coming back to the airport. Thanks guys!!!

name: Anonymous
comment: helpful staff, loved the curtains on the beds, with the added privacy. everything was within walking distance. definitely recommend

name: Anonymous
comment: The location was great and the staff was always helpful with any questions I had. I would definitely stay here again!!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Superb Hostel. First time booming this accommodation and have to say very impressed. Clean premises, friendly staff, comfortable beds, great wifi and location is ideal. 
 
 Will be back

name: Anonymous
comment: One of the nicest hostels I've ever been too. Comfortable, clean, and everything you need and more!!

name: Anonymous
comment: Best hostel I've stayed in so far!! Friendly staff, clean rooms & dorm beds that feel private & have all the essentials! Great location with easy access to airport buses!!

name: Anonymous
comment: best location in city centre. newly built . best hostel i have stayed. rooms have abundant space, each bed has curtains, reading lamp and charging points. in suite toilets. neat and clean. fully satisfied. recommend to everyone going to dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment:
That's a huge place, accommodating a lot of people. Yet it has nice and big common spaces and good acoustic, so one can feel fine among all other guests. 
 Overall I enjoyed the experience.

name: Anonymous
comment: Probably one of the best hostels facility wise I've ever stayed in. Security is really really good aswell. Good common room, good pricing. atmosphere is good aswell.

name: Anonymous
comment: the hostel is near bus station so I didnt have to walk at night too far. there is free breakfast in the morning till 9.30 after the time, the staff take out the food so dont be late. there is free luggage store. I walked to the downtown and pick up my luggage later for free. Negative: if you want to open a door, you have to press a buttom or put a card. I felt to be like in a jail. ok, for the first door near reception but for the others i think it is not necessary.

name: Anonymous
comment: lovely hostel üëçüèº

name: Anonymous
comment: Was a great stay! The staff was awesome and extremely helpful. The rooms were nice with the nicest bunks we've been in at hostels. Was also very clean. Great place to stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: Brilliant stay for 3 nights! Stayed in the dorm next to the dining area, didn't hear a sound in the morning during breakfast... Super quiet! Partied hard on the pub crawl, would certainly recommend booking onto it! Despite not remembering, am sure we all had a brilliant night! ;) ! Excellent facilities and clean!!! Couldn't ask for anything more!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great security and location, but the ensuite toilet smelled of pee and was obviously not cleaned during the three days I stayed.

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff are fantastic and very helpful. Facilities seem pretty clean and it's very well located. My only complaint would be that some things don't work well (the lock dispenser in the luggage room).

name: RaulS92
comment: Staff was great and helpful. Good location and easy to get there with public transportation from the airport. Really secure and had a couple of fun events too. Would definitely stay here again if I'm back in Dublin

name: Anonymous
comment:
Pros:
 Wifi was great
 Kitchen was clean and well equipped
 Lockers for luggage storage before/after checkout
 Big lockers in rooms
 Privacy curtains
 USB and night light in each bed
 Good location
 
 Cons:
 Bathroom was a little dingy 
 No hand towels/bathmat 
 Breakfast was not much (but it was free so cannot really complain)

name: dgahafer
comment: Great hostel, very clean, and just far enough away from everything to avoid the noise at night. Also located right next to the garda (police) stain, and the Busaras bus station. Best hostel I've stayed in yet. Highly recommended.

name: Anonymous
comment: It was one of my better hostel experiences. Nice staff and facilities. Really a great stay would recommend. Breakfast could be a little bit expanded (some yogurt possibly) but otherwise great

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay!!!!

name: Anonymous
comment: I didn't find the staff helpful on my first night at all.

name: dolphnatalie
comment: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay! Was able to walk to the heart of the city. Staff is very friendly! Will stay here again before my flight home!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good hostel, clean and just opposite of the Bus Central Station. Beds were comfy, with plugs n reading lamps as well as curtains on every single bed. I¬¥ d stay there again

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn is a typical hostel. Uncomfortable beds, paper thin walls, and late night noise. The location was great and the staff was wonderful, but the rates were inflated for the All Ireland Gaelic Football Championship.

name: Anonymous
comment: My first time staying in a hostel and i was pleasantly surprised. Extremely friendly and informative staff. Perfect location. Will be booking again.

name: Anonymous
comment: our first time staying in a hostel & we'll definately be doing it again!Lovely,friendly vibrant accommodation !helpful staff,Breakfast included in price

name: Anonymous
comment: Everything was really clean and the staff is very warm and useful. I can't wait to go back to Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: Many facilities for socializing -- and if you will prefer to rest at night, it is great too because they provide individual curtain for beds so that you won't be distrubed by those who are still awake. The location is just 3 mins walk from the main bus station -- very convenient. Good quality of breakfast.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location and facilities. The bunks are great, booked a 6-person mixed dorm and noise was never an issue in the room. Other dorms were quite noisy so booking a smaller dorm seems to be the way to go.

name: Anonymous
comment: Dorm and hostel was fine. I had mu bicycle with me and their was no where to store it at the hostel I could keep it at a different hostel nearby but wasn't too comfortable where I had to leave it as the the outside storage area was locked by a cheap locker, which could easily be broken into. Apart from that I had no issues.

name: Anonymous
comment: I enjoyed my stay here. The staff is informative and very friendly. I especially LOVED the USB ports by each bed! The location is perfect if you want to be near all the pubs and events. Our room and the property was clean. I would stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very organized place. Big plus for offering good specialty coffee in the lounge!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Well located, clean hostel: close to the main bus station (with the busses to the ferries) and Connolly train station, and walking distance to Connolly street as well as the Convention Center.
 Large, well equipped kitchen, and large rooms. When we were there, there were a number of noticable groups or school classes, but since I wasn't there to find company for my own trip that wasn't a problem.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bathroom smelled but what can you expect from a shared bathroom. Beds are super comfy. About a 20 minute walk from everything.

name: riordanmeister
comment: A good hostel in a good location. Just a one minute walk from Busaras and the Luas. I enjoyed the free breakfast and the Wifi connection was good. The one downside of my stay was that there was no security cages or lockers in my 4 bed dorm. I understand this was a newly converted private room but lockers or cages should have been available.

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel is really lovely & had some lovely rooms!! The atmosphere was quiet, but that was what we were wanting so perfect for us. Had some good pubs / restaurants close by & the staff were lovely! Also had amazing coffee at reception!! Would recommend üòä

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn is a cracking hostel with a youthful modern feel to it. The guys on the desk couldn't have been more helpful with tips and advice. The 12 berth room we had was clean and tidy. Decent sized bathroom. Excellent security at the reception. Nice plus was the free breakfast. We didn't take advantage of everything that was on offer which included a Saturday night pub crawl and a walking tour of Dublin. I'd readily recommend this hostel. And we'll be back.

name: Anonymous
comment: I booked for a 10 bed room and they gave me a 12 in the firt night and told me i should move to another room in the second night. In the second night the bed i should use was occupied by another person.We moved 2 times until they gave us another room. All of that changes in the middle of the night.

name: Anonymous
comment:
The staff were excellent, extremely welcoming, helpful and friendly. 
 I would definitely recommend staying here

name: Anonymous
comment: Reception staff unacceptable, another booking that was made under my name without my consent and they where trying to force me to pay for extra charges, spent an hour in reception trying to deal with the problem. Also had to change rooms throughout our stay because of "refurbishments".

name: Anonymous
comment: It was clean and breakfast was good... but it didn't have much atmosphere. Also not the best choice if you're a solo traveller (there are definitely hostels in dublin that are better for socialising if you're traveling alone), more of a place for big groups.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel! Had a wonderful vibe, super clean, and great facility. In a unique area of Dublin, I wish I could've stayed longer!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great experience only complaint was the roommates but that's not really the hostels fault!

name: Anonymous
comment: I enjoyed my stay at Jacob's Inn hostel. The staff was friendly as all the irish people I met were. The room with bathroom was clean and quiet except for the train that drove close to my window. The breakfast is simple (milk with muesli and toast with jam or chocolate spread) but sufficient. The temple bar area and Dublin Castle are at 20 minutes walking distance from the hostel.

name: whitlock19837548
comment:
Great hostel with fantastic location, lots of communal areas, nice bunk beds, and the best luggage storage i have ever seen.
 My only small issue is that there seemed to be a lot of groups staying there which isn't good for solo travellers.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice, if you prefer your privacy each bed has its own curtain. Great staff always helping with any questions or stuff to do. Nice kitchen, was fun to cook in it. met really awesome people that were also traveling alone!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel! Nice atmosphere

name: Anonymous
comment: It was one of the best first experiences I had with a hostel - the security was fantastic, and the facilities were good! It was always clean, and the atmosphere was good! The staff were knowledgeable. It is definitely more of a 'party' hostel, so if you're looking for a quiet place, this isn't for you.

name: Anonymous
comment: Not the best stay, our room was very dirty and we found other guests in our beds.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location within Dublin city. Facilities are well provided, great friendly atmosphere with huge spaces to mingle. More importantly there are cages for you to store your things. Although a short walk away from the city centre, it is still very accessible.

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff were really helpful especially during the bus strike helping me get to the airport.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Honestly it felt like a hotel in every way (and we were in a big dormitory) - curtains across the beds for privacy in the dorm, secure under-bed lockers, everything clean, bright and shipshape. Breakfast was toast or cereal with juice, tea/coffee. The only thing lacking was atmosphere; a lot of the guests seemed to be school trips or older people rather than young people looking to socialise.
 
 Otherwise, great value for money and a pleasant stay!

name: Anonymous
comment: Stayed at this hostel for two night as visiting Dublin . Bit pricey for the basic room you'll get. We had no window in our room,it was so hot, it was smelly and to fall asleep was almost impossible.The room was clean and tidy. Bathroom small but practical. It is good for a short term stay or for younger people, maybe i wasn't the right person for this Hostel. Reception staff were very helpful and polite so that is the bonus.

name: Anonymous
comment: Do the pub crawl! You won't regret it!

name: Anonymous
comment: Amazing and safe hostel. Cracking atmosphere, brilliant location (takes 5-10 minute walk to get to Lower O'Connell Street where all the shops are). The breakfast in the morning was good. Super value for money (stayed from last Monday-Thursday). I've put the big grin (top rating) for all factors except staff (put the small grin for that one!) just simply because some members of staff confused us with telling us which transport to get to the airport as the main Dublin buses were on strike.

name: briewolf06
comment: One of the best hostels I've ever stayed at!

name: Anonymous
comment: First thing to note is that Jacob inn is mostly a youth party hostel. If you are not looking for young loud mostly dirty hostel you should look elsewhere. Staff out nice but are all ways on a mission it does not create the most inviting environment. They close the kitchen down and lock the doors from 3pm to 5pm. They kick you off dinner / common area at 10 am. Breakfast is to 10 am but they start putting things away 15 mins before so if you show up last min you will think you can get food but no

name: Anonymous
comment:
not very clean. Almost no soap anywhere to wash hands with. Did not get an intro to what the hostel offers and where things are located, when breakfast times are, when check out is... Also had to change the beds for 2 nights which I booked weeks in advance. Most of my roommates had to change once or even twice as well. So not very well organized. Of course it can happen but it seems to happen alot at the hostel. 
 
 very secure though and in a very good location.

name: Anonymous
comment: Its a good hostel, the staff are very friendly and helpful, it was my birthday the day i arrived so they gave me 1 night free and helped me with suggestions of where to go out to celebrate!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great set up in rooms with power / usb in bed and the curtain was a great addition. Unfortunately our door was broken so no one could get in all through the night. Common areas were a bit like hotels not much atmosphere. The best kitchen we have come across 10/10 for that. Great access to washing machine and dryers for ‚Ç¨6 for wash and dry.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, great staff. Cool vibe to the place, great facilities, loved the security to this place, nice little coffee bar, and tons of common area. Rooms were nice. Happen to be on same floor as male showers, which was nice, but I can see it being a pain if you have to go to another floor to shower.
