But bathrooms were clean and plenty of showers, so can't complain. Nice little terrace on top floor. Overall, great hostel!

name: carolynb642515
comment: Fantastic in every way (price, location, facilities, management) except for the fact that -- being a hostel with large accommodation possibilities -- this seems to attract large school groups. More than at other youth hostels I've stayed in, this one was loud. Bring earplugs for sleep.

name: Anonymous
comment: This ended up being my favourite hostel in Dublin. Each bunk bed has their own outlet, light, and privacy curtain, as well as a cage underneath. Rooms and ensuite/shared bathrooms are clean, and spacious, no issues with being too hot/cold, and WiFi works everywhere. Plug adaptors are available at reception for free, they just hold onto your ID. Location is not bad, a little bit of a walk from city centre, but close to Busaras station, O'Connolly station, and the 747 airport shuttle.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel with awesome facilities, especially the kitchen! Staff were helpful and friendly. The hostel was just a bit too large and impersonal- there were so many large groups that it was hard to meet other travellers. Quite a loud hostel with the groups too, so probably not the place to stay for some peace and quiet.

name: Anonymous
comment: Ticks all the boxes altho' geared to a young crowd that sadly isn't me any more :-(

name: trissybell125019
comment: This hostel was perfectly adequate. I appreciated the luggage storage and free breakfast. The room facilities were good - lights, plugs, and under bed storage for each bed. The bathroom was fairly clean, and the staff was very friendly. Overall, a good place to stay for a night or two.

name: Anonymous
comment:
This hostel is a 5 star hostel! They have drapes and plugs in each bed so you have your privacy and your electronics. Rooftop patio is awesome. Free breakfast is great.
 I recommend this hostel for anyone hanging out in Dublin....awesome!!!!!

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn is a great hostel - roomy and bright rooms, spacious and comfortable common areas, clean and functional toilets, they've got it all. The only downside is that it's a bit of a walk (15 mins) to the Temple Bar area where it seems to be more lively.

name: Anonymous
comment: This place is pretty great. Located right near the river which is perfect. The room I stayed in was roomy and clean. They have a nice common area downstairs as well as an eating area. I would definitely stay here again. No issues.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Really cool vibe here, good kitchen and facilities, really good location. 
 One problem: Maybe I'm just not used to the drinking culture in Ireland, but at around 10pm in the common area, three big, completely trashed guys were loudly harassing me, and the staff were at the desk only about 10 feet away and didn't comment. I know it's not really their job, but I would have felt more safe if one of the male employees had helped me a bit. 
 Still had a good time though

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great neighbourhood near everything. However the locals down the street are stretchy. But found after getting my grounds the first day - it was perfectly fine. Amazing hostel. Very clean & rooms were huge! Beds very comfy too! Loved having a light & outlets for my individual bed & a curtain.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location and the beds were wonderful. Light, outlet and shelf for each bed with curtains and lockers. Our room had an ensuite but there was also a large WC with extra shower/toilets/sinks/mirrors so you don't disturb roommates at odd hours. Beds and bedding were comfortable. There was a group in the next room that was obviously there for a party so they were a bit louder than I liked at late hours but not the fault of the hostel. Great seating areas and a good breakfast. I recommend it!

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel was one of the best when it comes to large places with many guests. Its larger than any place ive seen but they still manage to keep it clean and safe. The showers and beds were great. This is the place to stay in Dublin for cheap.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn is a hotel among hostels! They really have it down to a science. We enjoyed our large, secure room with curtains on each bunk, and the ensuite washroom. Unlike some other hostels, their luggage storage area is very secure. The staff was exceptional and breakfast was a cut above. We would also recommend taking the walking tour offered each morning.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really nice hostel all round had an amazing time! The vibe and atmosphere is amazing. Privacy curtain on the bed was a nice bonus. The fact that every bed had its own outlets was something I really appreciated. Free walking tours and the pub crawl were the bomb!

name: Anonymous
comment: Good, clean, safe hostel. As a solo female traveller I felt perfectly safe in the neighbourhood, although wouldn't recommend walking solo anywhere in Dublin after 1am. The hostel is very secure, clean and helpful staff. The beds a quite big and the privacy curtain is great! Not a very social hostel but I did the free walking tour - which was also great, and made friends with other travellers on that. The pub crawl is also good if you want to hear real Irish music. I would stay here again.

name: hayleenye
comment: Great hostel! Only there for one night, but had no complaints.

name: Anonymous
comment:
This is probably the best hostel in Ireland. The rooms are big and not cramped with dorm beds. The beds have curtains and plug points and even usb outlets and your own reading light, which is wonderful. Showers are clean and loads of space to put your stuff in. 
 Breakfast is pretty good though on my last day they were missing eggs. The location is close to the bus station but bit far from the main attractions.

name: Anonymous
comment: Lovely hostel , stay and best location. I definitely recommend this hostel to Dublin visitors.

name: taradunphyy
comment:
Had a lovely night in the city thanks to Jacobs Inn. The staff were so helpful. Recommend going on the organised pub crawl. Even though I'm from Ireland I had never experienced a proper Dublin night out, it goes through temple bar, lively crowd, drink deals and activities. 
 Very clean facilities, overall would recommended to anyone who wants a few nights in the big smoke.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bad Value for money because the room was quite expensive for the size. Futhermore the room was on the opposite site of the railway station. Therefore it was pretty noisy.

name: Anonymous
comment: A hostel with a rooftop balcony do I need to say more

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel very close to bus station--very professionally run. Would stay there again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Stayed there two nights. Very well looked after looks very modern and tidy. Loved the rooftop terrace/smoking area. Handy storage lockers under the bed. Friendly staff no trouble or anything with other occupants. Will definitely recommend it and if in Dublin again will stay here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good experience here. A hostel with everything you need located in a good location. The free breakfast they offer is wonderful with various nice choices.

name: mollymalott16
comment: No complaints! Good location, good atmosphere, professional, friendly. Would definitely stay again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Great place to stay. Super reasonable price. But we did end up getting put in different rooms, as they try to keep groups together. Bathrooms are just fine, the free breakfast is simple but good. The staff is super friendly. There's a coffee shop right at the reception and you'll get 50c off - pretty cool! All in all - great place!

name: Anonymous
comment: An amazing hostel, just about a 10 minute walk from the city center. I absolutely loved the freebies you get with the booking. Each bunk bed has its own power socket which was pretty neat. Most other hostels I've stayed in have been dead in the city center. This was very close, yet a lil further away -- which meant nights were peaceful without noisy streets! A positive experience overall.

name: annekat
comment:
A great hostel to stay in, but so large it lacks the sort of atmosphere where you can easily talk fellow guests in a common area. 
 Very clean and comfortable enough beds. Pillow was a but small, but livable. The train is nearby and you can hear it rattle past, but it's not unbearably loud. 
 Breakfast was simple, but good and offered for a long time period.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great location, lovely building, clean. Hostel was so large (also a lot of large groups) that you did not really meet many fellow travellers

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed in a 12 bed female room. The bed and blanket were comfortable and the blackout curtains and personal USB charging ports were very convenient! As were the locker spaces under the beds. The bathroom inside the room was OK. It could have stood to be a bit cleaner. The shower needs to be pushed on every 10 seconds which was fine. The Hostel itself was nice. Comfortable shared spaces, good breakfast, nice staff.

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel was amazing, everything was clean and neat breakfast was great and if you wanted to you could cook dinner in their massive kitchen.

name: Anonymous
comment: Super location. Great common areas and kitchen... Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were adequate, especially with each bed having its own light and power socket. The only let down was the bathrooms, which were a little dated and greasy. As for everything else.... superb.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn is a great spot. It was much bigger than I expected - the kitchen and dining room are huge! I stayed in a 12-bed female dorm. The vibe was pretty good (definitely do the pub crawl!) and the rooms were clean. The kitchen was an added bonus but a bit confusing. Security was great - you have to carry a pass, which can get annoying, but at night they always stop and check it. The location was okay. About a 10/15-minute walk to the action of Dame Street.

name: itzmewolfman
comment: Great facilities an entertainment. Well furnished big hostel. Big crate lockers for bags. Dorms are nice, breakfast is great. Used by everyone, not so many backpackers

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel, although the 4share rooms need more power socket, the 16 share is amazing with charging station with every bed. The staffs are awesome, super friendly and helpful, a big shout-out to the lovely Aussie lady name Martina at reception and the 2 guys who tried to help me booked the last-minute tour to the Cliffs when I missed mine due to hangover üòÇüòÇ

name: Anonymous
comment: Very clean and very safe.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very good hostel ! Everything is nice and good !

name: Anonymous
comment: Amazing hostel! Loved the room setup and great security - lowest rating is location but even with location it isn't a problem, it's just a few minute walk to the spire!

name: Anonymous
comment:
It was great, stayed in a 12 room.
 Plenty of room and privacy.
 My friend's personal belongings were moved out of his bed though, really bad form and a gaggle of young Spanish guys were a-yip-yapping all morning. 
 The hostel can't control who stays in the room or whether or not they behave themselves.
 
 Staff, location and facilities all great.

name: Anonymous
comment: Friendly, helpful staff and very clean, modern facilities. The free breakfast was decent and the beds were super comfortable (those modern pod-style beds with outlets and curtains and USB ports). The common areas were spacious, comfortable, and clean. They had an all-day "cafe" and we were allowed to bring in alcohol and outside food. I'll definitely stay here again next time I'm in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment: We had a great stay at this hostel. I would definitely recommend it.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's Inn was my first experience in a hostel and it was solid. It felt very secure as it required key card access to get into most areas and rooms and rooms had lockers that fit my huge suitcase. The showers were hot and decently clean. Would recommend.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very clean. A small walk from the center (about 10-15 minutes). Got a private room, pretty reasonable on the weekdays but not on the weekends. Saw a lot of teenage groups traveling through. Very big hostel. Staff was helpful.

name: Anonymous
comment: Liars. Will do everything to get a few more Euros. Beware

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel! I enjoyed my stay. Much better than Isaacs. Friendly staff, clean rooms, nice terrace.

name: cedricdu78
comment: huge hostel close to the bus station and the spire of Dublin , very safe i was a bit upset because i have to change my room and my booking was to the same place anyway its was during the high season , i recommmended this hostel to everyone

name: Anonymous
comment: The staff is excellent and welcoming. The rooms are large. I like the en-suite toilet but preferred to shower in the designated rooms. I wouldn't mind coffee a little earlier as most tours start at 0700 and nothing is open yet. The facilities are large and it is easy to store your bags before you check in, do laundry, work in the common areas or relax. WiFi is strong. I'll definitely be staying there next year!

name: Anonymous
comment: Excellent secruity. Very good location which was in walking distance from the main street and buses. It's a shame that cigarette smoke pours into room 101 every evening from the smokers down below. Beds were comfortable and the privacy curtains were useful. Helpful staff. Would stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice hostel, not a party hostel, wish i had chose something closer to Temple Bar area but I booked this before I came to Europe. Also I'm not sure if it would be different at another hostel in Dublin but as two young women we did not feel safe walking around any of the surrounding streets of this hostel after 11 at night, but that might be a thing anywhere in Dublin. Good experience though for people who want a quiet place and not staying out late to sight see

name: Anonymous
comment:
My first nights sleep on the Friday was the worst sleep I have in years, I know this is not your fault but being in a room were nearly everyone snored was impossible to sleep in. I don't mind light snoring but this person could have risen the Titanic.
 
 2nd and 3rd nights were completely fine.
 
 I think it would help if you put a box on your booking form "Do You Snore?" or "Are you a light sleeper?" at least you would give people the opportunity

name: Anonymous
comment: Wish I'd of stayed here all 3 nights! Stayed before highly recommended always busy but near the centre and the bus and train and tram stops

name: Anonymous
comment: Really nice hostel. Great location right by the train bus dart and luas station. All the beds have curtains, outlets, USB ports, and your own light. They have a really great kitchen and a decent free breakfast. The guy who checked me in was ok but wasn't super helpful but most of the staff were. The key cards sometimes stop working which was a little annoying but overall one of my best hostel experiences.

name: Anonymous
comment: We stayed here our very first night in Dublin and loved it. With not ever experiencing a hostel before and this being the first one, it did not disappoint. Very clean, nice/helpful staff, incredibly secure, and the best breakfast. Their coffee and tea is to die for! We also have to thank Jacobs Inn for allowing us to store some of our camping supplies while we traveled throughout the rest of Ireland. So convenient! I would recommend this a thousand times over to anyone!

name: Anonymous
comment: This is one of the best hostels!! We loved everything about it.

name: Anonymous
comment: Honestly the best hostel I've stayed in this far!! The front desk was extremely helpful and undeniably friendly. Had a wonderful experience at Jac. Inn :)

name: Anonymous
comment: Great staff, lots of space to lock up your stuff, good shower facilities. Mostly clean throughout. Location isn't bad, but a little bit of a walk to main parts of the action in the city.

name: Anonymous
comment: good location, renovated and clean, friendly and helpful staff

name: Anonymous
comment: It's hard to say something bad about this hostel, they just have whatever you need. The kitchen is gigantic and there's a rooftop terrace perfect for meeting people at night. The night shift staff is not really nice though.

name: Anonymous
comment: Amazing hostel - very clean, great staff, and privacy curtains on bunks are a nice touch. The only thing I didn't like was the location. It's a bit out of the way so I didn't feel safe walking alone at night. It's very close to the train and bus station though which is great for early morning departures.

name: Anonymous
comment: I stayed in a 10 bed female room. The bed and blanket were comfortable and the blackout curtains and personal USB charging ports were very convenient! As were the locker spaces under the beds. The bathroom inside the room was OK. It could have stood to be a bit cleaner. The shower needs to be pushed on every 10 seconds which was fine. The Hostel itself was nice. Comfortable shared spaces, good breakfast, nice staff.

name: Seoulkat
comment:
I stayed here, and was amazed at how close it was to the bus station! The daytime staff were also really nice and helpful, and the beds are comfortable and have curtains√©private USB ports and plugs for charging. THere are underbed lockup areas for your things. 
 
 That being said, the night staff were very rude, and as I left very early in the morning, I forgot my watch there- I e-mailed to inquire if it had been found in the room, and there was no reply at all.

name: Anonymous
comment: Great reception team. So helpful. Really nice facilities and living spaces. I loved how the rooms had curtains on the beds and power points to each bed space. It's a big hostel, so it is busy. And the location is okay - a short 15 min walk to Temple Bar/Trinity college etc. Great hostel, had a nice time here!

name: Anonymous
comment: This place has mastered the art of serving their guests!

name: Anonymous
comment: Out of the 10 hostels I stayed at in Europe over my trip, this was the best of them all. Very clean, ample places to sit and hangout, big kitchen, good wifi, and my favorite of all was that they had little curtains on your bed for when you went to bed at night. They also have a roof terrace which was cool, could go up there and drink and have a cigarette. Solid place.

name: Anonymous
comment: Only downside was that it was really far from everything.

name: WaywardCloud
comment: Great!! Electric outlet right by beds. Lamps by bed too. Privacy curtains on beds. Bathrooms were good too. Wifi seemed fast. Security lockers were cage system under beds.

name: Anonymous
comment: Nice but kind of sterile. So many layers of security; definitely safe but frustrating if you need to go in and out. Kitchen is fantastic and staff are lovely. Had a bit of trouble with a dirty bed, but staff were helpful.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good location, very close to the bus station and only 20-30 minute walk to city center. Love the curtains on the beds, gives so much privacy. Also liked the USB charging port so I didn't have to buy a new converter. And free breakfast. Would definitely stay again.

name: Anonymous
comment: We stayed in a en-suit private room. It was clean, they only thing we weren't happy with was the lack on sockets. Just one for the whole room -for three people- plus shaver socket. Clearly insuficient.

name: Anonymous
comment: First off this hostel is HUGE, over 400 beds. But there wasn't much socialization unfortunately. Security is very good, perhaps a bit over the top... a lot of doors to pass through. Staff are friendly and helpful. Location is close to Talbot street/the Spire on the north side of the river, still pretty close to Temple Bar. I didn't think it was sketchy like many others but I am from America so our idea is different :) Push button 5 second showers are REALLY annoying and unnecessary, please stop.

name: Anonymous
comment: I think the idea of this hostel is GREAT, but some things were lacking. The people at the front desk were VERY unhelpful, even when my key didn't work (they didn't believe me, just figured I didn't know how to use a key card), the door on my room was broken (remained so throughout my stay), and my luggage was lost (would tell me what the airline had said on the phone - just told me to come down to check periodically. When it came, the new person at the desk gave it to me w/o checking tag or ID)

name: Anonymous
comment: Really cool hostel, friendly staff, great facilities and a really nice layout of the whole place. Recommended.

name: Anonymous
comment: Brilliant location, just outside the main bus station. Modern and functional building with all the right amenities (bedside lamp and 2 sockets? Check!), and staff who are refreshingly caring for a hostel this size

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacob's Inn was a great hostel - excellent location, clean, friendly staff, great kitchen facilities. Every morning they have a free walking tour which is the best way to see the city, and our guide was amazing, and as a solo traveller this was also a fun and easy way to meet new people.

name: Anonymous
comment:
It's a great place to stay for the price! Quite clean, many spaces to hang out in. They check security pretty tightly.
 I was looking for a more social hostel, but I didn't get the chance to go on the pub crawl - I didn't get to talk to my roommates and people didn't seem particularly keen on socializing.
 
 Overall, good experience.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good stay. Staff was awesome. A bit of a walk to all the restaurants and pubs. Beds were good but very low-- but loved the privacy curtain!

name: Anonymous
comment:
Great place to stay, great location, clean, great staff.
 
 The breakfast was basically toast and cereal. Towels are extra.
 
 There was a couple large groups of 10-13 year olds staying at the hostel which was nice to see but I felt like I was an adult stuck in a middle school. Also, when they were in the dinning room it got very crowded and the atmosphere was very different from what I expect and enjoy at a hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: Big hostel. Well run. Very organised. Be aware that kids/school groups appear to stay there. So breakfast can be hectic.

name: Anonymous
comment: A pretty great hostel, probably one of the best I have stayed at. At 5am in the morning when I was scared my bag would be too heavy the front desk staff helped my weight my bag in kilos, and was super cool about it. The individual bathrooms could take some cleaning but overall very good experience. I was pretty worried about being able to get my beauty sleepy before my super early flight to Athens but everyone was super respectful even if they went or what not.

name: Anonymous
comment: Bathrooms and hallways need some TLC but the bunk beds were nice, especially with the chargers in them. 12 people sharing one bathroom is tough and the location is far away. Lobby, breakfast and staff were all amazing, just fix the bathrooms and hallways and it would be perfect.

name: Anonymous
comment: This place is great! It's definitely worth it. The beds are comfortable and the staff is super friendly and helpful. The staff is always making sure the facilities is clean as well. My only complaint is that the room can get a bit stuffy and that doesn't help at the end of the day when people have stinky feet. I had a 12 bed mixed room and it worked out well.

name: Anonymous
comment: Solid choice

name: Anonymous
comment: Everything was good. The staff was friendly but in a rush (a lot of people in this hostel). The matters was not good.

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn was a great place to stay. The room was large and comfortable, the staff were really helpful and the kitchen facilties were great.

name: Anonymous
comment: Hostel was in a decent location (bit of a walk to some places but not bad overall), rooms were clean and spacious. Staff didn't give too much information about the place but were nice overall. Solid security which is always nice. Other than that, nothing over the top in a good or bad way.

name: hailey5620
comment: Very big place, lots of noise

name: Anonymous
comment: A very good hostel in a Decent location, the atmosphere is lacking a bit

name: danrezende
comment: Very good place, staff and facilities bit the shower doesn't allow you to regulate the temperature and for the 2 days I stayed there the water was boiling!

name: Anonymous
comment: There are not enough words to describe how much I loved this place. The staff was the best of the many hostels I've been to. They were attentive, knowledgeable and so sweet. Loved it here.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel. Privacy curtains are a nice touch. Would probably stay again

name: Anonymous
comment: This was a great hostel to stay at! Friendly staff, clean, good value, and very close to the bus station. The free breakfast was nice and they allowed me to store my luggage after checkout while I explored that morning. Definitely recommend and would happily stay there again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Convenient location. Near Airlink drop off, Central Bus station and Busaras tram, easy walking to all the main sights. Stayed in 6 bed mixed ensuite dorm, clean, good amount of space, good bunks sturdy so don't worry about disturbing person above/below, privacy curtain, 2 USB charge points, individual light and plug socket. Relatively quiet for a hostel. Good mix of ages. Nice breakfast was included, cereals, tinned fruit and bread/toast. Staff helpful.

name: outsider83
comment: Sometimes the ''chill-out'' area can be silent. I blame the travellers, not the staff

name: Anonymous
comment: I've been traveling for about a month and this might be my favorite hostel of the trip. The ensuite bathroom didn't seem to be cleaned often, and the location is just ever so slightly seedy, but those are the only downsides. As sometime traveling alone, I thought the atmosphere was great, staff was super helpful, and I felt very comfortable while there.

name: Anonymous
comment: while most of the facilities are nice, I really didn't like that the lockers were cages that could easily be seen through. Despite being locked my stuff still felt vulnerable. There was a bathroom in my mixed dorm but it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while and there was no way to dry your hands, no paper towels or hand dryer. It's not the hostels fault, but I had a really creepy guy flash me after being in the hostel for a very short time. I felt unsafe and left after two nights.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really enjoyed my stay! Only thing is that it's a bit of a trek from a lot of attractions

name: Anonymous
comment: Literally the only issue I had was that the fixtures were separating from the wall in the bathroom which could cause mold. The place itself and the staff were awesome and would definitely stay again

name: Anonymous
comment: Unfortunately, my stay did not allow me to have full access to Jacob's Inn. I have every intention of booking with Jacob's Inn the next time I am in Dublin.

name: Anonymous
comment:
Very cooperative staff. 
 Entire team is well aligned with our requirements & hence we are very much satisfied although it was our first visit.

name: Anonymous
comment: This hostel was great. The staff were friendly and super helpful, the dorms and bathrooms were spacious and very clean, and I liked having a USB port on my bunk so I didn't have to worry about having the correct converter for the outlets. The hostel was within 2 min. walking distance from the bus station, and in a quiet location but not too far from all the excitement of Dublin (also within a 5-10 min. walking distance). The free walking tours were great too! I would definitely stay here again.

name: Anonymous
comment: All very clean and comfy. Nice breakfast included. It's located outside the busiest/noisiest area but just a 15-mins walk from the main attractions. Definitely recommend!

name: Anonymous
comment: The highlights of this hotel are the breakfast (they say its light but it even includes granola and nutella), the security (you'll hate the amount of times you have to swipe your room card) and the social area. The rooms are a bit old and the bathroom definitely needs some care. The beds with curtain are really nice, although the only cover one side of your bed. Overall I do recommend this place. Be careful about weekends, the price per bed skyrockets.

name: odonnellbrandon
comment: Awesome place to stay. Each bed has usb plugs and a light, also a curtain that keeps the bunks somewhat private. Security protocols are great and the hostel has a rooftop terrace. Great option if you're staying in Dublin

name: Anonymous
comment: The location was great, right by the bus station. Breakfast was simple but nice. A very good place to stay, I would go again. But it would be nice to have soap/hand dryers in the bathrooms. Nice kitchen to work in.

name: Anonymous
comment: This was quite possibly one of the nicest hostels I have ever stayed in. The beds each had their own outlets, lights, and curtains. The staff were helpful and assisted me in getting a ride to the airport and printing out my boarding pass.

name: Anonymous
comment: This was my first hostel stay and the service was top notch. Unfortunately the residents were a bit rowdier that I would have liked and that impeded my good nights rest. A great hostel however if you're of a younger age and out partying for a good portion of the evening.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very nice hostel, a bit expensive, but it is Dublin! The security is maybe a bit too much (using your passcard four time before reaching your room), but they have a very big an amazing kitchen, very nice rooms and a cool small terrace on the roof. They are close from everything you need and I overall enjoyed my stay.

name: Anonymous
comment: Friendly staff, everything clean, lots of space, comfy beds (the only ones I found in Irish hostels), great location. Maybe the best hostel I stayed in my whole 2 month trip.

name: Anonymous
comment: A pretty good, out-of-the-way hostel, located north of the Liffey river. Facilities are excellent and the bathrooms were clean. The main downside to this place is that it was located near the bus station in a somewhat iffy party of town. A bit pricier than the other places around, but worth it if you care about standards.

name: Anonymous
comment: The hostel is good, clean, accessible, and safe. I just had a bad stay because I didn't know that I'd be staying with three other people with strong body odor. üòï Couldn't open the window because it was loud outside and inside was stinky! But that's on me not the hostel.

name: aarya123
comment: Lots of school kids here

name: Anonymous
comment: Great staff around the clock. Clean sheets, sturdy beds (with privacy curtain and huge locker) and large bathrooms. Conveniently located across the street from Central Bus Station (Busaras), which has the 747 Direct Airlink bus to the airport in 25 minutes (as well as connections to the rest of Ireland). I am traveling alone, an older female, and felt very safe here. Thank you particularly to the very responsive and helpful late evening staff, as I arrived very late in the night.

name: Anonymous
comment:
A large hostel, noisy, breakfast is a scrum as not enough room when lots of students are staying. Staff seem busy but not particularly helpful.
 Booked a twin room en suite and for two females one with a sprained ankle, being offered bunk beds was not on.
 Returned to reception to request a twin bedded room this was done with not a lot of grace!!

name: Anonymous
comment: Very secure place, which is good when you're carrying a laptop, tablet and a bunch of important stuff to work while traveling. The plug and phone charger points on each bunk bed are great! Internet in the rooms is also good. The roof terrace is nice too.

name: Anonymous
comment: Really good hostel for your money. Walking tour was good. Staff were very helpful. Good free breakfast.

name: Anonymous
comment: Very clean and secure, as you need to use your card to access every part of the hostel

name: Anonymous
comment: nice hostel about a 20 minute walk to Temple Bar. Great clean rooms and bathrooms and a well organized hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: There aren't many positives about my stay at Jacob's Inn. It's in kind of a dodgy part of town (didn't feel great walking there at night by myself) and a good walk to any of the sights. The staff usually seems either unable or unwilling to answer questions, or do much of anything really. The beds were flimsy and uncomfortable, and despite everything written here, my room (a 4-bed mixed dorm) did not have privacy curtains or individual plugs. Really the only pro I can think of is the good wifi.

name: Anonymous
comment: Relatively central location, lockers underneath beds in the rooms which is always good, as well as curtains around the bed and individual charging plugs/ lights. Dorm room located next to the railway line, and police department so noisy at night. Not much atmosphere, almost too many people staying there to be a able to meet people easily, especially school groups. Good ratio of toilets/showers to people.

name: nique_gts5040
comment: Very nice experience! I will return there!

name: Anonymous
comment: *cancelled reservation*

name: Anonymous
comment: Great hostel. Everything is nice and new and super-clean. Decent bathrooms and a good breakfast.

name: Anonymous
comment:
We stayed at Jacob's Inn for 3 nights in a private 3 bedded room- 2adults and one child aged 11. 
 We had a very good stay, and would comeback again. The room had good space. The bed was ok, the breakfast was modest, as expected. The atmosphere ok. There was noise at night. Location is great.

name: Anonymous
comment: Good hostel overall. A bit big so there's not much of a community feel - there are also tons of large groups (high school, etc.).

name: Anonymous
comment: Really good hostel, the security was great and there is even proper luggage storage if you arrive before check in or if you have to check out but have a later flight. I found it to be a very clean place to stay, it seems like there was always someone cleaning which was nice. Location is pretty close to everything, just within walking distance of main spots. Staff was friendly and the atmosphere was good, the free breakfast was a great bonus too.

name: Anonymous
comment:
I stayed in 10 beds female dorm room. Each bed has the curtain, plug and light. The location is perfect for me just near the bus station, 3 mins by foot, 10-15minutes walk to o'connor street. Some of the people were chatting really loud during the night time at around 21:30 to 23:30. The quality of sound-proofing of the bedroom door is not good.
 All in all, recommend this hostel.

name: Anonymous
comment: I really enjoyed my stay at Jacobs Inn. I liked that they had curtains you could pull for a bit of privacy on your bunk and that they had USB ports. The breakfast was good and all the facilities were clean. Overall it was probably the nicest hostel I stayed in during my travels!

name: Anonymous
comment: I LOVED staying here! Out of the 3 weeks I stayed in Ireland, this was definitely one of my favorite! Everything is classy, high tech, user friendly, and safe. The location is fantastic and so is the staff. I would most definately stay here again!

name: Anonymous
comment: Jacobs Inn was incredibly safe, they have lockers for you and cages if you get there early and need to store your stuff. I had been traveling all night and arrived before check in, and the staff at the front desk were nice enough to let me check in early. The rooms were very clean and there are curtains to close off the beds so that they feel more private. The bathroom was clean and there is also a communal bathroom (per gender) down the hall with more bathrooms and showers which was really nice
